loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 50 years old and is married to Felomino, a farmer in the village. Marilyn is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has had this business for four years and earns about PHP 5,000 per hog every disposing season. Her ambition in life is to improve the status of living for her family. Now, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs in order to increase her sales at disposing time. Hopefully, it will provide her a great help.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Maura Estela

texts.es:
La Señora Maura Estela posee un negocio de venta de comida, ropa y cosmético  en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia. 

La Señora se traslada de su casa de habitación a las 3:30 am. Abre su negocio a las 4:00 am  inicia a preparar los deliciosos platillos y finaliza a las 3:00 pm. Sus principales clientes son  comerciantes del mercado, además la Señora Vende ropa y cosméticos, esta labor la realiza con ayuda de sus cuatro hijas.   

El  crédito que esta solicitando a Ceprodel será utilizado para compra de Arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, pollo, carne de res, ropa  y cosméticos  para así ofrecerle a su clientela una variedad de productos de mejor calidad para satisfacer la demanda por lo que tendría más ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Maura Estela has a business selling food, clothing and cosmetics at one of the city markets in León. She carries out this work in order to provide for her family. She leaves her home at 3:30 a.m. to open her business at 4 a.m. to start preparing delicious dishes that she serves until 3 p.m. Her main customers are the market merchants. She also sells clothing and cosmetics, which she does with the help of her four children. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, chicken, meat, clothing and cosmetics so she can offer her customers a variety of high-quality products to meet demand. In this way she will have more income to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, chicken, meat, clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza del Socorro es comerciante de uno de los Mercados de la ciudad de León, abre su negocio a las 6 am. Para realizar la venta de hielo y bolsas plásticas a las además comerciante en especial a las que vende marisco, posteriormente se dedica a  la recuperación de cartera de la venta de electrodoméstico que realiza al crédito y finalizan a las 4 pm.
 Viaja a la ciudad de Managua una vez por semana a comprar  su producto. Ella es madre de seis  hijos mayores de edad de los cuales ni uno está a su cargo,  Inicio su negocio vendiendo ropa ambulante.

El crédito que solicita a Ceprodel lo utilizara para la compra de nuevos productos tales  como televisor y equipo de sonidos sombrías grandes la cual son utilizadas por las comerciantes.

Los sueños de la señora es lograr concluir con las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en: Esperanza is a merchant at one of the city markets in León. She opens her business at 6 a.m. to sell ice and plastic bags to the merchants who sell seafood, and later on she sells household appliances on credit before she finishes up at 4 p.m. She travels to the city of Managua once a week to purchase her merchandise. She is a mother of six children, all grown up and independent. She started her business selling clothes on the street. She is requesting the loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel to purchase new products such as televisions and sound equipment that can be used by the merchants. Her dream is to finish making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase televisions and sound equipment.

loans.name: Andrea Justina

texts.es:
La señora Andrea Justina  es  propietaria de un negocio de venta de ropa donde oferta diferentes tipos de productos como mosquiteros, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, colchas. Su día de trabajo empieza muy temprano, ordenando sus productos desde las 8 de la mañana en el puesto que posee en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de León para posteriormente con mucha emoción y energía ofrece sus productos a su fiel clientela.

 Actualmente está solicitando un crédito, el cual invertirá directamente en la compra de ropa interior  para damas, caballeros y niño, mosquiteros, toallas de baño y de manos, colchas. Al obtener dicho crédito espera incremetar el  margen de ganancias y  surtir su negocio de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida propia y la de su familia.

La señora Andrea está muy agradecida con nuestra institucion ya que le ha ayudado a crecer en su negocio y poder salir adelante con su familia brindándole una mejor educación y formación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Andrea Justina owns a business selling clothing and different kinds of products like mosquito nets, undergarments for men and women, and bedspreads. Her workday starts very early. She sets up her merchandise at 8 a.m. at a sales post in one of the city markets of León, and she later offers those items with a lot of energy and emotion to her faithful customers. She is requesting the loan to purchase undergarments for men, women and children, mosquito nets, bath towels, and bedspreads. With the loan, she hopes to expand her profit margins and stock her business, and in this way improve the quality of life for herself and her family. Andrea is very grateful to Kiva partner Ceprodel, since it has helped her grow her business and make headway for her family, allowing her to provide her children with a better education.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, mosquito nets, towels and bedspeads.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu is 45 years old. He is married with fourteen children, eight of whom are adopted. They live in Masindi, Uganda.

For thirty years, Adamu has been a farmer and, with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for the children and buy more land to farm on. Just like most farmers in a developing world, he lacks skilled manpower and must deal with price fluctuation. These challenges notwithstanding, he hopes to educate his children up to the university level and hire employees to help modernize his farming activities.

Adamu is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Segunda

texts.en:
This is Segunda. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 13,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Segunda dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give a good future to her children through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of mineral water needed in her business.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Mrs. Sarantuya is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a Ger (a traditional Mongolian home) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband, Bat-Ochir, is 47 years old. He is agrarian. Her oldest daughter, Anhbolor, is 21 years old. Her youngest daughter, Oyuntungalag, is 17 years old. Her son, Otgonbayar, is 11 years old. They study at college and secondary school. Mrs. Sarantuya started a taxi service business in 2008 and she and her husband also grow vegetables in their 1 hectare garden. They harvest around 15 tons of vegetables per year. She and her husband sell their vegetables in the market. She is a clever and hardworking woman. She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to purchase seeds and other necessary things for year's plantation.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and other necessary things for this year's plantation

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Marivic is 21 years old, and has three children. She is married to Almax. To supplement her spouse's income, she is selling dimsum and other food products as snacks to the people in her village. She had been doing this for three years. She is now asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy hot dogs, fish balls and bananas to cook and sell. She would like offer more delicious foods to increase her income, too. Someday, giving a good education to her children will be her greatest achievement in life.

loans.use: to buy hot dogs, fish balls and bananas to cook and sell

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
This is Minerva. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used for upgrades and repairs to the cars that she sells. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan for upgrades and repairs to the cars that she sells. His profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Minerva dreams of expanding her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for upgrades and repairs to the cars that she sells

loans.name: Cristopher

texts.en: Christopher is an industrious man who sells bananaque (a banana-based snack), hotdogs and glutinous rice desserts to the people in his village. His mother cooks these snacks, and he sells them for profits. He would like to keep selling good products so he is now asking additional capital of PHP 5,000 to buy bananas and hot dogs to sell. In the future, Christopher would like to keep making the business grow, earn a stable income, and help improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bananas and hot dogs to sell

loans.name: Mertha Sedana Group

texts.en:
The Mertha Sedana Group continues to borrow loans to increase their business. They now have 2,500,000 IDR per member. On the day of the photograph, one of the members couldn't attend because of illness and is represented by her husband.

Ni Ketut--head of the group--will use this loan to purchase three piglets and their feed. She hopes that, from the pig business, she will be able to build a new kitchen.

loans.use: To buy three piglets and food for them.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
This is Melinda. She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Melinda hopes to expand her business, she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Hung

texts.en: Hung is requesting a new loan to buy good quality ingredients to cook crab noodle soup to sell. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food stall, increasing sales, and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality ingredients to cook crab noodle soup to sell.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials. Huong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy sewing tools, sewing equipment and materials.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
This is Cresilda: 36, resident of Payatas, Philippines. She is a mother and is married to Santiago. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while running the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Cresilda sells bedding and mattresses. She makes and manufactures the bedding and mattresses, with the help of her husband. Customers buy their products because they're cheaper than those in the mall. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, Cresilda is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy foam, cloth, plastic, rugby and other materials to expand her product inventory. She expects an income boost as she expands her business. Cresilda hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her children a good, quality education.

She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. It is a place where she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for foam, cloth, plastic, rugby and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
This is Corazon. She previously accessed a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 45,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The loan will also be used in her canteen in buying more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Corazon hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is requesting a new loan to buy shampoo, cosmetics, and nail polish to serve her customers. Van's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, cosmetics, and nail polish to serve her customers.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu is requesting a new loan to buy shampoos, cosmetics, nail polish and materials. Thu's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, cosmetics, nail polish and materials.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz 40 años convive con su pareja Víctor, con quien trajo al mundo a dos lindas hijas: kelly de 19 años y la pequeña Nallely de 4 añitos. Este hogar habita actualmente en una casa hecha de material noble que la pareja hizo con mucho esfuerzo. Desde hace 20 años Beatriz tiene consigo a su cargo un negocio de frutas que ella impulso debido a una época en que la familia no pasaba por un buen momento económico. Así es como en un paradero de transporte interprovincial de la cuidad optó por establecerse junto a otras vendedoras con las cuales llegaron hasta hoy, formar un grupo sólido dedicados al rubro. Con el apoyo de su esposo quien a su vez impulsa una pequeña tienda de golosinas, Beatriz puede desempeñar su actividad sin inconvenientes ya que él es quien ayuda a cargar los sacos de frutas frescas que llegan por parte de sus proveedores. A su vez comenta que le agrada mucho su trabajo ya que siente la satisfacción de ofrecer los mejores productos de la zona a los viajeros y visitantes quienes  muy agradecidos por la calidad la felicitan también por su buen trato. 
En la actualidad Beatriz tiene pensado realizar el tarrajeo de su casa  para así poder en todo caso alquilarlo o sacarle algún provecho. Con su préstamo número 03 se siente agradecida una vez mas por la confianza  brindada y se compromete a ser cumplida como siempre , agradece también a sus compañeros de su banco comunal quienes son personas muy educadas y motivadoras.
Con los 2,000 realizara el tarrajeo de su casa, pues ya esta planeando la contrata de los maestros y comprar materiales para el mismo ,  el dinero que reste lo invertirá en su negocio de frutas.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 40, lives with her partner, Victor, with whom she has brought two lovely daughters into the world:  Kelly, 19, and little Nallely, 4.  She currently lives in a house made of good material that the couple built with a lot of hard work.  For 20 years, Beatriz has had a fruit business, which she started when the family was going through a bad economic time.  This is how she decided to establish her business at an interprovincial transport stop with other businesswomen.  They have formed a solid group dedicated to their work.  With the help of her husband, who has a small candy store, she can perform her work without problems, since it is Victor who helps her carry the sacks of fresh fruit that arrive from their vendors.  She is very happy with her job since she is satisfied with offering the best products in the area to travelers and visitors who are very thankful for the quality, and they also congratulate her on her good service.

Currently, Beatriz is thinking about plastering the walls of her home to be able to rent it out to get some benefit out of it.  This is her third loan, and she is thankful once again for the confidence given to her.  She promises to make her payments like always.  She is also thankful to the other members of her communal bank, who are very educated and motivating people.

She will use the 2,000 PEN to plaster the walls of her home.  She is planning on hiring the workers and buying the materials.  She will invest the rest of her money in her fruit business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her home and fruits to stock her business.

loans.name: Londra Moncerrate

texts.es: Londra tiene46 años estado civil casada ,tiene 1 hijo .Ella cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de desempleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró. Pues fue ahí entonces que decidió vender  todo lo referente a cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar .perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc.
texts.en: Londra is 46 years old, married, and has one son. She says that she started this activity because of the lack of employment that exists in the country. She wanted to find work but did not find it. It was then that she decided to sell everything related to cosmetics, and it has gone well for her. She works in the afternoon to offer the products for her neighbors. With the loan she wants to buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorants, and talcum powder.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorants, talcum powder, etc.

loans.name: Gudilia

texts.es: Gudilia de 33 años, es soltera y madre de dos menores : Katherine y Antonio ambos con 11 y 5 años de edad respectivamente , juntos conforman un hogar. Hace poco le dieron la titulaciónd e su propiedad a base de madera. Como toda madre impulsadora de su familia, ella optó desde hace 10 años en enfrentar a la vida logrando establecer a puro esfuerzo propio su negocio de frutas que se convertiría en adelante en un buen sustento para su familia ,laborando sola y teniendo siempre el mejor apoyo que existe por parte de sus hijos. Por otro lado, tiene en mente aperturar  una tienda dedicada a la venta de abarrotes, pues considera que es momento de crecer y que mejor oportunidad para hacer realidad su objetivo. Lleva consigo 03 créditos que ha usado para invertirlos, dándole la posibilidad no solo cumplir sus cuotas con total puntualidad sino también el lograr obtener buenos resultados de su inversión , a su vez también agradece  a su banco comunal por la manera como viene trabajando. Con los 2,000 soles otorgados iniciará su negocio de abarrotes en donde realizará la compra de algunos víveres, cereales y frutas cumpliendo así uno de sus objetivos a corto plazo.
texts.en: Gudilia is 33 and is the single mother of two children:  Katherine, 11, and Antonio, 5.  Together they form their family.  A short time ago, she was given the title to her property, which is made out of wood.  As the driven mother of the family, she decided 10 years ago to face life and established a fruit business through purely her own efforts.  She would make it into a good souce of income for her family, working alone and having the best support possible from her children.  On the other hand, she is thinking about opening a store dedicated to selling groceries,.  She thinks that it is time to grow and to have the best opportunity to reach her goal.  She has had 3 loans, which she has invested.  She has made all of her payments on time and also achieved good results from her investments.  She is also thankful to her communal bank for the way that it works.  She will use the 2,000 PEN to start her grocery business.  She will buy supplies, cereals, and fruits to fulfill her short-term goals.

loans.use: to buy supplies, cereals, and candy.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en: During the six years she has operated her retail shop business, Magdalena has experienced success. However, there are factors contributing to downturns in her business. Aside from low income, she also rarely experiences lack of capitalization. With this situation, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase cup noodles, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking ingredients, sugar, cooking oil, milk and detergent soap for her grocery store. She hopes that with this loan she will be able to enlarge the store, offer more services to her customers and earn a higher income to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase cup noodles, soft drinks, biscuits, canned goods, cooking ingredients, sugar, cooking oil, milk and detergent soap.

loans.name: Phelogona

texts.en: Phelogona is grateful for the support she is getting from Yehu and Kiva. Since the previous loan, she says that her business has grown and she hopes that it will continue to grow. Phelogona is a hardworking person who always struggles to succeed in life. Now that her business is producing good results, she has decided to expand it to earn more profits. With the loan she is requesting she plans to purchase more bales of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
This is Bienvenida. She previously accessed an 14,000 PHP loan that she used to buy herbal medicines and food supplements to sell. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 16,000 PHP loan for her to buy more herbal medicines and food supplements that she will sell to her customers. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Bienvenida hopes to expand soon, she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of herbal supplies and products needed in her business

loans.name: Tung

texts.en: Tung is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products such as shampoos, shower-gel and tooth-paste to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of basic goods to stock his general store

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan to buy shampoos, cosmetics and soft drinks, to serve her customers. Huong's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy shampoos, cosmetics, and soft drinks to serve customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Batbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Batbaatar is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in an apartment in Arhangai province, Mongolia. His wife, Tserenchimeg, is 37 years old. She works as an accountant in a private company. His daughter, Munhjin, is 6 years old. His son, Temujin, is 1 year old. They go to kindergarten. Mr. Batbaatar is planning to open a dental clinic. His profession is dentistry. He worked as a dentist in Japan for 10 years. He is a hardworking and responsible man. He is asking for 4,000,000 MNT to buy an X-ray machine and raw materials for artificial teeth for his business.

loans.use: to buy an X-ray machine and raw materials for artificial teeth for his business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en: Hang is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food to serve her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food to serve her customers

loans.name: Clemente

texts.es:
Clemente de 43 años un gran hombre y padre de sus 3 hijas, junto a su pareja Isabel dieron mucho de si para brindarles lo que hasta hoy han logrado que es inculcarles los valores y principios de superación. Uno de sus logros reflejados es el haber culminado la construcción de su casa. Hábil en el campo automotriz se desempeña como mecánico desde hace 15 años, inicialmente como empleado el cual le valió para ganar experiencia y confianza. Actualmente posee su propio taller con el apoyo administrativo de su pareja. 
Desde que se inicio fue muy perseverante en su trabajo llegando incluso a no desprenderse de sus labores hasta culminarlas. Esto le permitió conocer amistades los cuales serian en adelante sus futuros clientes  con quienes trabaja hasta hoy y le permiten hacer de su negocio su mejor herramienta para el progreso.
Dentro de sus prioridades planea adquirir mayor cantidad de repuestos para desempeñar sus labores con fluidez, debido a que el campo automotriz va en aumento así como su clientela. De esta manera seguirá trabajando para lograr que su negocio siga creciendo para hacer posible, solo administrarlo en el futuro según cuenta entusiasmado. Este es su crédito número 16 y como siempre agradece por confianza que MFP le brindó desde un inicio invirtiéndolo con seguridad, comenta también que le da gusto trabajar de codo a codo con sus compañeros de su banco comunal ya que también los ve  progresar.
Los 2,000 soles los destinará a la compra de repuestos para vehículos con el fin de tener su taller bien abastecido.
texts.en: Clemente is 43 years old and has three daughters. He and his wife, Isabel, have given their all to provide their children with the values and principles to move up in life. One of those achievements is reflected by having completed the construction of their home. Skilled in the automotive field, Clemente has made a living as a mechanic for the past 15 years. He started out as an employee, which helped him gain valuable experience and confidence. He currently has his own shop, which his wife helps administer. Since he started, he has been very persistent with his work and never let up until the job was done. This allowed him to make friends, who became future customers he has worked with ever since, and made his business the biggest tool he has to make progress. One of his priorities is to acquire more spare parts in order to carry out his work more fluidly, since his clientele is increasing. In this way he will keep working so his business will be able to keep growing, and he will run it with the same enthusiasm in the future. This is his 16th loan, and as always he is grateful for the confidence Kiva partner MFP has put in him since he started investing in his business. He also says that he likes working with his fellow members of his community bank because he can see the progress. He plans to use the loan to purchase parts so he can keep his shop well supplied.

loans.use: to purchase auto parts.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Jepun Sari Group

texts.en:
Like many Balinese women, Ni Ketut and the other members of the Jepun Sari group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes. Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Ketut hopes that, through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.

Ni Ketut will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With her profits, she will help support her family by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer. Ultimately, Ni Ketut hopes that increased income will enable her to purchase more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en: Virgincita is 55 years old, married, and a resident of Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City, Philippines. She has 11 children. She has managed a gardening business as her source of income for 2 years. Every month, she earns PHP 4,000 from this activity. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,500 from GDMPC to purchase fertilizers. Virgincita hopes to expand the business, buy a motorcycle to easily move the goods in the marketplace, and obtain more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en: Ana Marie is a married woman from Baclayon, Bohol. She has been in the lumber business for almost one year. She earns 8,000 PHP a month by working the lumber business. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchased more wood like coconut. On the other hand, Ana Marie is also engaged in a food vending business and she plans to buy more meat and vegetables. In the future, Ana Marie would like to expand her business to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy wood for her lumber business and to buy meat and vegetables for food vending.

loans.name: Piling Subur Group

texts.en:
The Piling Subur Group is formed from information received by Ni Ketut, who received it from a friend who had already joined the group of pig farmers assisted by MUK. Ni Ketut and her friends form a group to get a loan from MUK and training; so that they could keep pigs properly and in a manner consistent with the standards.

The loan will be used to purchase piglets, renovate the barn and buy feed. Most members of the group still keep pigs in the traditional way so they do not get the maximum results. By joining MUK's pig program, they expect to be able to increase their knowledge and the results obtained will be maximal.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, renovate the barn and buy feed.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 28 years old, married, and has 2 children. She is from Masabud, Clarin and has been in farming for six years, earning an amount of 7,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Maribel joined GDMPC. Maribel is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar, 24, is a young mother of two children. She is a hard-working wife and mother who owns and manages an accessories stand. She has been operating this business for four years and she aims to lift their standard of living through her started source of income.

She is determined to work hard because her husband can not help her to financially support their family, due to an unexpected motorcycle accident that happened to him. But life must go on, Maricar said. To continue her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 as additional capital. It will be used to buy more accessories, and stock up on plastic and kitchenwares to re-sell. She believes that through this loan she will increase her product offerings and satisfy her customers' needs. She hopes that in the future she will make the business a viable source of income, to save for the future of her two children.

loans.use: to buy more accessories, and stock up on plastic and kitchenwares to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy eggs, plantains and yams.

loans.name: La Flor Del Cafe Group

texts.es:
Don Jose, tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 6 hijos, y vive en una comunidad rural del municipio de nueva frontera, Santa Bárbara. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura, tiene aproximadamente 30 años de tener sus propios cultivos de café, maíz y frijoles. Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. El quiere tener una finca grande y mejorar la producción para tener un crecimiento económico.
Actualmente quiere darle mantenimiento a sus terrenos para continuar trabajando y ha decidido formar un grupo que se llama La flor del café y está formado por cuatro personas que en la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta don Jose, le sigue Ángel de camisa roja, luego esta Josue y a la derecha esta Isrrael, todos viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican  a la agricultura y el préstamo grupal es por 21,000 Lempiras, el préstamo lo utilizaran para comprar fertilizantes y abonos para darle un mejor mantenimiento  a los terrenos y lograr sacar mejores cosechas.
texts.en:
Jose, 52, has 6 children and lives in a rural community in the municipality of Nueva Frontera, in the department of Santa Barbara.  Jose has worked in agriculture all of his life.  He's been growing his own coffee, corn and bean crops for about 30 years.  He sells his crops in the local market.  He wants to have a big farm and improve his production so that he can have economic growth.

At this time, Jose wants to maintain his land so that he can keep on working.  He decided to form a communal bank called "La Flor del Cafe."  This group has 4 members who are identified in the photo as follows:  at the left is Jose, beside him in the red shirt is Angel, next is Josue, and at the far right is Isrrael.  They all live in the same community and are all farmers.  This group loan is for 21,000 Honduran lempiras.  They will use this loan to buy fertilizers and manure to maintain their land so that they can obtain better harvests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure to maintain the farms where they grow coffee, corn and beans

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn is 36 years old and married with two school-aged children. She has a bakery shop where she sells variety breads in the community. Marilyn has had this business for almost two years and she earns approximately PHP 5,000 monthly. She is requesting a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase flour, margarine, sugar, salt, and oil. She hopes that through the loan, she will acquire more customers and gain more income. In the future, Marilyn hopes that her business will improve to support the needs of her family, especially the educational needs of her two children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, margarine, sugar, salt, and oil

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra  de 41 años de edad, es la propietaria de una sala de bellezas que está ubicada en su domicilio, la cual inició desde hace 10 años, atendiendo a la inclinación que desarrolló desde muy joven, por la cosmética y la estética y que posteriormente tradujo en lo que es hoy un negocio, donde ofrece servicios de mejoramiento de la imagen personal, a través de cortes de cabello, masajes, peinados, pedicure y manicure. Inicialmente cuando empezó su actividad, lo hizo para apoyar los gastos de su hogar, pues hasta ese momento se encontraban a cargo de su esposo. Poco a poco su negocio ha crecido y hoy apoya mas el bienestar de su familia y además de sus vecinos, tiene como clientes a referidos por estos, a quienes dirige todos sus esfuerzos de mejoramiento, para fidelizarlos, porque son la razón de ser de su negocio. Sandra trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche diariamente y sin descanso, y allí también asesora en imagen y vende productos cosméticos, accesorios femeninos, perfumería entre otros asociados a su negocio. Ella se siente muy satisfecha con su actividad y estimulada, porque está bien ubicada cerca a un boulevard de gran concurrencia en el sur de la ciudad, por donde transitan muchas personas que ya la identifican, pero va a trasladarse a un lugar independiente de su vivienda, donde tenga mas sosiego familiar . El crecimiento de su negocio es evidente y cada vez mas siente que su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responde a su expectativa de crecimiento y a su misma demanda. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará tintes,  alicer, plancha, pintura de uñas, cosméticos y accesorios encargados por sus clientes para continuar el camino al éxito y con su credikiva aprovechará para tenerlo organizado en su otro local donde sabe que se moverá mucho comercialmente.
texts.en:
Sandra, 41, is the owner of a beauty salon located in her home that she opened 10 years ago, given her inclination from a very young age for cosmetics and beauty.  Later this translated into what today is a business where she offers services for improving the personal image through haircuts, massages, hairstyling, pedicure, and manicure.  When she first began her activity, she did it to help with the household expenses, but up to then they were her husband's responsibility.

Little by little her business has grown and today she supports the well-being of her family as well as of her neighbors.  Her customers are referred by them, for whom she devotes all her efforts to improve, so she can cultivate their loyalty because they are the reason for her business.  Sandra works from 8 in the morning until 7 at night every day without resting.  She also does image consulting and sells cosmetics, women's accessories, perfume, and other things associated with her business.

She feels very satisfied with and stimulated by her job because it's well located near a very busy boulevard in the southern part of the city where a lot of people go by who know her.  She's going to move to a place away from her house, though, so she'll have more quiet at home.  The growth of her business is clear, and more and more she feels that her working capital is not enough to respond to her expectations for growth and to her own demand.

This is why she's getting a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She'll buy dyes, straightener, an iron, nail polish, cosmetics, and accessories ordered by her customers so she can continue on the road to success.  She'll make the most of her Kiva loan to have everything organized in her other place, where she knows she'll sell a lot.

loans.use: to buy dyes, straighteners, an iron, nail polish, cosmetics, and accessories

loans.name: Emilita

texts.en: Emilita, 47, is married and resides in Calabayan, Ozamis City.  Emilita owns and operates a business venture, making and selling a variety of baked goods in the local community. Emilita has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns 5,300 PHP a month. Emilita is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make baked goods to sell. She became a member of GDMPC in 2011. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make baked goods to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann, 26, is married and has two children. She lives in Guba, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Mary Ann has managed a gardening business for nine years, earning a monthly income of PHP 4,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional fertilizer. Mary Ann been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Mary Ann hopes to improve her business so that she can support her children better.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer.

loans.name: Sedana Ayu Group

texts.en:
For housewives in Bali, it has become commonplace to have pigs at home. This is to support the family's income, in addition to the husband's income. Apart from the farming business, other things that could help meet the needs of daily life is raising livestock, especially pigs. In development there are several obstacles being faced in developing a business, such as limited knowledge of business management, as well as limited access to capital. To overcome this problem they decided to join into one group so it's easier to communicate among members of the group and can more easily get funding.

Ni Nengah, 37, is head of the Sedana Ayu group that runs a pig breeding business. To increase their business, Ni Nengah invited group members to participate in loan programs for small businesses from MUK. This loan will be use to buy superior piglets and the rest to buy feed. In five months, the pigs ready for sale. The advantage gained from this effort will be used entirely to support the families' economy and to renovate the barn.

loans.use: to buy superior piglets and to buy feed.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 49 year old who engaged herself in a hog fattening business. She currently has two hogs to care for and she wants to make them healthier and nourished to generate higher income. Therefore, she is seeking a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy vitamins, medicine and two sacks of feed. The loan will surely help her in making her hogs fat. Sometimes her family really suffers financial problems but, through their strong determination, they can survive. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further grow her business.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, medicine and two sacks of feed.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en: Jonah, 36, is married and has one child. She is a responsible housewife who owns and manages a variety store in her community to help her husband by generating income. She and her husband aim to become successful and financially stable so that they will educate their child and give him a better life. She wants to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demands. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of 50,000.00 PHP to buy grocery items, charcoal, rice, feeds and vegetables for sale. Through patience and hard work, she believes that her business will continuously grow and become a viable source of income. She hopes that someday, she will achieve her goals as she continues to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, charcoal, rice, feeds and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.en: Raymunda, 48, is married, has five children and is from Baclayon, Bohol. The oldest child is 28. She has been in the retail business for three years. She sells children's accessories like pouches, fashion watches, necklaces, key holders, hair knots, stickers and toys. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional children's accessories like head bands, hair pins, fashion bags and fashion sunglasses. Aside from her children's accessories business, she also operates a small grocery store and sells merchandise like canned goods, noodles, sugar and soap. In the future, Raymunda would like to expand her business to support her family and also send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy children's accessories and groceries.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios, 63, is married, has three children and resides in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City.  To make a living, she makes and sells food. She has been engaged in her business for eight years and earns about 6,000 PHP a month. In 2011, she joined GDMPC. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 4,500 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make food products for sale.

loans.name: Michaela

texts.en:
Michaela is a 31-year-old, married woman with three children who is living in Macupa, Tangub City. Her husband is a farmer. In order to add income in the family, she entered into a business of buying and selling bananas 10 years ago. She usually gets 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. 

With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Michaela is able to buy additional bananas to sell because of the money amounting to 7,000 PHP rendered to her. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue for a business expansion.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes for a clothes selling business.

loans.name: Susana Gregoria

texts.es: Susana tiene 26 años estado civil soltera tiene hijos.  Cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de desempleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró y también por su edad. Pues fue ahí entonces que decidió vender todo lo referente a cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc.
texts.en: Susana is 26 years old, single and has children. She started this activity because of the unemployment that is prevalent in the country; she wanted to find a job, but couldn't. So she decided to sell all kinds of cosmetics, and it has gone very well. She works in the afternoons and offers her products to her neighbors. With the loan, she wants to purchase perfumes, creams, colognes, deodorants, powders, etc.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, creams, colognes, deodorants, powders, etc.

loans.name: Tupatane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Buta, leader du collectif d’affaire «Tupatane », est jeune entrepreneur, âgée de 28 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants. Son mari est un enseignant dans une école normale. Elle est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises au petit marché de Ndosho. Il y a 3 ans révolus, elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus.  Elle démarra ses affaires avec le crédit de base de l’IMF Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser  5 cycles dans le projet de microcrédit  de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 sac de farine de maniocs, 50 kg de farines de maïs, 50 kg de riz, etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et agrandir son entreprise. La cliente salut l’initiative de Hekima pour l’autonomisation de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en:
Our client, Buta, leader of the business group "Tupatane", is a 28-year-old entrepreneur.  She is married and the mother of four children.  Her husband teaches at a teachers' college.

Buta sells food products, displaying her merchandise at the small Ndosho market.  She has been involved in this type of income-generating activities for the past three years.  

Buta started her business with an initial loan that she took with the microfinance institution Hekima, and she has concluded five loan cycles within Hekima's microcredit program.  She will use this new loan to buy two bags of cassava flour, 50 kg of maize flour, 50 kg of rice etc.  She also hopes to see her children grow, and she wants to expand her business.

Buta praises the initiative taken by Hekima to empower low-income women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy two bags of cassava flour, 50 kg of maize flour, 50 kg of rice etc.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Sarin, aged 29 years old, and his wife, Sovann, 31 years old, live in Phnom Penh's suburbs. They have been married since 2005 and have one young child who attends primary school.

Sarin is a construction worker, while his wife is a garment worker. He is applying for a loan of $700 to purchase one cow to raise. He will get extra income from selling the cow for beef, or from the sale of calves when the cow has a baby.

loans.use: to buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 43 years old, married and has three children. She is from Labuyo, Tangub City. 

Roselyn owns and operates a sari-sari store (general store), selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo and toothpaste, etc. in the local community. She been in this business for seven years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2001, Roselyn joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps etc. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps etc to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rim is a widow with five sons and one daughter. Four of her children are married and live outside the family home, and the other two children assist their mother with farming. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Rin a weaver, and when farming season comes around, she also operates her farming business. She is now asking for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to continue her farming business by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her farm.

loans.name: Avelia

texts.en:
Avelia is 47, married and has two school-age children. Her ambition in life is to improve her family's status of living, educate her children and give them a better life. 

As one way of generating income, she offers a boarding house or bed spacer to students who are away from their home. She plans to improve and expand the boarding house to make it comfortable to all boarders. 

Due to high cost of commodities, she can not afford to buy all the materials that are required. Therefore, she is asking for an additional capital of P50,000.00 to buy the materials needed, and pay the labor costs to repair her boarding house. She believes that this financial assistance will make it possible for her plans to work out, and she hopes that someday she will increase her boarders, and make more improvements to make her boarders live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy materials needed and pay the labor costs to repair her boarding house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy used sweaters for selling in her sweater-selling business.

loans.name: Hedy

texts.en:
Hedy is from Labuyo, Tangub City. She is 64 years old, and is a widow with four children. 

To make a living, Hedy owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products. Hedy has been engaged in her business for six years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

Hedy joined GDMPC in 2009. Hedy is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell in her shop. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Gladys Esther

texts.es: Gladys de 54 años de edad vive en el municipio de Puerto Colombia, lugar paradisiaco ubicado a orillas del Mar caribe, donde tiene su negocio de venta de mercancía como ropa, cosméticos, accesorios, cremas y perfumes, que vende entre familiares, amigos, del mismo municipio. Gladys conforma una familia con  sus 3 hijos en las edades de 22 a 36 años y su esposo que también trabaja. Para ella promocionar y vender, representa una tarea que la mantiene activa  y le permite obtener algunas utilidades que capitaliza en el mismo negocio, ayudado por su hija menor, quien distribuye los productos y se encarga de las cuentas por cobrar. Su meta es continuar ampliando su negocio y esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual invertirá en mercancías variadas, que llegaron con buenos descuentos en sus catálogos, como cremas perfumes ropa cosméticos y accesorios femenino, con los cuales planea impactar su mercado en este segundo semestre, época en las que sus ventas se incrementan y   estará atenta a tenerle lo mejor a sus clientela,  para que le compren y ella gane cada vez mas dinero. .
texts.en: Gladys is 54 years old and lives in the municipality of Puerto Colombia, a heavenly place located on the Caribbean coast, where she has a business selling merchandise like clothing, cosmetics, accessories, creams and perfumes to friends and relatives in the area. Gladys has three children between the ages of 22 and 36, and her husband also works. Promoting and selling the products is something she is diligent about, and she is helped by her youngest daughter, who distributes the products and is in charge of accounts receivable. Gladys' goal is to continue expanding the business, and it's for this reason she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first from Foundation Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to purchase a variety of merchandise, which she gets at a good discount through her catalogs, like creams, perfumes, clothing, cosmetics and feminine accessories. This will increase her supplies for the time of the season when her sales increase and she will be able to provide a better service to her customers so they make purchase and every time she makes a little more money.

loans.use: to purchase creams, perfumes, clothing, cosmetics, and feminine accessories.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 44 years old and is married with three children. Her husband is a farmer in the community. 

Perlita is engaged in raising pigs. She has had the business for almost six years and she is able to earn approximately PH8,000 per pig. 

She would like to raise all her pigs to be fat and healthy but due to a shortage of capital, she cannot buy vaccine, medicine and feed to ensure their proper growth. So Perlita is asking for a loan of PH9,000 to buy the said necessities. The loan will help Perlita maintain her pig-raising business. In connection to this, she will be able to maintain her family's daily needs and to support her children gain higher levels of education.

loans.use: to buy vaccine, medicine and feed for her pigs, so that they are fat and healthy.

loans.name: Jesus Emilio

texts.es: Jesús, 51 años de edad, casado, padre de tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, originario de León. Él se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos actividad que realiza desde hace 6 años juntos con su hermano, venden en los barrios y comunidades, esta actividad ha resultado bastante rentable para ellos. Está solicitando el crédito para comprar cerdos de desarrollo pues la demanda ha aumentado y no tiene como cubrir los pedidos. Él tiene como meta lograr tener su propia granja de animales donde pueda criar pollo y cerdos de desarrollo. Desea mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir trabajando.
texts.en: Jesús is 51 years old, married, and the father of three grown children. He is originally from León. He and his brother have been buying and selling pigs together for six years. They sell them in different neighborhoods and communities and this work has been rather profitable for them. Jesús is requesting a loan to buy developing pigs because demand has increased and he does not have enough animals to cover his orders. As his goal, he would like to have his own animal farm where he can raise chickens and pigs. He hopes to improve his quality of life and to continue working.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Hok

texts.en:
Hok lives in Phnom Penh. He is 41 years old, and his wife, Sam At, is 41 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have four children - one son and three daughters. Three children are in school and the other child is still young. 

Hok is a construction worker, while his wife is a garment worker. They also grow rice when rice farming season comes. Hok is applying for his first loan in the amount of $600 to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is 46 years of age and has two children - a daughter and a son. 

Kamil sells jewelry. His business is very small, but he is hard-working and wants to increase the prosperity of his business and that of his family. 

This is his second loan from AqroInvest and Kiva. He now needs a loan of 1500 AZN to enable him to buy more jewelry and to open a shop for his business. Kamil is grateful to Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell in his business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She's 45 years old, married and has 5 children. To make a living, Gina has owned and operated a motorcycle transport service for 8 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. Gina is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco es de la comarca la laguna casado con dos hijos a cargo de 15 y 17 años de edad ,  él se dedica a sembrar maíz ,frijol y tomate ,dice que el inicio trabajando con el papa pero a los 23 años que se casó decidió trabajar independiente sembrando maíz ,frijol para esa época casi no se utilizaba insumos y casi todo el trabajo  en sus labores agrícola lo apoyan dos hijos y cuando saca la cosecha  de maíz, frijol y tomate la lleva a vender a Managua pues se vende mejor el grano y el tomate . Hoy francisco necesita este crédito para comprar el abono completo la urea y la semilla de Tomate para hacer una Hortaliza de riego por gravedad a través de una laguna de agua que hay en la comarca .Francisco dice que el crédito le ayudara ya que en este momento le falta dinero para comprar el abono y la urea para aplicárselo al maíz y frijol de postrera.
texts.en:
Francisco is from the Laguna County area.  He is married and has two children in his care, ages 15 and 17.  He grows maize, beans and tomatoes and says he began working with his father, but at age 23 married and decided to work independently.  At that time, he did not use many supplies.  His sons help out with the farming at harvest time.  He takes his produce of maize, beans and tomatoes to sell in Managua, since it gets a better price there.  

Today, Francisco is requesting a loan to buy complete fertilizer, urea and tomato seeds so he can sow a vegetable patch irrigated through gravity with the water in the county.  Francisco says the loan will help because now he does not have the money to buy the fertilizer and urea for the maize and beans.

loans.use: To buy complete fertilizer, urea and tomato seeds.

loans.name: Jessica Jessenia

texts.es: Jessica tiene 20 años estado civil   soltera,  no tiene hijos, Ella comenzó a trabajar desde los 10 años ella comenzó trabajando vendiendo tripita en la calle, en la actualidad ese es su negocio que le genera su sustento de vida. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprarse una carreta
texts.en: Jessica is 20 years old, single and has no children.  She has been working since she was ten years old as a street vendor selling tripe.  Currently, this is how she earns an income to support herself.  The loan will be used to buy a cart.

loans.use: To buy a cart.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela una mujer de 26 años  casada con Alfredo con quien fue posible hacer la llegada de sus mas grandes tesoros Jonathan de 3 años y la pequeña Yeny de 6 meses. Un matrimonio prometedor cuyas vivencias son albergadas en una casa de madera construida en un terreno que les fue cedido por sus padres. Como toda mujer impulsadora vio en el cacao su mejor manera de sacar adelante a su familia desde hace 10 años, es así que con Alfredo quien labora con ella de sol a sol ven sus metas a futuro y saben que será posible solo con esfuerzo y trabajo. Es hasta el momento es una producción rentable debido a la demanda que posee. Dentro de sus plantaciones también posee café, achiote, palillo  entre otros.
Surge comúnmente en esta época del año la necesidad de darle toda la atención posible a los árboles cacaoteros ya que es clave para obtener una producción de final de calidad, adicional a ello tiene planeado expandirlo de tal manera que ocupe una pequeña parcela que adquirió hace poco de un vecino colindante con la finalidad de obtener una mayor ganancia.
Dentro de los requerimientos permanentes esta la compra de almácigos de cacao, abonos naturales así como la contrata de jornaleros quienes gustosos están a su servicio por impartirles un buen trato. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP espera cumplir de manera puntual con sus pagos, se caracteriza por ser muy participativa e inculcar la puntualidad en las reuniones.
Con los 1,500 soles realizará la contrata de jornaleros para el sembrado de almácigos que también comprará conjuntamente con los sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Adela, 26, is married to Alfredo, with whom she has brought into the world the greatest treasures of her life: Jonathan, 3, and little Yeny, six months.  The couple's life experiences are housed in a wooden home built on land given to them by her parents.  Like every other driven woman, she saw in cocoa her best way to  help her family get ahead, which she has been doing for ten years.  She and Alfredo work from sun to sun to meet their goals and they know that it is only possible through effort and hard work.  Up until now, production has been profitable because of demand.  She also grows coffee, annatto, and guava, among others, on her plantation.

Usually during this time of the year much attention must be paid to the cocoa trees, because it is important for the final quality aspect of the crop.  She also wants to expand production on on a small patch of land she bought recently from a neighbor, in order to increase her income.

Among the permanent requirements is the purchase of cocoa plants for transplanting, natural fertilizers and hiring workers who are happy to provide service.  This is her third loan through MFP and she is committed to paying it back on time.  She is very participative and punctual at the group meetings.

The 1,500 PEN will be used to hrie workers to cocoa and also buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: To hire workers and buy sacks or organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Flor Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HATUNCHASKAS,la socia continua con su negocio de hostal,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia se siente feliz con su negocio el cual le brinda satisfaciones tanto economicas como personales ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de un par de camas y sabanas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank HATUNCHASKAS.  She continues with her hostel business, which she has been in for several years, and which is doing well thanks to her daily hard work.  She is happy with her business activity because it gives her much satisfaction, both economic and personal.  She is a responsible, enterprising person who provides for her family in this way.

The member is requesting a loan to buy two beds and sheets for her business.  She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy two beds and sheets for her business.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia, 38 años de edad, madre soltera, es una humilde campesina la cual no tuvo estudios, pero se dedica a la siembra desde muy pequeña actividad quien le enseño su papa. Es habitante de la comarca San Jerónimo en las afueras de Teustepe, tiene dos hijos los cuales le ayudan a ella en los procesos de siembra de maíz y frijol. Cuando la época de siembra es baja viaja a Costa Rica a cortar café. Está necesitando el crédito para comprar ½ manzana de Tierra pues desea ampliar sus áreas de siembra y dejar de alquilar tierra y tener lo propio donde puede seguir adelante junto con sus hijos.
texts.en: Antonia, 38, is a single mother and a humble farmer without an education.  She has ben growing crops since she was very little and learned the trade from her father.  She lives in San Jerónimo County outside Teustepe.  Her two children help with the planting of the maize and bean crops.  When the planting season is low, she goes to Costa Rica to cut coffee.  She is in need of a loan to buy a patch of land to expand her farming and stop renting land.  This is to have her own property so she can get ahead together with her children.

loans.use: To buy a patch of land.

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат погасив свой кредит в срок  в том же месяце решила получить  очередной кредит.   После предыдущего кредита у неё намного улучшились условия проживания семьи.    Теперь планирует на полученный кредит сделать ремонт своего  двора и покрасить стены дома. Она благодарна, что имеет возможность осуществить планы семьи с помощью кредитов.   Со слов Рохат видно, что она не ощущает трудностей в погашении, так как  имеет ежемесячную зарплату с кондитерского цеха, где она работает продавцом.Заранее благодарит.
texts.en:
Having repaid her previous loan on time, Rohat decided to apply for another loan that same month.  Her previous loan greatly helped her to improve her family's living conditions.

With her newly received loan, Rohat is planning to repair her yard and to paint the walls of her house.  She is thankful for the opportunity given to her, through these loans, to realize her family's projects.

From Rohat's words, it is clear that she has no repayment difficulty since she makes a monthly income from the pastry shop where she works as a salesperson.  She thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase paints to repaint her house.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 28 years old, married, and blessed with a three-year-old child. He practices dairy farming, a business he ventured into three years ago, and he earns a monthly income of about KES 6,000. 

He has requested a fourth loan of KES 52,500 to purchase animal feeds for his cows and sheep. The anticipated profit will be used to improve the  productivity of the breeds. 

He dreams of being a renowned farmer in his area of residence.

loans.use: To purchase feeds for the animals.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is married, 48 years of age, and lives in Panay Diot, Clarin, together with her kid. Eva is operating a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than 9 years and she earns about 3,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She joined GDMPC this year. Eva wishes that their business would be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima resides in a rental house in the suburban area of Kisauni, Mombasa city. She is married to Kombo, a businessman, and together they have 8 children, four of whom are grown, married and independent, while the other four are in school. For the last 15 years, Halima has been involved in food vending, selling from her home. She sells a variety of foodstuffs like dumplings, flat breads, fried potatoes, etc. She dreams of owning a hotel in the future and wants to provide a quality life to her children. She will use the loan to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder, raw potatoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wheat flour, cooking oil, baking powder, raw potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en: Marvie is a married woman with two children, ages four and two years old. She hails from Baclayon, Bohol. She has been in the hog raising business for two years. She earns about three thousand five hundred pesos a month by tending her hog raising business. She plans to use the loan to buy an additional piglet and feeds. In the future, Marvie would like to expand her business in order to support her family and to finance the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet and feed.

loans.name: Maica Joy

texts.en:
Maica Joy lives in Dalapang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children. To make a living, she has been cultivating coconuts for sale for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, she joined GDMPC. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to pay labor costs for farm maintenance. Maica Joy plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies and for her children's tuition.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for farm maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy animals for her business.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en: Melita is 46 years old, married, and a mother of 6 children. She lives in Panay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last 12 years by selling home and used products. She makes about PHP 4,000 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She joined GDMPC in 2010 as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en: Dominic is a responsible mother of six. Her husband Ruben earns an income through farming while she is raising pigs.The income from farming is not easily acquired so she started her own source of income.  Now, Dominic requests a loan of PHP 9,000 which she plans to use to purchase feeds and vitamins to make her pigs healthier. Someday, Dominic hopes to send all her children to school so they can earn a degree and look for a good job.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Parsaloi

texts.en:
Parsaloi is 34 years old, married, and supports a family of five people. He has been a maize farmer for the last six years, earning a monthly income of about KES 28,000. 

He is servicing his loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD which he intends to use to purchase farm supplies.

The anticipated profits will be used to diversify into sheep keeping. His future dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Amado

texts.en: Amado is married to Corona and blessed with four children. They are living a simple life in the village. Amado cares for piglets as a source of income. Aside from raising pigs, he also manages their small farmland. He wants to make a bigger income in his piggery business, thus he wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy medicine and feed for his pigs. This has been a great help in improving his income and in providing the needs of his family and the education of their children.

loans.use: to buy medicine and feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Amable y alegre Olga de 34 años convive con su novio Rogelio su pareja de siempre y a punto de casarse. Juntos habitan en un hogar prospero donde fue posible la llegada de sus dos menores Roger y Yetziluz de 13 y 16 años respectivamente. Uno de sus objetivos es concretar a futuro su casa de material noble debido a que  poseen una propiedad donde levantaron una casa de adobe. Desempeña su negocio de abarrotes que logro habilitar en un ambiente acogedor de su casa desde hace 7 años, desde ya sus menores hijos ayudan en diversas actividades. Una de las cosas el cual la motivo a desempeñarse como bodeguera fue el deseo de estar en casa Con sus hijos. Aunque dentro de su lista de clientes posee personas que no le cancelan a tiempo las cuentas que ella otorga por amistad, perjudicándola  en ocasiones, a pesar de ello a tenido cierto éxito por el cual tiene que implementarse con variedad de productos, para así, ser como siempre, la favorita de su barrio. A propósito del deseo de ampliar su negocio, también iniciar la construcción de su vivienda con material noble y siente que cada vez es posible. Este es el crédito número 13, muy agradecida confía poder cumplir con sus cuotas. Se caracteriza por ser una persona muy  solidaria en su banco comunal para con sus compañeros
Con los 1,000 soles comprará productos cuya variedad no se hallan en su negocio así como otros de constante demanda dentro de los cuales esta el azúcar, arroz, conservas entre otros.
texts.en:
Olga is kind and cheerful and 34 years old. She lives with her boyfriend Rogelio, her long time partner whom she is about to marry. They live together in a comfortable home with their children Roger and Yetziluz who are 13 and 16, respectively. One of her objectives is to re-build her house out of brick, since they put up and adobe house on some property they own. She runs her small grocery store that she has able to set up in an appealing space in her house 7 years ago. Her children help her in different activities. one of the things that motivated her to work as a shop owner was wanting to be at home with her children. On her list of customers are people who don't pay on time after she extends them credit out of friendship. This hurts her at times, but despite that she has had a certain success and so she has to stock up on a variety of products so that she can continue to be, as she has always been, the neighborhood favorite. She wants to expand her business and also start to build her house out of brick and she feels that it is possible. This is loan number 13. She is very grateful and confident she can make her payments. She is described as a very supportive person in her communal bank by the other members.

With the 1,000 soles, she will buy products that her business doesn't have and others that are in constant demand. Among these are sugar, rice, perserves and more.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and different kinds of preserves.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of seven young children from San Jose, Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. Marissa has been engaged in the hog-raising business for more than ten years now.
