Marissa works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of her children. She will use the loan to buy feed and additional piglets to raise.

In the future, Marissa hopes to expand her business to augment her income for the family's needs and expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 45-year-old retail shop proprietor in Mombasa. He is married to Flora,who is a farmer.  Together they are blessed with three children aged 22, 12 and four years respectively. He has been doing this business for the past seven years with great success.

This is Peter’s second business loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powder for his shop. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and to gradually expand his shop. He hopes to see his family successful in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powder

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Due to lack of job opportunities, Imelda runs a variety store in their community to supplement her husband's income. She is 44 years old and was blessed with three children.

She and her husband agreed to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn degrees and becomes professionals someday. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, they need to increase their income to pay for necessities and finance the education of their children. For this reason, Imelda aims to improve her variety store to increase her income. 

She is asking for additional capital of P20,000 to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles, soaps, candies, eggs, seasonings and soft drinks to sell. She believes that this loan will help her to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. She hopes that someday her business will grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, noodles, soaps, candies, eggs, seasonings and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy cooking oils, snacks, toffee, etc., in larger quantity.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos de 33 años un padre soltero a cargo de sus dos menores hijos Emilia de 1 año y Carlos de 12 años, se desempeña con esmero pensando en sus dos motivos más grandes. Posee una casa de madera adquirida hace poco.
Se desempeña como productor de cacao en sus parcelas adquiridas hace 7 años que fue posible gracias a un préstamo otorgado por sus padres quienes también fueron un gran apoyo  con la crianza de sus hijos.
Considera su trabajo como muy entretenido ya que le agrada dirigir y también ser partícipe de las actividades ya sean el mantenimiento y la cosecha. Aunque en ocasiones ha tenido que lidiar con algunas plagas que aquejan sus parcelas perjudicando su producción de manera considerable. Considera muy rentable su trabajo debido a la cantidad de cacao que suele producir en cada temporada, eso es parte de las cosas que lo motivan aun más.
Dentro de las cosas que planea priorizar finalizada la temporada y a puerta del inicio de la misma es de adquirir almácigos abonos orgánicos y herramientas con las cuales desempeñar sus actividades sin inconvenientes.
Para con sus planes a futuro piensa adquirir un terreno en la ciudad donde realizará la construcción de una vivienda para que así sus hijos puedan desempeñar estudios superiores. Este es su tercer préstamo con el cual agradece desde ya la confianza brindada y  piensa corresponder con su cumplimiento así como en ocasiones anteriores. Comenta que le agrada su trabajo con su banco comunal ya que sus compañeros siempre lo escuchan.
Con los 3,000 soles realizará la compra de plantas de almácigo así como sacos de abono orgánico, desde ya también otorgará el adelanto a los jornaleros quien conjuntamente con el desarrollaran las actividades requeridas.
texts.en:
Carlos is 33 years old. He is single father raising two minor children: Emilia who is 1, and Carlos, who is 12. He works hard, thinking of his two big motivations. He owns a wooden house he acquired a short time ago.

He works as a cacao grower on the land he acquired 7 years ago thanks to a loan from his parents who have also been a big help with raising his children.  

He considers his work to be very interesting since he likes to lead and participate in the activities, whether they be maintenance or harvesting. Sometimes he has had to deal with some pests that disturb his land, damaging his production considerably. He considers his work to be very profitable because of the quantity of cacao he usually produces every season. This is part of what motivates him even more. 

Among the things he plans on prioritizing the finalizing of the season and beginning the new one. To do this he has to acquire seedlings, organic fertilizer and tools to do his work with no problems. In the future, he plans on building a home so that his children can get a good education.  
This is his third loan and he is thankful for the trust put in him and he plans on paying it off as he did on previous occasions. He remarks that he likes working with his communal bank since the other members always listen to him.

WIth the 3,000 soles, he will buy seedlng plants as well as sacks of organic fertilizer. He will also pay the laborers who with him will start the work that is needed.

loans.use: to buy seedling plants and sacks of fertilizer and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HATUNCHASKAS,la socia continua con su negocio de confeccion de ropa,la socia confecciona ropa deportiva para sus clientes que mas le solicitan,la socia lleva años eneste negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de tela al por mayor para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank HATUNCHASKAS. The member continues with her clothes manufacturing business. The member makes sportswear for her clients who order most from her. She has made a living in this activity for years and it is going well thanks to the hard work she puts in to her business every day. The member is a responsible and hard working person who in this way get her family ahead.

The member is requesting a loan to buy fabrics wholesale for her business.

The member feels grateful for the loan provided and is committed to making her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy fabrics wholesale for her sportswear manufacturing business.

loans.name: Leonor Catalina

texts.es: Leonor tiene 30 años estado civil casada, tiene 2 hijos .Leonor comenta que a causa de la falta de empleo que posee el país y no podía encontrar un trabajo fijo, tomo  el rumbo de ser una comerciante mas del país. Pero uno de sus mayores impedimentos es la  falta de capital, pues lo que  ella vende  es  ropa pero eso no la impedido salir adelante, ya que levanta a las 6:00am y comienza su recorrido a dejar mercadería a sus clientes. Con el préstamo Cecilia va a comprar: abrigos, blusas, pantalones, camisetas  vestidos etc.
texts.en: Leonor is 30years old. She is married and has 2 children. Leonor says that due to the lack of employment in her country she couldn't find a regular job, so she decided to become one more merchant in the country. One of her biggest obstacles is a lack of capital. What she sells is clothes. To get ahead, she gets up at 6:00 a.m. and starts her rounds. leaving merchandise with her customers. With the loan, Cecilia is going to buy coats, blouses, pants, t-shirts, dresses and more.

loans.use: to buy coats, blouses, pants, t-shorts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Adouni Kaossarath Laï

texts.fr: Célibataire sans enfant, Kaossarath est âgée de 30ans. Spécialisée dans la distribution des produits de beauté depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes dans l'un des marchés de l'extérieur. Dans le but d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la forte demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse compte tenu de la bonne qualité de ses produits, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev. Le bénéfice généré par ce crédit lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et d'acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en: Unmarried and without children, Kaossarath is a 30 year old woman. She has been a specialist in the distribution and sale of beauty products for the past few years, and stocks up on merchandise from wholesalers in markets. In order to increase her sales and satisfy the growing demand from her customers due to the good quality of her products, she is asking for a loan from Finadev. The profits from this loan will enable her to purchase larger quantities of products.

loans.use: purchase two cartons of body milk, one box of beauty cream and five lots of clothespins

loans.name: Guillermo Enmanuel

texts.es: Guillermo tiene 27 años estado civil soltero, no tiene hijos. Guillermo lleva aproximadamente 7 años vendiendo periódico el cuenta que por la falta de empleo que existe en el país tuvo que ponerse su propio negocio de venta de periódicos. Con el préstamo él quiere ponerse otro negocio para tener más ingresos
texts.en: Guillermo is 27 years old. He is single and does not have any children. Guillermo has sold newspapers for the past 7 years. He tells us that due to the high level of unemployment that exists in the country he had to set up his own newspaper selling business. With this loan he wants to set up another business in order to have more income.

loans.use: to set up another business in order to have more income

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.fr: La cliente Musoka, leader du collectif de crédit «Mapatano », est entrepreneur, âgée de 40 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un Evangéliste Pasteur dans une église locale de la pentecôte. Elle est sociétaire d’un atelier de couture installé dans le quartier Ndosho.  Il y a 8 ans révolus, elle a ouvert cette entreprise. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 10 cycles dans le projet de microcrédit  Hekima. Elle démarra avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec quelques matériels de couture (15 mètres de tissus, files, dentelles, mordorés, modelage, ciseaux, etc.). En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et accroître son entreprise. La cliente salut l’initiative de Hekima pour l’autonomisation de pauvres femmes non bancables.
texts.en: Musoka, the leader of the group loan Mapatano, is a 40 year old entpreneur. She is married and the mother of 6 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is an evangelical pastor in a local church. She is the owner of a sewing studio in the Ndsoho neighborhood, which she opened 8 years ago. Since then, she has asked for and obtained 10 microfinance loans from Hekima. She opened the business using proper cash from her husband. She is asking for a new loan in order to purchase sewing materials (15 meters of cloth, threads, lace, thimbles, scissors, etc). She would also like to see her children take over and grow her business in the future. Musoka greatly appreciates Hekima for enabling poor, unbanked women to being independent.

loans.use: purchase sewing materials (15 meters of cloth, threads, lace, thimbles, scissors, etc.)

loans.name: Gladys Amparo

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 34 años, se considera una persona estricta, responsable , con muchos deseos de superación personal y familiar. Gladys vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Ibarra.

Gladys se dedica a la crianza de animales como cerdos y cuyes, está en este negocio tres años, ella empezó con un chanchito reproductor, actualmente tiene 5 chanchos reproductores, Gladys con el desep de seguir adelante y mejorar la raza de sus chanchos necesita un crédito para que pueda invertir en la compra de 10 crías de cerdos rosados y también para la compra de balanceado para su alimentación, inversión que le permitirá mejorar sus ventas e ingresos que le ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Gladys sueña en tener un criadero de cerdos grandes, para poder convertirse en una distribuidora a las empresas grandes y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos y darles una buena educación.
texts.en:
Gladys is 34 years old. She feels she is a strict, responsible person with a great desire to exceed herself personally and in her family. Gladys lives with her husband and their three children in the city of Ibarra.

Gladys makes a living raising animals such as pigs and guinea pigs. She has carried out this activity for three years. She started with a mothering sow and now has five. Gladys hopes to continue getting ahead and improving the breed of her pigs. She needs a loan in order to invest in buying 10 pink pig piglets and also to buy animal feed for them. This investment will allow her to improve her sales and income which will help her to improve her family's quality of life.

Gladys dreams of having a large pig farm and becoming a distributor to large companies and so improve her children's quality of life and give them a good education.

loans.use: to buy 10 'pink pig' piglets and also to buy animal feed for them.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  Danaya sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Madame Kadia fait le commerce de condiments et d’habits dans ce groupe de femmes, elle est debout  au milieu.
Elle compte acheter avec mon  prêt,  5 douzaines de  complets d’habits pour enfants auprès des grossistes de Sikasso. Elle effectue ses ventes à domicile et au marché à une clientèle composée généralement  de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 27.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et l’intérêt, l’autre servira de dépôt d’ épargne .
texts.en: The five members of the Danaya group are all married women, on average 40 years old, with on average 5 children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in Hamdallaye, one of the poorer neighborhoods in the city of Sikasso. They are asking for their third loan from Soro Yiriwaso, in order to satisfy customer requests. Mrs Kadia sells condiments and clothing, and is the middle person in the above photo. She will use the loan to purchase 5 dozen complete outfits for children, and will purchase these from wholesalers in Sikasso. She sells both from her hom and from the market, in cash, to a customer base mostly comprised of women. She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 27,500 FCFA (~55 USD), and will use part of this to pay the interest on her loan and the other part will be deposited into a savings account.

loans.use: purchasing children's clothing

loans.name: Edgardo Isaac

texts.es:
Edgardo, es un joven de 25 años, casado, padre de familia, su hijo es aun pequeño tiene 3 años de edad, habita en la comunidad Las Banderas, en las afueras de Teustepe. Se dedica a vender piedras canteras (Piedras para construir casa, muros, paredes). Él trabaja en este oficio desde los 15 años de edad cuando iba en el camión de su papa a vender. Hoy en día trabaja independiente con un camión que le alquilan, el cual utiliza para transportar y vender piedras, tiene 2 ayudantes que viajan con el. 
Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar piedra cantera al por mayor. Esto le permitirá tener más inventario para vender más y mejorar los ingresos. Uno de sus anhelos es lograr tener su propio camión y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Edgardo is a young 25 year old who is married and father of a family. His son is still young, only three years old. He lives in the community of 'Las Banderas' on the outskirts of Teustepe. He makes a living selling quarry stones (stones for building houses, walls, fences). He has worked in this activity since he was 15 years old when he used to go in the truck with his father to sell. Nowadays he works alone with a rented truck, which he uses to transport and sell the stones. He has two helpers who travel with him.

He needs a loan in order to buy quarry stones wholesale. This will allow him to have a great stock and sell more and so improve his income. One of his dreams is to have his own truck and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy quarry stones.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “HATUNCHASKAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es cesante del sector público, el socio continua invirtiendo el prestamo en arreglos para su casa ,el socio es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante ,el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su vivienda.
El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar algunos cuadros para su vivienda y para algunos gastos personales.
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "HATUNCHASKAS". This bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member used to work for the public sector, he continues investing the loan in renovating his house. He is responsible, and very determined to get ahead. The loan he is currently requesting is to invest in his home. 

The member requests this loan to buy some pictures for his house and for some personal expenses.
He is happy with the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: to buy some pictures for his house and some personal expenses.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: As a mother, Josephine always sees to it that she meets the needs of her family, especially when it comes to the educational needs of her children. Her dream is for her children to finish their studies and become employed with good jobs and not to experience hardships in life. To provide them a good education, she sells dried fish. This source of income helps her husband. But still, their income is not enough. So she would like to ask for financial assistance in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy more dried fish to sell. She hopes for her loan approval.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a 41 year old married woman and a mother of four children, ages 21, 18, 14 and 11. They live in Getafe, Bohol, Philippines. Marlyn and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for more than 20 years. This is the source of their income.
Marlyn is asking for a loan to buy fishing materials, such as fishing nets, lead weights, buckets, etc. for her husband's fishing ventures.
Thus, her husband will be able to enhance his daily catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market.
Marlyn dreams of making their fishing business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials, such as fishing nets, lead weights, buckets, etc. for the family fishing business.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en: Primitiva is 66 years old, widowed, and has four children. She is from Poblacion 1, Clarin. To make a living, Primitiva owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to the local community. She earns 5,000 PHP a month and has been in this business for 6 years. In 2009, Primitiva joined GDMPC. She is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. In the future, Primitiva plans to renovate their house.

loans.use: to purchase new items, such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc., for her general store.

loans.name: Cyrene Mae

texts.en:
To generate income, Cyrene Mae buys and sells frozen foods in her community. Her husband works at a private company. 

Cyrene Mae is 25 years old and has no child yet. She aims to improve and strengthen her business to earn a higher income. 

To improve the business, she is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of hot dogs, ham, longaniza (pork sausages), tocino (bacon) and dressed chicken for sale. 

This financial assistance will help Cyrene Mae to improve her business. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to make the business grow and become a viable source of income.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of hot dogs, ham, longaniza (pork sausages), tocino (bacon) and dressed chicken for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy thread and cloth for her sewing business.

loans.name: Maguli

texts.en:
Maguli is from the Terjola district of West Georgia. She is 63 years old and lives with her grandson, Shota. Shota is married and has a wife and two infant children. He works as an artisan and earns a monthly income. Maguli is a pensioner. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own two pigs and sell piglets locally. Also, they have a plot of land where maize is grown. The family completes all relevant agricultural works to ensure a good harvest. The harvested product is sold at the local open market. 

Maguli works hard, but she still doesn’t have enough income to build her savings and improve the living conditions of her family. She has requested a loan to renovate her house. Her existing house is old and damaged. Maguli will purchase building materials and repair her home. Then, the living conditions of her family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. 

Maguli hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe  SOUTOURA  sont des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et  en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.  
Elles sont à leur dixième prêt  avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme SIRADJE fait le commerce de savon dans ce groupe de femmes de   SOUTOURA  elle se tient en deuxième position à partir de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt ½ fut d’huile et 1 sac 50 kg de chaux  pour la fabrication de savon. Elle revend en détail sur place,  en famille et au marché, à une clientèle composée en majeur partie de femmes, en détail, au comptant et quelques fois à crédit. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the group Soutoura are married women with an average age of 37 and who have an average of 4 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the popular neighborhoods of the city of Sikasso.

The women are on their tenth loan with the microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso, in order to better meed the needs of their customers. Siradje is in the soap business with this group of women of Soutoura; she is pictured second from the left in the photo.

Siradje plans on using her loan to purchase 1/2 cask of oil and one 50kg bag of lime in order to make soap. She resells it at retail on site, within the family, and at the market, to a customer base made up mainly of women who pay in cash and once in a while on credit. 

Siradje hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 17,500 francs CFA, a portion of which will be used to pay back the loan and interest, and the other portion for savings.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make soap

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase used clothes for thread making business

loans.name: Juliebeth

texts.en: Juliebeth, married, is 47 years old and lives in Labo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Juliebeth owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting corn to earn a living. She has been in this business for 15 years and earns PHP 15,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 25,500 to purchase farm chemicals. Juliebeth has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. Juliebeth's plan for the future is to save her profits in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase materials for constructing a dairy unit and a chuff cutter.

loans.name: Zafarjon

texts.ru:
Зафарчон родился в 1979 году в городе Душанбе. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Зафарчон занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке Корвон, где продает женскую одежду и сумки. Зафарчон в основном занимается продажей женских сумочек и детских сумок. В этой области он несколько лет. 
Зафарчон просит кредит для покупки сезонного товара (сумок) с целью увеличения оборота и ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Zafarjon was born in 1979 in the city of Dushanbe. He is married and has one child. Zafarjon is in sales. He rents out a vendor space on the Korvon market where he sells women's clothing and bags. Zafarjon mainly sells women's and children's bags. He has been in this business for several years.

Zafarjon is asking for a loan to buy seasonal merchandise (bags) with the goal to increase sales volume and assortment of goods.

loans.use: to increase sales volume and assortment of goods.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is from Lanchkhuti district. She is 57 years old and lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and a granddaughter.  Her son and husband work as gardeners and get a monthly salary. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, Marine runs a small dairy farm; she has two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. Besides this, the family grows maize, nuts and cucumbers on the family-owned land. The family sells their agricultural products and dairy at the local open market. Marine is a very hard-working woman, with a rich experience in her work.

She has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle. With the requested loan, she plans to purchase an additional milk cow. This will allow Marine to receive more milk for her dairy and increase the sales. This will give her an opportunity to improve her family's living conditions. Marine awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Diyabougou Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe DIYABOUGOU  sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 27 ans,  5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à  SANOUBOUGOU I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  ASSETOU  fait le commerce de pagnes dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est debout en troisième position à partir de la droite.
Elle compte acheter avec mon  prêt 15 pièces de pagnes auprès des grossistes qu’elle revend en détail  sur place  et au marché à une clientèle composée en majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre qui servira d’épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the group DIYABOUGOU are married women who average 27 years of age and five children each, and who live mostly in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, a working-class district of the city of Sikasso. They are seeking a third loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.

Mrs. ASSETOU sells pagnes (colorful west-African cloth). She is the one standing third from the right. She will use her loan to buy 15 pagnes from wholesalers to sell at retail, for cash, on location and at the market, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000FCFA, part of which she will use to repay her loan and interest, and the remainder to be added to her savings.

loans.use: to buy pagnes for resale

loans.name: Nugzari

texts.en:
Nugzari is from the Tkibuli district of West Georgia. He is a 37-year-old, single man who lives with his parents. Nugzari’s father is a pensioner. The family runs an agricultural business. Nugzari owns a calf and two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy production. They also own a vineyard and pick grapes in the late summer. Nugzari produces wine, which he sells at the local open market. They also have a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables are grown. The family has two pigs as well and they take good care of them. 

Nugzari works hard, but he still doesn’t have enough income to build his savings and improve the living conditions of his family.

He has requested a loan to renovate his house. The existing house is old and damaged. Nugzari will purchase building materials and repair the house with them. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. 

Nugzari hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres “Maria Auxiliadora” Empezó a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el 2010, el comité está integrado por 15 mujeres de la misma zona y todas antiguas dentro del comité. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, manifestaron que tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante.
Agueda es miembro de este trabajador grupo y comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por su familia y por ir creciendo como microempresaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y de huevos y es gracias a sus ventas que puede aportar en los gastos de la casa, y de esa forma sentirse útil. Agueda solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras de todo tipo, y de esa forma poder tener bien surtido su negocio.
texts.en:
The women's communal bank “Maria Auxiliadora” began to work with Fundación Paraguaya in 2010.  The communal bank is made up of 15 women from the same area and all are long-standing members within the communal bank.  The women are very united, responsible and supportive and they demonstrate that they are eager to work and to get ahead. 

Agueda is a member of this hardworking-group and says that all of her efforts are for her family and for growing as a small-businesswoman.  She makes a living selling vegetables and eggs.  It is thanks to her sales that she can contribute to the expenses of the household and in this way feel useful.  Agueda is requesting a loan in order to buy all kinds of vegetables and in this way be able to have a well-stocked business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Sebougou Group

texts.fr:
Les 6 membres du groupe SEBOUGOU  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à  SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  DJENEBOU  fait le commerce de tissus dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est debout en  première position à partir de la gauche.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 15 rouleaux de tissus qu’elle revend en détail  sur place  et au marché à une clientèle composée en majeur partie de femmes, en détail au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26.500FCFA dont une partie est utilisée pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour servir d’épargne.
Elle ambitionne augmenter mon chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire ma clientèle.
texts.en:
The six members of the SEBOUGOU group are married women with a mean age of 29 and an average of four children each. Most of them live in monogamous families in SANOUBOUGOU I, a working-class neighborhood in the city of Sikasso. This is their third loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with a view to satisfying the needs of their customers.

DJENEBOU sells fabric in this group of women. She is the first person standing on the left-hand side [of the photo]. She plans to use the loan to buy 15 rolls of fabric that she will sell retail in her shop and at the market for cash or credit to a clientele composed mainly of women.

She plans to earn an average monthly profit of 26,500 FCFA, part of which she will use to pay back the loan and its interest, and the rest of which she will save. She wants to increase her sales to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida is a 43-year-old married woman from Albur, Bohol. She has six children. The oldest child is 25 years old. She has been making tuba (coconut wine) for 15 years. She plans to use the loan to buy additional ingredients to make tuba (coconut wine) to sell to the neighboring towns. 

In the future, Leonida would like to expand her business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make more tuba (coconut wine) to sell.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
Ella sells a variety of groceries within the village she lives. She is married, with four children. Her husband is an Overseas Filipino Worker at Riyad.

Ellas's two children are working; the other one is still searching for a job, and the youngest is still studying.  Ellla and her husband work together to have a better way of living and let her youngest child finish her studies.

Ella has owned a retail store for two years andgiven five years to her direct selling business. She would  like to buy more stocks of merchandise, such as canned goods, soft drinks, ingredients and assorted biscuits, because the products immediately sell out.

With regard to this connection, Ella is asking for a loan of PHP 17,000.  She knows that this amount of loan would help her a lot, most especially in improving her retail store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as canned goods, soft drinks, ingredients, and assorted biscuits, for her retail store

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité tiene 16 integrantes  en donde todas se sienten muy emocionadas, ya que la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias.
Rosalia es la presidenta, y comenta que ella motivo a sus amigas a formar parte del grupo, ya que también quiso poder ayudarlas a salir adelante. Ella tiene una despensa familiar, donde todos trabajan y la ayudan a atenderla. Cuenta que empezó con un pequeño negocio, pero que después fue abriéndose camino y hoy en día ya tiene una muy buena clientela.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y tener de esa forma bien surtido su negocio. Agradece que ella y sus amigas tengan esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
The committee has sixteen members and all of them feel very excited because the mutual help among them is constant and above all it inspires their desire to continue fighting for their families.   

Rosalia is the president and she comments that she motivated her friends to join the group because she also wanted to help them get ahead.  She has a small family grocery store where they all work and help her to run it.  She tells the story that she started with a small business, but afterwards, she continued making her way and today she has a good clientele.

She is requesting the loan to buy drinks, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables and other supplies in order to be able to continue working and, in this way, to have her business well stocked.  She is grateful that she and her friends have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy drinks, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables and more.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: Luis, tiene 29 años de edad, casado vive en Victoria, Yoro  junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. El tiene 3 años de haber establecido su propio negocio de tapicería y venta de repuestos y accesorios para vehículos. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y realiza trabajos de tapicería automotriz y de muebles. Anteriormente trabajaba como mecánico automotriz y por su experiencia decidió poner su negocio. El préstamo que solicita es por 8,000 lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de materiales para tapicería, repuestos y accesorios para vehículos. Este préstamo le ayudara a fortalecer su negocio y terminar los trabajos pendientes por entregar a sus clientes. Su sueño es brindar a su familia educación, una casa digna y estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Luis, age 29, is married and lives in Victoria, Yoro, with his wife and their four children.  Three years ago Luis established his own upholstery and sales business.  He sells auto replacement parts and accessories.  The business is at his house, and he does vehicle and furniture upholstery jobs.

He previously worked as an auto mechanic, and because of his experience he decided to set up his own business.

The loan he is requesting for 8,000 lempiras is to buy upholstery materials and auto replacement parts and accessories.  This loan will help him strengthen his business and finish pending work to deliver to his customers.

His dream is to give his family an education, a decent house, and financial security.

loans.use: to buy materials (imitation leather, glue, nails, etc.) for his upholstery work.

loans.name: Rushel

texts.en:
Rushel is young businesswoman, yet single. She has operated her toy retail store for three years now. Her store is located at her village while her other one is located at Aritao Nueva Vizcaya.

Rushel aims to have a better way of living and to obtain an increased   income so she could support her youngest sibling in her studies.  

She plans to buy more stocks of groceries, clothing, and toys, but she has insufficient capital.  So she is requesting a loan of PHP 17,000. This amount of loan is useful in the further growth of her retail store. Rushel hopes for approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries, clothings, and toys for her retail business.

loans.name: Oscar Exequiel

texts.es: El señor Oscar tiene 37 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Los Ángeles del municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Es casado y tiene dos hijas, de 5 y 9 años de edad. Hace 4 años que don Oscar y su esposa decidieron vender mercadería y aproximadamente año y medio pusieron una pulpería para vender también productos alimenticios. Ahora ellos realizan varias actividades para generar ingresos, la pareja se turna para atender la pulpería y la venta de mercadería como ropa, zapatos, achinería, cosméticos etc. tanto en su casa como de forma ambulante también. Además el realiza trabajos de soldadura en el taller de su padre cuando le solicitan.   Don Oscar está solicitando un segundo préstamo con ODEF y Kiva, el cual es por 12,000 Lempiras y va comprar un fardo de ropa usada y achinería para incrementar las ventas y los ingresos para poderle dar la mejor educación a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Oscar is 37 years old, and he lives in the village of Los Ángeles in the Arizona municipality in Atlántida. He is married and has two daughters, ages 5 and 9.  Four years ago Oscar and his wife decided to sell merchandise.  Approximately a year and a half ago they set up a mini market in order to also sell food products.

They now do various business activities in order to generate income.  The couple takes turns tending to the mini market and selling merchandise like clothes, shoes, low-cost novelty items, and cosmetics, etc.  They sell at their house as well as selling in an itinerant manner.

He also does soldering work at his father’s shop when requested.

Oscar is requesting a second loan with ODEF and Kiva for 12,000 lempiras.  He will buy a bundle of used clothes and novelty items to increase sales and income in order to be able to give his daughters the best education.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes and novelty items in order to stock his store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay those who help him cultivate rice.

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
SABALY est un regroupement de femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans,   5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogames à HAMDALLAYE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  ADIARATOU fait le commerce de condiments dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est debout au milieu.
Elle  compte acheter avec mon  prêt  10 cartons de cube maggie, 1 sac d’oignon et 1 carton  boite de concentrée de tomate.  Elle fait ses ventes à domicile et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes,  en détail au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et l’intérêt l’autre servira de dépôt d’ épargne .
texts.en:
SABALY is a group of women who are, on average, 39 years old and have five children.  They live mostly in monogamous families in HAMDALLAYE, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso.
They are on their first loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in the hopes of being able to meet their customers’ demand. 
Mrs. Adiaratou is in the business of selling condiments in this group of women.  She is standing in the middle.  
She plans to buy, with her loan, 10 cases of Maggie cubes, a sack of onions, and a case of tomato concentrate.  She makes her sales from home, to women, at retail, for cash and on credit.
She foresees making an average monthly profit of 22,500 FCFA, a part of which will be used to pay back the loan and interest, and the other part will go into savings.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe  BENKADI  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et  en moyenne  5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames au quartier MEDINE, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Elles sont à leur 11ème prêt avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso, dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  FATOUMATA,  fait le commerce d’habits dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle se tient en deuxième position à partir de la gauche vers la droite.
Elle  compte acheter avec ce  prêt,  10 pièces de pagne wax  et revend en détail  sur place  et au marché à une clientèle composée de femmes, au comptant. 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30 000 FCFA dont une partie sera  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour mon épargne. 
Elle ambitionne augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
The four members of the BENKADI group are married women, with an average age of 39 and they have on average five children.  They live mostly in monogamous families in Medine, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso.
They are on their 11th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, in the hopes of meeting the demands of their customers. 
Mrs. Fatoumata is in the business of selling clothing in this group of women.  She is second from the left.
She plans to buy, with this loan, ten Wax pagnes (lengths of brightly colored cloth used for clothing) to sell at retail from home and at the market to a clientele of women, for cash.
She foresees earning an average monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA, a part of which will be used to pay the loan and interest, and the other part will go to savings. 
Her goal is to increase her turnover and to be better able to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: to buy pagnes.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El Sr. Ernesto tiene 56 años, vive en la ciudad de Itá con su esposa, el se dedica a la talabartería hace como 16 años en su propia casa.
Don Ernesto es cliente de la fundación desde el año 2007, ya que mediante los créditos que se les fueron otorgando fue creciendo como micro empresario y así expandió sus productos hacia el interior del país.
El préstamo que solicito es para la compra de cueros que se le ofreció a bajo precio ya que su precio actual es un poco elevado y quiere de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y mejorando sus productos.
texts.en:
Ernest is 56 years old and lives in the city of Itá with his wife.  For 16 years, he has been earning a living making saddlery in his own home.  

Ernesto has been a client of the foundation since 2007 because through the loans that they have granted he went on growing as a mico-entrepreneur and thus expanded his products to the rest of the country.  

The loan that he is requesting is to buy leather that was offered to him at a low price because his normal price is a little high and, in this way, he wants to be able to continue growing and improving his products.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Myrna and her husband need to improve their business to generate sufficient income for their family. 

They are engaged in making and selling of hollow blocks in their community to generate additional income. They aim to strengthen this business so that they will increase their income and continue sending their four children to school. They want them to earn degrees and become professionals someday. 

For this reason, they plan to make more hollow blocks to sell, but they have not enough capital. Therefore, Myrna is asking for an additional PHP 10,000 to buy cement and sand and pay the expenses incurred in making hollow blocks. 

They are hoping that this financial assistance will enable them to improve the business and hoping that they will make it more viable in the future.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand and pay expenses incurred in making hollow blocks for sale.

location.town: Brgy. Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
Silvestra is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Talibon, Bohol, Philippines. 

She has been engaged in a rice farming business for more than five years now.

Silvestra is in need of financial resources for her farming venture. With a loan, Silvestra will be able to buy fertilizer for the rice and pay the maintenance of the machinery, such as the tractor.

Silvestra hopes to make her business a success in order to generate more revenue. Any additional income will be used to finance the family's daily consumption and pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and for the maintenance of the tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two more pigs and to pay her son's university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy young cattle.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is 24 years old, a vigorous lady, who has been running a beauty parlor business  for the last 1.5 years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Her father is employed as a guard in a small factory with a low salary to fulfill the needs of the family alone. That is why Naila is working to contribute to the family income. Her beauty parlor is very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household.

 In order to cater for more customers, she needs to have more products for her parlor. This forced her to contact Kashf Foundation to apply for a loan.  She requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy more cosmetics and hair treatment products and whitening creams in large quantity. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach beautician skills, so they could help her expand her business, and also earn money for themselves.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and products for hair treatment and whitening creams in large quantity.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a married lady who is childless. She is a merchant and dedicated to her job. Doris helps her spouse in the daily expenses through the sale of charcoal in a small store in her home. She has been in this business for the last two years, and she narrates that it has produced commendable results. Thanks for her efforts and determination; she has a good customer base since her products are of high quality.

Doris wants to stock her store and she is requesting this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Ms Amina is 55 years old and the mother of five children. For 20 years, Amina has had a business of selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. 

With the passage of time her sales have increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as in financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of Rs. 45,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf and Kiva for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James, who operates a piggery business, has two children. His family lives happily in the village of Buguey and he works hard to maintain their close family ties. James is earning about PHP 5,000 per piglet every disposing time. He wishes to exceed his earnings. Now, he has applied for a loan amount of PHP 7,000 to buy feed and vitamins. This loan will be of great help to his business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 25 years of age and single. She has run her retail store for four years. Aside from this business, she also engages herself in a hog-raising business. According to her, she earns about PHP5,000 a month.This amount only covers their household expenses, due to the large number of household members. She is the fourth child among the nine siblings.

Jessica works hard to make a living. She aspires to save money for her business expansion. But this time she needs to improve and re-stock her retail store to be able to obtain her goals in life. Jessica has requested a loan of PHP7,000 to allow her to buy necessary stocks of merchandise. She knows that in this way, she can help her parents in generating funds to be able to supply the needs of her hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy necessary stock of merchandise for her retail store.

loans.name: Marvie

texts.en:
To support the daily necessities of family, Marvie is operating her retail business. She has been managing her store for five years. She believes that patience and seriousness are needed to manage a business but access to finances is mostly important. 

Now,  Marvie is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase additional stock of groceries such as junk foods, spices, noodles, biscuits and breads. She came up with the business because she wanted to help her husband generate extra income to support their children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries such as junk foods, spices, noodles, biscuits and breads.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah, 45, resides with her husband, and four children at Sinkor.  She  stopped  her  education  in  the  9th  grade. Her husband is an instructor, and  her children  are  between  the  ages  of  5  and 18 and currently in school.   

Sarah is very hard working; she has had this business for the past seven years. She sells beans, rice, cooking oil, bath soap, washing soap, flour, sardines, luncheon meat and many other items.   Because of the location of her business, and the good interaction that she has with her customers, she makes profit when she sells. She uses the profit to improve the business, and help with the expenses of the home.  She has requested her fourth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more cooking oil, bath soap, flour, sardines, and beans for the business. Her plan is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, bath soap, flour, sardines, and beans for the business.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en:
Emzar is from Kobuleti district of West Georgia. He is 47 years old and lives with his wife, daughter, son, daughter-in-law and an infant grandson. His daughter works at a sewing workshop and his son is employed in road building. Both of them get monthly income. 

Emzar runs the agricultural business. In particular, he has a milk cow, whose milk is used in

He has requested a loan to purchase calves which he plans to raise, fatten and sell at a good price. This will significantly increase the income of the family. Emzar will reinvest his profits in his agricultural activities and expand the animal husbandry business.  He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise

loans.name: Katunge

texts.en:
Katunge is a 53-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 10 years to 34 years. She describes herself to be a quiet woman. She operates a food stall  where she sells fruits and vegetables such as avocados, bananas, kale, etc. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located near a busy town  and her primary customers are local residents  from the environs. 

Katunge describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business . She will use the Kes 5,000 loan to buy vegetables and fruits for selling. Her business goal is to open a retail store selling home products to customers within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to university level . This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for selling

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, age 32, is married and has been blessed with three children.

She has been running her store for four years. She sells basic necessities such as sugar and oil to meet each customer’s needs. She is able to earn about 10,000 PHP a month. 

Mary Jane would like to request an additional capital amount of 15,000 PHP, allowing her to restock her retail store because Christmas season will be her opportunity to acquire higher sales. She will use the loan to purchase canned goods, noodles, coffee, and sugar. She hopes her requested loan will be approved in order for her sales and profits to increase. She also hopes that her economic situation will improve through the loan.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice lives with her four children, making her living operating a cafe. She has been working in this business for several years and has gained a lot of experience producing and selling. She always obtains healthy profits.

The business is located in a community where Beatrice lives and is frequented by a lot of people. She has many steady customers who prefer her cafe because everything is made with the best quality goods at accessible prices. Above all, she provides excellent service. 

Beatrice is an exemplary woman. She is decisive, dedicated to her work and has a lot of goals for the future. She feels very proud of what she has achieved to date and is confident that if she continues working hard she will be able to achieve greater success.

In the last few weeks, demand has increased and she wants to profit from it by making a new investment, but she doesn't have enough capital, so she is seeking a loan from Yehu. This will enable her to buy flour, meat, vegetables, cooking oil, charcoal and so on. 

She has faith that she will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy flour, meat, vegetables, cooking oil, charcoal and so on.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Kuña Kyrey en guarani siganifica mujer con animos, y justamente son 13 mujeres las que con mucho animo se unieron para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto y de esa forma salir adelante.
La Sra. Bernardita tiene 2 hijos vive con su marido Juan. Bernardita está emprendiendo un negocio, que es la venta de prendas de todo tipo, y es por ello que solicita este préstamo, para poder invertirlo en la compra de ropas, y de esa forma poder empezar su trabajo y el día de mañana tener un gran local de ropas.
Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, pues no solo ella es beneficiada, sino toda su familia.
texts.en:
Kuña Kyrey means "courageous woman" in Guarani, and they are exactly 13, the women who, with a lot of courage, got together to be able to help their families through their work as a way of getting ahead.

Bernardita has two children and lives with her husband, Juan.  Bernardita's setting up a business selling all types of clothing, so she's requesting this loan to be able to buy clothes.  This way she'll be able to start her job and have a big clothing store in the future.

She's grateful for this opportunity because both she and her family are benefitting.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Defri

texts.en:
Defri is a 38-year-old man. He is married to Efnilinda, a 36-year-old lady. They are blessed with three children: Simron, 19; Yani, 12, who is attending first grade of junior high school; and Desti, 4.

Defri has a plot of land where he cultivates vegetables such as pumpkin, water spinach, mustard greens, tomatoes, etc. Defri sells the vegetables at the market, which is located about 30 km away from his village. The vegetables business enables Defri to support his family. Even so, Defri still needs more capital to purchase more seeds and fertilizer. 

To do so, Defri requested loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. The loan would enable him to buy various vegetable seeds and the fertilizer. Defri is hoping that he can improve the business as well as to repay the loan to TLM.

loans.use: to buy various vegetable seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan de 42 años de edad, está felizmente casado con la Sra. Ninfa hace 25 años,  y con quien tiene 3 hijos.
El Sr. Juan  es carpintero,  se dedica a la fabricación de muebles que posteriormente los vende en su casa ya que los hace por pedido. Empezó este trabajo hace 10 años gracias a un ahorro con que contaba con su esposa y de esa manera pudieron emprender esta actividad.
Don Juan tiene la aspiración de ir ampliando su carpintería para que pueda brindar más mano de obra en su barrio y también ayudar a las demás personas.
Solicita su crédito para la compra de materia prima, maderas, tapizados y otros materiales ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda en la venta de sus muebles.
texts.en:
Juan, 42, has been happily married for 25 years to Ninfa, with whom he has three children.

Juan's a carpenter who makes a living making furniture that he later sells in his house because he makes it on request.  He started this job 10 years ago thanks to savings he and his wife had.

Juan wants to expand his carpentry shop so he can offer more handmade work in his neighborhood and also help other people.

He's requesting his loan to buy raw material, wood, upholstery, and other materials because there's a lot of demand for his furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood and upholstery

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en:
Ms Saeed is a 44 year-old married woman. Fifteen years ago, she started her own business of clothes-selling when her husband had low income and they were facing problems to keep up with the family's expenses. She didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation, upon the advice of her neighbor, to initiate her own business. 

Ms Saeed buys clothes of different designs, from the market in bulk at lower rates, and sells them in her community. She has a good client list, most of her clients are her neighbors. She is the mother of two children. She has gradually improved her business and now she has requested a loan of Rs. 25,000. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantities to add to her current stock. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of clothes, in a larger quantities, to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Margaretha

texts.en:
Margaretha, 38, is married to Nimrod, 50, a private employee. They have four children who are under 15 years old. Three of them are attending school, while the youngest is not attending school yet. Margaretha enjoys her role as a housewife and mother. In addition, she also runs business selling vegetables. Prior to moving to her current place, Margaretha ran the business at the market, but due to her pregnancy she decided to run the business from home. She sells leafy vegetables, mustard greens, cabbage, tomato, eggplant, and also chili in front of her house. 

Recently, Margaretha has been planning to improve her business, but she has very limited capital to do so. She requested a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,500,000 to purchase more types of vegetable such as garlic, onion, ginger, turmeric, lemongrass, and others. Besides that, Margaretha also plans to use the remaining loan for postnatal fees.

loans.use: to purchase more types of vegetable such as garlic, onion, ginger, turmeric, lemongrass and also to pay for postnatal fees.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking woman who lives with her husband and their eight children. Of these children, six are grown and married while two are still in school. 

Mary is a visionary woman who always looks for opportunities on how she can progress in life. 

Over the past few months, demand for charcoal has increased, especially this rainy season. The main challenge is that she sells her charcoal in the open air, and therefore it is prone to theft and destruction by rain. For this reason, Mary is seeking a loan to construct a store to stock her charcoal for safety.

loans.use: to construct a store to stock her charcoal for safety.

loans.name: Lhamsuren

texts.en: Mr.Lhamsuren is 44 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a small house in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His daughter, Hulan, is 19 years old, and is a college student. Mr.Lhamsuren works at construction material producing company. He used to work as retailer of raw pelt from 2003. His wife Chimgee, is starting to purchase raw pelt from individuals at the market, and sell it to processing companies for a higher price. This is a seasonal business, and high season is approaching. Mr.Lhamsuren and his wife would like to boost their profits during the high season to cover their daughter's tuition and accommodation expenses. He is a modest and honest man, and is requesting a loan of 3,700,000 MNT to pay daughter's tuition and accommodation expense.

loans.use: To pay daughter's tuition and accommodation expense

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce, 34, is a mother of three, a dedicated merchant who is married and lives with her family in the town of Kisauni. 

She has been operating a food stall that has been running for eight years. Her husband is also a hotelier. 

Joyce has the desire to progress in life and help her family with their daily activities. With the requested loan, she will buy more ingredients like maize and wheat flour, rice, beans, etc.

loans.use: buy more ingredients like maize and wheat flour, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia, age 42, helps her husband in the family business. They have been in fishing for over 30 years. Lilia sells the caught fish in the village. 

She is seeking a loan of PHP 6,000 to repair and maintain their net and motorboat. By improving their tools, they will be able to meet their daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance of their net and motorboat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add new stock of foodstuff

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora Dora tiene 51 años, es soltera, tiene dos hijos. Es comerciante desde hace varios años, tiene un local en la ciudad de Encarnación en donde vende prendas de lencería, calzas, musculosas, ropas de cama y otros. Se dedica a este trabajo desde hace mucho tiempo, su negocio ha ido creciendo de a poco y actualmente ya tiene buena clientela. Gracias a esta actividad ella ha podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
La señora ha solicitado este crédito para la compra mas prendas para su local, para poder seguir tendiendo buena variedad de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora, 51, is single and has two children.  She has been a merchant for several years.  She has a place in the city of Encarnación where she sells lingerie, stockings, sleeveless tops, bed clothes, and other things.

She has made a living at this job for a long time.  Her business has grown gradually and currently she has good customers.  Thanks to this job she has been able to get ahead, support her household, and pay for any unexpected expense.

She has requested this loan to buy more clothing for her store, to be able to continue having a good variety of clothing to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: После окончания средней школы, Малика поставила себе цель стать известным экономистом. С этой целью она поступила в Технологический Университет Таджикистана в факультет Мировая экономика и маркетинг. Малика студентка 4 курса. Она очень умная и трудолюбивая девушка. Учиться на отлично и активно участвует на всех мероприятиях университета. Родители Малики простые рабочие и они не в состоянии оплатить за учебу своего ребенка. Малика обратилась в Имон Интернешенл с целью получения займа для оплаты учебы в университете. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: After completing high school, Malika set herself a goal of becoming a famous economist. With this aim in mind, she entered the Faculty of World Economics and Marketing of the Technological University of Tajikistan, where she is now in her fourth year of studies. She is a very intelligent and industrious 'A' student who actively takes part in student events on campus. Malika's parents are simple working people who are not in a position to afford the costs of their daughter's university studies. Malika has come to Imon International to ask for a loan that will allow her to cover her tuition fees. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay her tuition

loans.name: Delli

texts.en:
Delli is a 40-year-old widow who lives with her mother, sister, and cousins. She is the breadwinner in her family and is responsible for taking care of her mother and covering her cousin’s schooling fees. Delli runs a kiosk business. 

Delli is requesting a 10,000,000 IDR loan from TLM to expand her kiosk and buy more merchandise such as soft drinks, snacks, and daily use items. She will also buy building materials as she needs to enlarge her kiosk to accommodate everything before increasing her stock. Delli learned that TLM provides loans to small business owners and she submitted a loan application and request. She is expecting that her loan will help her to generate a better income for her family.

loans.use: to expand her kiosk and buy more merchandise such as soft drinks, snacks, daily use items, and building materials

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan is a 38-year-old man who is married and the father of two lovely children. He is the only income earner in his family and he operates a variety store where he sells groceries, toiletries, detergent, and beverages piecemeal in his local neighborhood.  Kanan wants to provide his family with the best life possible. 

Kanan is requesting an 1,800 AZN loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory and continue to operate his business. This is his first loan and he is very thankful for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is married with two children. For the past four years, she has run a general store and she also buys and sells bananas. She uses the profits from her general store to provide for her family's household needs and to provide for her children. Emelita was able to start her banana business through hard work, patience, and wise management. 

Emelita is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan to buy groceries for her general store to make it more productive and profitable through wise management. Her main priority is to increase her income, educate her two children, and save some money for emergency purposes. Emelita hopes to continually improve her store and banana business.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her general store

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées toutes dans des familles nucléaires, les cinq femmes du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 47 ans et 2 enfants. Elles habitent toutes au quartier Bagadadji dans la ville de Ségou et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu. Elles font l’achat et la vente de canaris, pastèques, ustensiles de cuisines et pagnes wax. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire les besoins de leurs clientèles de plus en plus croissants, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui, elles sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Djènèbou  (femme debout en première position sur la photo de la gauche vers la droite) est une grande vendeuse de matériels de poterie de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 200 canaris avec les artisanes de la place. Elle effectue ses ventes en détail au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes, à domicile et au grand marché de Ségou. Avec ce prêt,  Djènèbou  espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge certains besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The five members of the group Danaya are married women who live in nuclear families. They average 47 years of age and two children each. They all live in the district of Bagadadji, in the city of Ségou, and they know one another as neighbors and coworkers, and trough ties of kinship. They buy and sell canaris (earthenware vessels), watermelons, kitchen utensils and wax pagnes. 

To satisfy the needs of a growing customer base, the group joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance program, with which they have started their 3rd group loan cycle. 

Djènèbou (standing first from the left) is a leading seller of various pottery items. She plans to use her loan to buy 200 canaris from local craftspeople. 

She will sell her stock at retail, for cash or credit, to a clientele consisting mainly of women. She conducts her sales from her home and at the big market of Ségou. 

She expects to earn an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her activity and to cover some of the household needs.

loans.use: to buy canaris (earthenware) for resale.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 52 years old, married, and has three children.  She is from Calunasan Norte, Loboc, Bohol. Tita runs a sari-sari or general store, which she has been doing for more than seven years. She sells various goods and commodities to the people in her community.

Tita is requesting for a loan, which she will use to buy additional merchandise to sell, such as canned goods, snack food, detergents, and shampoo. With additional merchandise, she will be able to attract more customers to her store.

Tita hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive. Any additional income will be used to for her family's daily needs and for savings.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Shohista

texts.ru: Шохисте 30 лет. Она разведена и воспитывает 1 ребенка. Шохиста умеет шить красивые национальные платья, и она решила организовать свой бизнес услугой швеи для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  6000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shohista is 30 years old, divorced, and has 1 child. Shohista can sew beautiful national dresses, and has decided to set up her own business in sewing services so that she can provide for her family. With this goal in mind, she took a course entitled "Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she received a certificate. She is now fully capable of establishing her own business and becoming successful at it. Shohista is seeking a loan of 6,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy a sewing machine so she can set up a new business. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine to set up a new business

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is 47 years old and married. She has five children, two daughters and three sons. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and healthcare. Her husband is a mason. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

Zarina started her business to contribute in the family income. She has been in the business of sewing for three years. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation. She took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy a machine and stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc. Then she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She wants to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work.

loans.use: To buy a machine, stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Adolfina

texts.en:
Adolfina is a 33-year-old mother of three children.  The children are Vioni, 9 (who is in the 3rd grade); Kesya, 4; and Reigi, 10 months. 

Adolfina owns a pig breeding business that has been running for three years. She breeds the pig for several months and then sells them to her customers. She also makes cakes and distributes them to kiosks around her village. 

Adlofina plans to improve her business, and therefore requested loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM to buy more piglets, fodder, and cake ingredients (wheat flour and egg in bulk).

loans.use: to buy more piglets and fodder, as well as cake ingredients (wheat flour and eggs in bulk).

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en: Eufemia is 57 years old and a mother of two children. To make a living, she sells vegetables in a market. Her profit every day, amounting to 500 PHP, is  not enough to sustain the needs of the family, especially since her daughter is suffering from illness. This causes Eufemia to strive more in selling vegetables. She needs to earn a higher income for her children. She is asking for a loan amount of 16,000 PHP to buy additional goods to sell such as squash, spices, beans and root crop vegetables. She hopes to earn a higher than her usual income to cure the illness of her daughter, as well as to save for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell such as squash, spices, beans and root crops vegetables.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a married woman with five children between the ages of three and 22. For the past five years, she has operated a rope-selling business. Rosemary describes herself as a social and customer-friendly woman. Her business is located near a busy town  and her primary customers are local residents. Rosemary's biggest business challenge is insufficient funds. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

Rosemary is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy more ropes to sell. She plans to expand her business within five years. Rosemary hopes that her children will be educated to a higher level.

loans.use: to buy rope to sell

loans.name: Esmelda

texts.es:
La Sra. Esmelda es de la ciudad de Santaní,  es viuda con hijos, todos mayores que trabajan independiente, y cada vez que pueden la ayudan con todas las tareas que Esmelda necesita.
Es propietaria de una tapicería, motorrepuestos, producción y venta de queso, hace 12 años, tiene buena ubicación del negocio y eso la ha ayudado a ir formándose una buena clientela y de esa forma tener un mejor ingreso.
El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de motorrepuestos para tener dichos productos a disposición de sus clientes, y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Esmelda is from the city of Sanatí.  She is a widow with children, all of whom are adults who work independently and each time they are able, they help her with all the tasks Esmelda needs.  

For 12 years, she has been the owner of businesses for upholstery, motorcycle spare parts and cheese making and selling.  She has a good location for her business and that has helped her to continue forming a good clientele and to have a better income.  

She is requesting the loan to invest it in the purchase of motorcycle repair parts to have them available for her clients and, in that way, to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 38, lives with her life partner and their children. She owns a retail shop where she sells daily necessity items like bread, eggs, milk and flour. She's been running this business for five years, which has given her a lot of experience in sales that allows her to generate the best profits she can. The shop is located in her home at a location with a lot of foot traffic. She already has a lot of customers, but her best clients are her neighbors, who recommend her because she always has what they need. She offers quality products at affordable prices and with excellent service.

Francisca is an enterprising woman very dedicated to her work and who has many goals that she aims to achieve. Her biggest secret to achieving success is effort and a love of work. In recent weeks, demand has been increasing and she would like to take advantage. That's why she's requesting this loan from Yehu that will allow her to buy basic items like milk, eggs, rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy basic items like milk, eggs, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Virgen De Itati Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Itati tiene 13 miembros, y gracias al trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas ya están en el noveno ciclo, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de la fundación paraguaya.
