Cuenta la Sra. Dellys es la presidenta del grupo, y cuenta que se dedica a la venta de celulares de todas las marcas y tipos. Es un mercado muy duro ya que hay mucha competencia, pero pese a ello siempre se esfuerza mucho, ya que desea salir adelante y todo lo que hace es por su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de aparatos celulares, como así para accesorios y también repuestos, y agradece por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación.
texts.en:
'Virgen de Itati' has thirteen members, and thanks to their group effort they're already in their ninth loan cycle. These women are heads of household who saw a great opportunity for progress in the program from La Fundación Paraguaya.

Ms. Dellys is the president of the group and she tells us that she works selling all brands and types of cell phones. It's a very difficult market because there's a lot of competition, but despite this she always makes a strong effort since she wants to come out ahead, and everything she does is for her family.

She's requesting the loan to buy cell phones, accessories, and spare parts, and she is grateful for the help she's receiving from Kiva and La Fundación.

loans.use: to buy cell phones, accessories, and spare parts.

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс житель города Кургантюбе. Ему 37 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Фирдавс хочет заняться своим делом. Он просит кредит для приобретения легковой автомашины, чтобы предоставить услугу, такси. Таким образом Фирдавс намерен заработать и улучшить свои жизненные условия.
texts.en: Firdavs lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children. Firdavs wants to go into business for himself. He is seeking a loan so that he can buy a car which he can use to provide taxi services. This will allow Firdavs to earn money to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a car

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Santa Rosa esta en el tercer ciclo, tiene 15 miembros, donde todas ellas trabajan arduamente y se ayudan las unas a las otras. Son luchadoras y quieren dar a sus familias todo lo que pueden y que no les falte nada.
Lilian es parte de este grupo, ella es peluquera desde hace ya un buen tiempo, se ha hecho de buena fama ya que siempre da muy buena atención a sus clientes y hace muy buenos trabajos. Su sueño es poder seguir creciendo, y así también poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
Solicita el préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de spray, shampoo, enjuague, tintes y demás insumos para seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santa Rosa is in its third cycle.  It has 15 members who work arduously and help each other.  They are tenacious, and they want to give their families everything they can so they lack for nothing.

Lilian is part of this group.  She has been a hairdresser for quite some time.  She has an excellent reputation because she always gives good service to her customers, and she does very good work.  Her dream is to be able to continue growing.  This way she would be able to give work to other people.

She is requesting the loan to be able to buy spray, shampoo, rinse, dyes, and other supplies in order to continue giving her customers good service.

loans.use: to buy spray, shampoo, rinse, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Sattar

texts.en:
Sattar is 54 years old and a widow. Her husband died nearly 20 years ago. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for the past fifteen years.  After the death of her husband, she aimed to give her children a good and reasonable status in the society. This compelled her to start her own business, now she has become the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of three children and is responsible for providing them with the basic necessities of life.  

Sattar wants to expand her business. She requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins, and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demand for her work.  She also shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills so the girls can help her expand her business and also earn money for themselves. Sattar’s daughters also assist her in fulfilling orders on time.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet increasing demand for her work.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 29-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol, Philippines. She has been engaged in the farming business for more than five years now. Her husband also works as a farmer. They grow rice and other crops in their field.

Analyn is in need of additional capital for her farming business. She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

In the future, Analyn dreams of expanding her farming business so that it will generate more income to meet the needs of her family and for future schooling of her five-year-old son.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en:
Manana is from the Kobuleti district of West Georgia. She is 26 years old and lives with her husband, two children (4 and 8 years old), and mother-in-law.

Manana runs an agricultural business. In particular, she has a milk cow, whose milk is used in dairy products. Besides that, the family grows nuts and maize on family-owned land. Manana sells her agricultural products at the local open market.

Manana has requested a loan to purchase calves, which she plans to raise, fatten, and sell at a good price. The other part of the loan will be used for developing a nut business - the family needs the money to do relevant agricultural work and ensure a good harvest. This will significantly increase the income of the family. Manana will reinvest her profits in the family's agricultural activities. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves and develop a nut business

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is 25 years old, married and has a 3-year-old child. He describes himself as a quiet man. He operates an electronic repair store where he provides repair services for televisions, radios, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located near a town and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy electronics spare parts. His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his child. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy electronic spare parts.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia, 45, is married and lives in Sinkor. She has five children between the ages of 5 and 22. Only one of the children attends school due to lack of financial support. She has been selling palm oil, pepper, onion, vita, salt, tomatoes, cooking oil and many other items for the past three years. She learned to sell from her mother. She received a loan from BRAC Liberia  to start in this business. With the profit generated from the business, she repaid two loans and improved the business. She has requested her third loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more items to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, vita, salt, cooking oil, palm oil and onion to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mahmadsalim

texts.ru: Махмадсалим житель района А. Джоми. Ему 36 лет. Махмадсалим женат. Он является отцом четверых детей. Жена Махмадсалима предоставляет услугу у себя дома. Она портниха. Сам Махмадсалим зарабатывает путем купле - продажи крупнорогатого скота. В основном он закупает бычков, разводит у себя дома 3-4 месяца и через несколько месяцев выводит скот на рынок. Махмадсалим имеет богатый опыт в этой области. Он берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Mahmadsalim lives in A. Jomi. He is 36 years old, married, and has 4 children. His wife is a seamstress and works from home. Mahmadsalim buys and sells cattle for a living. He mainly buys bulls, raises them for 3-4 months, then takes them to the market. Mahmadsalim has a wealth of experience in this field. He is seeking a loan for the purchase of bulls.

loans.use: To buy bulls

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is 54 years old, married, and blessed with four children. To help his family he built up his own business. He has a piggery business that in their backyard. He also works as a farmer for additional income.  

Now, Romeo is requesting PHP 15,000 to buy feed and vitamins to help his pigs to mature. He hopes that through this loan he will be able to increase his sales because he wishes to save to improve his family's living situation.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is a 45-year-old married woman. She has four children ranging in age from 10 to 25 years old. She describes herself as a social and talkative woman. 

Paulina operates a retail and grocery business where she sells ropes, vegetables, and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located near a busy town and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds for improving her business. She will use the Kes 5,000 loan to buy potatoes for resale. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business . This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy potatoes for selling in her grocery store

loans.name: Nakale

texts.en:
Nakale is 48 years old and lives with her family in their own house. She has a kiosk where she sells basic necessities like bread, beans, rice, eggs, and other items. She has little sales experience because she has only had this business for nine months, but thanks to her efforts she has already established a good clientele. The kiosk is located in her home, in an area traveled by many people, which has meant many customers for her. They prefer Nakale's kiosk because she has goods available at reasonable prices with excellent service, though it is not well stocked. She is a very entrepreneurial woman with a great desire to improve her circumstances. Every day she dedicates herself completely to her work because she knows that this is the only way she will achieve success.

Like every good businesswoman, Nakale would like to expand her business. In order to do so, she needs to make an investment, which is why she is requesting a loan from Yehu in order to buy bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, sweets, detergents, etc. Nakale is very responsible, and she assures lenders that she will be able to pay back her debt. At the same time, she is confident that she will be able to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, sweets, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, a sewing machine and embroidery material.

loans.name: Kuña Pyryry Group

texts.es:
Este grupo esta en el ciclo numero 11, son mujeres muy unidas, que desean salir adelante y se esfuerzan por hacerlo. Quieren poder dar a sus hijos todo lo que ellas no tuvieron y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Silvina, quien mediante la costura ha ayudado a su familia. Cuenta ella que siempre está cargada de muchos pedidos, ya que es muy bien acogida por sus clientes por el buen trabajo que hace, y es por ello que solicita el crédito, ya que quiere poder comprar telas, hilos, botones y demás, con los que podrá seguir cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is in its 11th cycle.  They are very united woman who wish to get ahead, and they work hard in order to do so.  They want to be able to give their children everything that they did not have, and they do not want their children to undergo any hardships. 

Silvina is one of the members, and through sewing she has helped her family.  She says that she always has a lot of orders.  She is very well received by her customers because of the good work that she does.

That is why she is requesting the loan.  She wants to be able to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other items in order to be able to complete her customers’ orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Bushara

texts.en:
Ms Bushara is a 32-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last three years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support the family alone. 

She is a mother of two children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 20,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) to buy rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and she dreams to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante grows different kinds of vegetables in his 7000 square meter backyard vegetable garden. His main goal is to increase the vegetables he produces but the capital available to his business is not sufficient. Dante is now requesting a loan of 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP). He will use this loan in buying vegetable seeds such as squash, eggplant, tomatoes and okra. He hopes that this loan will keep his business growing and more profitable. 

Dante is looking forward for the success of his vegetable vending through the continuous access of financial assistance from lenders.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds such as squash, eggplant, tomatoes and okra for his vegetables business

loans.name: Dominica

texts.en:
Dominica is 54 years old, married, and has three children. Two of her children are married while the other one is still searching for a job. Dominca's main source of income comes from their farming business. With the income generated from her farming business, she is able to buy hogs to raise and educate her three children. She currently has raised one sow and ten piglets. She has run this kind of business for five years. Dominica is thankful because her living condition has improved. 

Dominica would like to provide her raised hogs with proper nutrition so she is seeking a loan of 15,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP), allowing her to buy hog feed and necessary vitamins and vaccines. She hopes that with these livestock supplies she can keep her hogs healthy and gaining weight until their maturity period. In this way she could sell them at a better price which will enable her to achieve her goals in life.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vaccines and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a 52 year old widow. She lives with her children, who are grown, in her own house in the town of Kaloleni, in the province of Coast. She describes herself as happy, hard-working and responsible with her children.   

Mlongo has a grocery store which she constantly needs to supply with products. This is her second loan with Yehu, which she will use to purchase wholesale groceries like sack of rice, sugar, salt, bales of flour, detergents and other things that will offer her customers greater variety. By doing this, she will be able to make good profits and improve her quality of life. Mlongo hopes to continue accessing loans so that she can continue to move forward and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale groceries like sack of rice, sugar, salt, bales of flour, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Nasur

texts.en:
Nasur lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, four of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. 

She sells second-hand clothes from home. She sells her products at both a retail and wholesale basis. She also gets additional income from selling beans, rice, and ground nuts (peanuts) in a shop that she rents. She has been in business for the last six years. She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more bales of second hand clothes and bags of beans, rice and ground nuts. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a truck to ease transportation and also build rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Qurbonnazar

texts.ru:
Курбонназар житель города Кургантюбе. Ему 41 год. Он женат. У него двое детей. Жена Курбонназара домохозяйка, она занимается воспитанием детей. 
Курбонназар занимается торговлей на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку на центральном рынке города. Курбонназар в основном занимается продажей овощей и хлопкового масла. Торговлей он занимается на протяжении десяти лет. Курбонназар берет кредит для покупки картошки, моркови и растительного масла.
texts.en: Qurbonnazar lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children. His wife is a homemaker and stay-at-home mom. For the past 10 years, Qurbonnazar has been working in retail. He rents a stall at the central city market where he sells mainly vegetables and cottonseed oil. Qurbonnazar is seeking a loan to buy potatoes, carrots, and vegetable oil.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, carrots, and vegetable oil

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба  женщина в возрасте. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Работает она в средней образовательной школе. Муж её  работает в Российской Федерации  и каждый месяц  отправляет денежные средства своей жене. Кроме работы она также занимается  животноводством . Дома откармливает скот.  Доход от этого вида деятельности очень хороший. Поэтому она хочет расширить свой бизнес и увеличить поголовье скота . На полученный кредит планирует купить скот.  Заранее благодарит Арванд  за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Mahbuba is a woman of a mature age.  She is married and has three children.  She works at a secondary school.  Her husband works in the Russian Federation and sends money to his wife every month.  Besides work, Mahbuba is also involved in animal husbandry.  She fattens up livestock at home.  The income from this type of business is very good.  This is why she wants to expand her business and increase the livestock headcount.  Mahbuba plans to use this loan to buy livestock.  She thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Diega

texts.en: Diega is a 43 year old married woman and a mother of five children. She runs a sari-sari or convenience store in her place in Trinidad, Bohol, Philippines. She has been in this business for more than four years now. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as noodles, canned goods, snack foods, candies, soda and other things. This will enable her to cater to more customers. Diega dreams of making her business a success in the future. Moreover, she wants to send her children to school regularly so they can get a good education and brighten their future.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as noodles, canned goods, snack foods, candies, soda, etc.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married and has four children, three of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members (sisters and brother). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 10 years. She sells to all kinds of people, both on retail and wholesale. She works seven days a week at the market. She has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to be able to go to villages for charcoal and also to buy or build her own house. She resides in a rented house and has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children, six of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She lives in her own house with access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.
	
Milly makes brushes, and sells them on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years, and works six days a week. She also gets additional income from teaching. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy raw materials for making brushes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals are to own a plot where she can build rental houses, and also to educate her children up to university.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for making brushes

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура всю свою жизнь занимается  животноводством так как не имеет образования . Она замужем имеет троих детей. Манзура  выращивает скот дома.  Они  живут  в небольшом доме в селе. Муж её работает помощником  мастера в   строительной компании, но заработная плата очень маленькая и хватает только на проживания. Манзура хочет расширить свой бизнес по животноводству и увеличить поголовье скота. На полученный кредит хочет   приобрести скот. Манзура благодарит Арванд и надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Manzura has been involved in animal husbandry all of her life because she does not have education.  She is married and has three children.  Manzura raises livestock at home.  Her family lives in a small house in a village.  Her husband works as an assistant to a foreman at a construction company, but his salary is very small and is only enough for basic living expenses.  Manzura wants to expand her animal husbandry business and increase livestock headcount.  She wants to use this loan to buy livestock.  Manzura thanks Arvand and hopes for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза женщина в возрасте 35 лет.  Она занимается шитьем занавесок  у себя дома. У нее четверо детей. К большому сожалению она развелась   со своим мужем и ей приходиться воспитывать детей самой. Они живут в селе и у них не большой дом. Хотя дом не большой но нуждается в ремонте. У них очень плохие условия проживания. Поэтому Шахноза обратилась в Арванд за финансовой помощью. Она хочет сделать косметический ремонт в своем доме.  Для этого ей надо приобрести строительные материалы.  На полученный кредит Шахноза планирует купить краски, известь, клей и обои. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку и помощь.
texts.en: Shahnoza is a 35 year-old woman.  She is involved in sewing window curtains at home.  She has four children.  Unfortunately, she divorced her husband and has to raise the children by herself.  They live in a village and have a small house.  Although the house is mall, it needs repairs.  They have very bad living conditions.  This is why Shahnoza came to Arvand for the financial help.  She wants to make cosmetic repairs in her house and needs to purchase construction materials for this purpose.  Shahnoza plans to use this loan to buy paint, chalk, glue and wallpaper.  She thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support and help.

loans.use: to buy paint, chalk, glue and wallpaper in order to repair her house

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
La  Sra. Zunilda  tiene 38 años , tiene una despensa  desde hace  7 años con una buena clientela formada en el barrio donde vive y sus alrededores .Es un  sacrificio constante para  ella  ya que tiene que madrugar para realizar sus compras  y así cumplir con sus clientes.
La Sra. Zunilda comenta que su sueño es pode ampliar su negocio y de esa forma dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes y ella poder seguir creciendo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, y demás, para poder abastecer su negocio, ya que estos son esenciales para su clientela.
texts.en:
Zunilda, 38, has had a grocery store for 7 years and it has a well-formed clientele from her neighborhood and adjacent areas.  It’s a constant sacrifice for her because she has to rise at dawn to make her purchases and meet customer demand.

Zunilda comments that her dream is to be able to enlarge the business for greater customer comfort and so that she can continue to grow.

She requests the loan to buy food items, beverages, dairy products and others to stock her store since these are essential for her customers.

loans.use: to buy food items, soft-drinks, dairy products and others.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 34 year old married woman. She has 5 children ranging in age from 1 to 16 years, and describes herself as a social and talkative woman. She operates a retail business selling papers. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located near a busy area, and her primary customers are local residents. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of funds for improving the paper sale business. She will use her KES 5,000 loan to buy more papers to sell. Her goal is to expand her business and run a retail shop within 5 years. She also hopes that in the future, she will be able to educate her children up to university level. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more papers to sell

loans.name: Magdonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Magdonio tiene 60 años y está casado con la Sra. Ninfalina que tiene 53 años. Tienen dos hijos, un varón de 36 años  y una hija de 28.
Magdonio se recibió de electricista y de técnico en Electrónica en el año 1972 y desde esa fecha se dedica a la reparación de aparatos eléctricos y electrónicos como: Equipos de Sonido, amplificadores,  Televisores, Computadoras, celulares y otros  más. Cuenta que gracias a su arduo trabajo ha podido dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan, y ahora quiere seguir trabajando para poder tener una vejez digna y sin necesidades.
El mismo desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de repuestos para artículos electrónicos y en la actualización de programas para reparación de celulares.
texts.en:
Magdonio, 60, is married to Ninfalina, 53.  They have two children, a 36-year-old son and a 28-year-old daughter.

Magdonio graduated as an electrician and electronics technician in 1972 and since then has worked repairing electric and electronic equipment like sound systems, amps, television sets, computers, mobile phones and others.  He relates that thanks to his hard work he’s been able to give his family everything they need and now he wants to continue working to have a dignified old-age that’s free of wants.

He wants to use the loan to buy spare parts for electronic equipment and to update his mobile phone repair programs.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Tétédé Adidjath

texts.fr: Agée de 22ans, Tétédé Adidjath est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont l'aîné est scolarisé. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 5ans et 03ans. Elle vend des fournitures scolaires depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. En vue de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Aged 22, Tétédé Adidjath is married and mother to two children, the older of which goes to school. The older child is five and the younger child is three. She has been selling school materials for a few years and buys her stock at one of the markets in Benin as well as further afield. In order to reinforce her purchasing power and to give satisfaction to her customers, she requested and has obtained a loan from Finadev. This loan will enable her to optimise her profits and to participate in the cost of educating her children.

loans.use: to buy 1 box of 100 page exercise books, 1 box of 200 page exercise books, 2 cartons of 4 colour Biros and 1 packet of pencils.

loans.name: Las Perlas Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Este grupo llamado las Perlas del Sur, surgió por promociones hechas a las miembros, están actualmente en su ciclo número once,  es gracias al trabajo de todas ellas que están donde están.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Silvia quien se dedica  a la venta de chipas en forma ambulante. Cuenta la Sra. Silvia   que el crédito lo solicita para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de chipas, como ser harina, almidón, huevos, anís y demás. Ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a la ayuda que recibe puede mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
This group, Las Perlas del Sur, came about through promotions to the members.  Currently they're in their eleventh cycle.  It's thanks to their work that they are where they are.

One of the members of the group is Silvia, who makes a living selling "chipas" [cornbread] on foot.  Silvia says she's requesting the loan to buy supplies to make chipas, including flour, starch, eggs, and anise.

She's very grateful because she's able to improve her family's income thanks to the help she receives.

loans.use: to buy flour, starch, eggs, anise, and other supplies

loans.name: Irma Luz

texts.es: Irma Luz de cincuenta años de edad vive junto a sus hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y eso le ha regalado experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio, además trabaja de jornal para complementar los gastos del hogar; Irma es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor y con muchas metas por delante, siempre esta a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito su mas grande secreto es el esfuerzo y el amor a su labor sabe que solo asi logrará su objetivo, en la ultima temporada de siembra aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, abono, etc. Irma Luz tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que le dara a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Irma Luz, 50, lives with her children.  She works in agriculture, specifically growing corn and beans.  She’s been in this line of work for several years and has gained experience that makes it possible for her to get the best harvests.  Her parcel of land is located in a zone with high concentration of agricultural activities that’s quite near to her home.  She sells all around the community and has many customers who prefer her because of the quality, good prices and above all excellent service.  To earn extra income she also works as a day laborer.

Irma is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her work; she has many goals ahead of her.  She’s always on the lookout for new opportunities that will make it possible for her to reach success.  Her greatest secret is effort and love of work; she knows this is the only way to reach her objective.

Last growing season demand increased and she wants to take advantage of this to increase production which is why she’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, manure, etc.  Irma Luz has good payment references and is responsible.  She assures that she will be able to repay the loan while at the same time has faith that she will provide her family with a full life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide and manure.

loans.name: Marin

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Kror Kor district of Pursat province, Marin is 54 years old and married with four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. To support her family, she has been farming rice for thirty years and supplements her family’s income by raising pigs. From the current business, she can earn about 20,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. Insufficient working capital is still the main challenge for her current business.  
 
This is the second loan for Marin with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund and she fully paid back the first loan. The first loan has helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a new loan of 1,500,000 KHR. Marin is going to use this loan to buy more piglets for raising. She hopes to grow her current business to earn a larger income so as to make convenient living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Pisey's Group

texts.en:
Pisey is 37 years old and widowed mother, with one dependent daughter who is still under school-aged. Her family lives in a rural area of the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been in farming rice on a two-hectare area of farmland for ten years and raising pigs. The current business earns her approximately 20,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Insufficient water supply for supporting her rice paddy is her main challenge.

Pisey has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle.  She has completely paid back the past loan which has helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. She is now leading her group of three members to apply for a loan. As the leader, Pisey will use her portion of to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs in plowing the field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase more crop yield so as to make her living better.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Soknang's Group

texts.en: As one breadwinner in a family with seven children, Soknang has to grow rice on her five hectares of farmland and sell clothes for additional income. She is 54 years old and resides in Moung Russey district, Cambodia. For the 10 years that she has been engaged in her business, she earns up to 18,000 KHR per day and saves about 8,000 KHR after offsetting with daily expenses. As a group of two, she and her fellow group member have never been with VisionFund (Kiva's partner) before. As new members requesting a loan, both of them are seeking the same loan amount of 500,000 KHR each. As a group leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to double the yield so that she can multiply her income for her household's sake.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Vanh's Group

texts.en:
Vanh, a married mother of four children, is 32 years old and lives in Moung Russey district of Battambong Province. To support her daily living costs, she manages her three hectares of farmland growing rice as her main source of income and working for others for a fee to earn extra income. With 10 years' experience in rice growing, she can earn about 20,000 KHR per day. 

In her group of two, Vanh is a fourth-time borrower and her co-member is a sixth-time borrower. Vanh has gradually improved her living standard with her past loans which she has repaid. Now, she is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR, the same amount as her fellow group member. As the group leader, Vanh is going to use her portion to purchase fertilizer for her crop. She hopes to multiply her yield and earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is a 39-year-old mother of four schoolchildren. She and her husband, a security guard, live in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province.For the past twenty years Ly has farmed rice and grown bitter melon and taro in her vegetable garden. This labor earns her almost 43,000 KHR from which she is able to save about 11,000 KHR after expenses. Ly is now applying for a 1,000 USD loan through VisionFund. She is going to use the money to buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for plowing fees. A portion of it will also be applied toward the purchase of a water pump. Ly hopes this loan will help her boost her crop production and multiply her income. With success, she will be able to repay the loan and afford to buy clothes and decent food for her children.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer, insecticides, plowing fees and part of a water pump.

loans.name: Choeurn's Group

texts.en:
Choeurn is 51 years old and the mother of five children.  To help her family survive, especially her children, she grows rice and raises pigs. Having been with this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about KHR 41,500, but she can save only KHR 10,000 per day.

This is the first loan for Choeurn and her co-member with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. She is applying for KHR 1,000,000, and her fellow group member is seeking KHR 200,000. As a group leader, she is going to use her portion to buy nine sacks of fertilizer and pig feed. 

She hopes that this purchase will help her to grow her rice as well as to raise her pigs healthily, so she can upgrade her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig feed

loans.name: Noklouman Group

texts.fr: Madame maria est âgée de 51ans. Elle a pour mari un cultivateur et ils ont 05 enfants en charge. Les deux premiers seuls sont scolarisés. Elle exerce la même activité que son conjoint et elle est plus basée dans la culture du mais et du haricot. C’est en 1998 qu’elle a démarré l’activité et 05 personnes l’aident dans l'exécution de ses tâches. Elle est à son premier crédit de WAGES et ce prêt lui servira d’acheter des outils de travail.  Avec les profits supplémentaires, elle veut épargner et augmenter sa superficie cultivable. Elle est la responsable du groupement nommée  NOKLOUMAN constitué de femmes qui sont toutes dans la culture du mais et du riz.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old.  She is married to a farmer and they have five children in their care.  Only the oldest two go to school.  Maria works as a farmer, like her husband, but she essentially grows maize and beans.

She got involved in agriculture in 1998 and five people assist her with her farming duties.

This is Maria's first loan with WAGES.  This loan will help her to buy working tools.

With the additional profits that she will generate, she plans to save and increase the surface area of her arable land.

Maria is the leader of the NOKLOUMAN group, which consists of women who are all involved in the cultivation of maize and rice.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Nèkè

texts.fr:
Né vers 1979 à Kocoula (région de Ségou), Monsieur Nèkè est un  polygame qui réside avec ses épouses et leurs 2 enfants à Wayerma I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso. 
Monsieur  Nèkè n’ayant pas la eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initié à l’activité blanchisserie depuis maintenant  sept ans. Il mène son activité dans son quartier où il dispose son atelier de blanchisserie. Monsieur  Nèkè est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de son travail et de sa ponctualité. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’ intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant quatre ans.
Il sollicite ce deuxième prêt pour acheter 2 Fers électrique, un table à repasser et 1 moto Jakarta occasion pour pouvoir récupérer et livrer les habits de ses clients qui  sont un peu loin de son atelier.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 175 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Nèkè was born around 1979 in Kocoula (a region of Ségou). He is a polygamist who lives with his wives and their two children in the district of Wayerma I, in the city of Sikasso. Never having had the opportunity to attend school, Nèkè pursued many business ventures without success. He eventually found his calling with his laundry business, which he has been running for seven years. His workshop and laundry are located in his neighborhood. Nèkè is in high demand among his customers due to the quality of his work and his punctuality.

In order to better serve his growing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, of which he has now been a member for four years. With this, his second loan, Nèkè plans to buy two electric irons, an ironing board and a Jakarta motorcycle. The motorcycle will allow him to pick up and deliver clothes to his customers that are further away from his workshop.

Nèkè hopes to earn a monthly income of 175,000 FCFA. He will use his income primarily to contribute to family expenses, and to pay the interest on his loan. The remainder he plans to use to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: to buy two electric irons, an ironing board, and a Jakarta motorcycle for making laundry deliveries.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms. Shamim is a 49-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is a laborer and does not earn sufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy rice and flour from the market at lower rates to stock her store. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues for personal expenses and part as business capital.

loans.use: To buy rice and flour

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
17 mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación han trabajado juntas y este es su cuarto ciclo. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que día a día quieren superarse y ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Julia, quien se dedica a lavar prendas. Ella es lavandera y comenta que está muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que gracias a este trabajo está saliendo adelante ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto.
Solicita esta ayuda para poder invertirlo en la compra de jabón en polvo, en barra, suavizante para prenda y demás, ya que estos son los insumos que más necesita para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Seventeen women in the city of Encarnación have worked together and are in their fourth loan cycle.  They're mothers and heads of household who want to improve themselves and help their families every day.

One of the group members is Julia, who makes a living washing clothes.  She comments that she's very proud of what she does because she's getting ahead thanks to this honorable and honest job.

She's requesting this loan to be able to buy soap powder, bar soap, fabric softener, and other supplies that are what she needs most to be able to continue working.

loans.use: to buy soap powder, bar soap, fabric softener, and other supplies

loans.name: Mungu Iko Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kyakimwa, conseillère de l’association de crédit « Mungu iko », est un entrepreneur dynamique, âgée de 36 ans, mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. Son mari est un petit commissionnaire, sans emploi fixe. Elle est vendeuse des boissons (Primus, Fanta). Elle installe ses marchandises dans son petit Kiosque. Elle commença son business avec son fonds propre reçu de son conjoint. Plus tard, elle bénéficia un fond additionnel de crédit de base  de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 5 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités pour la survie de sa famille. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser 18 cycles en profitant du programme de microcrédit de l’IMF Hekima. L’insécurité due aux inciviques dans la ville constitue une menace pour le développement de ses activités. Ainsi, donc, pour ce cycle son crédit a été revue à la baisse. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec la boisson (4 casiers de Primus, 3 casiers de Fanta, etc.). En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir et créer un bistro. La cliente salut l’initiative de Hekima pour ses actions dédiées à l’autonomisation des femmes non bancables.
texts.en: Kyakimwa, who is the counsellor of the Mungu iko credit association, is a dynamic businesswoman. She is 36 years old and mother of five children all of whom are students. Her husband is a small commission agent, who is without fixed employment. She sells drinks (Primus, Orange soda). She sets up her merchandise in her little kiosk. She started her business with her own money given to her by her husband. Later, she was the beneficiary of an additional sum from the IMF Hekima credit fund. She has been running these small businesses to assure her family's survival for over five years. However, she has now accomplished 18 loan cycles taking advantage of the IMF Hekima micro credit programme. Insecurity due to incivilities in town constitutes a threat to the development of her business. Thus, for this reason this loan has been diminished. This new loan will enable her to stock up with drinks (4 crates of Primus, 3 crates of orange soda, etc.). In addition, she hopes to see her children grow up and to create a bistro. This client pays tribute to Hekima's initiative for their actions devoted to helping non bankable women to be autonomous.

loans.use: to buy drinks (4 crates of Primus, 3 crates of orange soda, etc.)

loans.name: Kennia Adelaida

texts.es: Kennia de estado civil soltera, tiene 1 hija mayor de edad .Kennia cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de empleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró. Pues fue ahí entonces que decidió vender  todo lo referente a las ventas y lo que más le llamo la atención fue los cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar .perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc.
texts.en:
Kennia is single and has one adult daughter. Kennia says that she started this work because of the lack of employment that exists in the country, as she wanted to find work but couldn't.

It was then that she decided to consider all the different areas related to sales. What most caught her attention was cosmetics, and it has gone very well. She works in the afternoons to provide her neighbors with the products she has. 

Her dream is make improvements to her home.

With the loan, she wishes to buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorants, powders, etc.

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorants, powders etc.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Four years ago, Jameela started her own business, purchasing and selling cattle, with a loan from Kashf Foundation. Her husband is employed in a factory and earns a low salary. It was difficult for Jameela to manage all of the household expenditures with her husband's income. She then started her own business to contribute to the family income. She paid all her installments on time in previous loans. 

Jameela has one child, and she is happy to send him to a good school. She wants to build a good house for her family. She has some savings from her business and wants to purchase some cattle. So she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase some cattle and sell them near Eid-ul-Azha (a religious event). She hopes to get profit from it. She is thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase some cattle to sell

loans.name: Malik

texts.fr:
Né vers 1973 à Dioro, Monsieur Malik  est marié et père de quatre enfants.Il  habite avec sa famille à Sanoubougou I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso  (troisième région administrative de la république du mali) .
Monsieur Malik exerce les activités d’achat et de vente de Prêt à Porter depuis environ 14 ans et il dispose d’une boutique à la gare routière de Sanoubougou I. 
Vu l’augmentation de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles, il décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Avec ce cinquième prêt il compte acheter, 20 chemises différentes, 25 pantalons de qualité différentes, 20 paires de chaussure différentes (Soulier, Ferardine, etc.), 5 complets de veste, 20 Tee-Shirt et 15 complets de sous-vêtement. 
 Il s’approvisionne à Bamako afin de les revendre dans sa boutique située en pleine cœur de la gare routière de Sikasso avec une clientèle composée essentiellement de voyageurs et transporteurs.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui permettra d’augmenter son fonds de commerce mais également d’honorer ses engagements à l’égard de Soro Yiriwaso et couvrir d’autres dépenses familles.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in Dioro, Malik is married and a father of 4 children. He lives with his family in Sanoubougou I, one of the popular neighborhoods in the town of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Malik has been buying and selling ready-wear clothing for about 14 years. He has a shop at the Sanoubougou I bus terminal. 

Given the increase in customers, thanks to the quality of his clothing, Malik decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. With this 5th loan, he expects to buy 20 different shirts, 25 pairs of trousers of various quality, 20 assorted pairs of shoes (dress shoes, Ferardine shoes, etc), 5 suits, 20 t-shirts, and 15 sets of underwear. He procures his goods in Bamako in order to resell them in his shop situated in the middle of the Sikasso bus terminal to a customer base made up largely of travelers and freight operators.

With this loan, he expects to earn an average monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA, which will allow him to increase his business while equally honoring his commitments to Soro Yiriwaso and covering other family expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Florencia Georgina

texts.es: Georgina de estado civil divorciada, tiene hijos. Georgina Cuenta que comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de empleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró y a raíz que su ex esposo la abandono ella tuvo que luchar para llevar el pan de cada dia  a su hogar por eso Georgina  desde ese entonces que decidió vender todo lo referente a cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc.
texts.en: Georgina’s divorced and has three children.  She relates that she started this activity because of the lack of employment in the country; she wanted to find a job but couldn’t and because her husband abandoned her she had to struggle to put bread on the table and this is why Georgina decided from that moment on to sell everything related to cosmetics and she’s done very well.  She works afternoons offering the products she has to her neighbors.  She wants to use the loan to buy perfume, cream, cologne, deodorant, talc, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cologne, deodorant, talc, etc.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two. Four years ago, she started her own business buying and selling goats because the income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses. She started her business with the support of Kashf Foundation and purchased different animals for sale. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for four years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She desires to give her children a better future and the necessary education so they will succeed in life. For this purpose she wants to increase her business income and has applied a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy more goats in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus, 26, is a single gentleman who runs a kiosk, selling basic items like flour, beans, salt and cooking fat, among others. He has one year of experience in this business, and this has made him very familiar with sales, which enables him to obtain the best profits. The kiosk is located in his home in an area that has heavy foot traffic, and he has obtained a lot of customers.

Justus is a man committed to his work, and he feels proud of what he has achieved to date. He is keen to continue along his path and make every effort as he knows that in the end he will obtain a great reward: success. He needs capital to stock his kiosk with basic goods, which is why he is seeking a loan from Yehu to allow him to buy bales of flour, instant products, sweets, bread, etc.

loans.use: to buy bales of flour, instant products, sweets, bread, etc.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es: Norberto de treinta y nueve años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura  y se ha hecho de valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas; el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alto potencial agrícola, con suelo fértil y muy cercano a su vivienda, comercia en los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por los buenos precios, el producto de calidad y el excelente servicio; Norberto es un hombre alegre, emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, todos los días se entrega por completo a su trabajo pues ama lo que hace y sabe que eso lo conducirá al éxito, en la ultima temporada de siembra tuvo algunas perdidas y quiere recuperarse, necesita invertir y por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, herramienta, etc. Norberto tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía  que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Norberto, 39, lives with his life companion and their children in his own house.  He works growing corn and beans; he’s been working in agriculture for several years and has gained valuable experience that makes it possible for him to get good crop yields.   His parcel of farmland is located in an area with fertile soil of high agricultural potential that’s near his house.  He sells all around the location and has many customers who prefer him for the good prices, quality products and excellent service.

Norberto is a cheerful, enterprising man who is dedicated to his work.  He gives his all to his work every day because he loves what he does and knows it will lead him to success.   He had some losses last growing season and he wants to recuperate.  He needs to invest which is why he’s asking Integral for a loan to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, tools, etc.  Norberto has good payment references and is responsible.  He assures that he will be able to repay the loan while at the same time trusts that he will give his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; ella se dedica al cultivo de cereales, frijoles, maíz, entre otros, tiene varios años de trabajar en el rubro y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y cercano a su vivienda, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y el servicio inigualable siempre a la orden de los clientes; Ana es una mujer dedicada a su labor, responsable y emprendedora, dia a dia lucha por un futuro mas prospero y no piensa rendirse hasta lograr el éxito que desea, en la ultima temporada de siembra aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para aumentar la producción por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL  un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida etc. Ana Julia tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Julia, 47, lives with her life partner and her children. She has been growing beans and corn, among other cereals for many years, which has given her a lot of experience and the ability to obtain the best crops.

Her fields are located in an agricultural area, close to where she lives. She sells her products in the surrounding area of her community, and she has now many customers that choose her products because of their quality and good prices, and because she provides an unparalleled service, always listening to their needs.

Ana is a hard-working woman, responsible and enterprising. She strives every day for a better future and she will continue to do so until she succeeds. During the last sowing season, the demand increased and she wants to take the opportunity to increase production. This is why she is requesting a loan at INTEGRAL, in order to be able to buy corn seeds, bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide and other supplies.

Ana Julia has good references and impeccable morals. She assures that she will be able to pay the loan and at the same time she is confident that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, bean seeds, insecticide and herbicide.

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.ru: Абдуазиз обратился в МДО "Арванд", чтобы  привезти осенний товар.  Он досрочно погасив свой предыдущий кредит решил получить очередной кредит.  Он торгует на рынке мужской и детской обувью. Скоро начинается  сезон дождей и холодов торговля  пойдет  хорошо, поэтому он решил привезти товар. Его жена поддерживает его в бизнесе, когда Абдуазиз уезжает за товаром, она сидит за прилавком и торгует.   Его дети еще молоды, старшему 12 лет а младшему 5 лет. Он копит свои средства, для будущих своих детей. Старший сын мечтает поступить в престижный университет и стать врачом.  Поэтому Абдуазиз, хочет получить кредит чтобы улучшить свой ассортимент и привезти осенний товар, и тем самым увеличить свой капитал и доход.
texts.en: Abduaziz came to MDO Arvand to bring in autumn merchandise.  He repaid his previous loan early and decided to obtain another loan.  He sells men's and children's shoes at a market.  The rainy and cold season is starting soon, and sales will go well.  This is why Abduaziz decided to bring in merchandise now.  His wife supports him in the business and sits behind the counter and sells when he travels for merchandise.  His children are still small - the oldest is 12 and the youngest is 5 years old.  He is saving money for his children's future.  The oldest son dreams of getting accepted to a prestigious university and becoming a doctor.  This is why Abduaziz wants to obtain a loan to improve his selection and bring in autumn merchandise, and, thus, increase his capital and income.

loans.use: to purchase autumn merchandise

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is married with five children, three of whom attend school.  She also takes care of additional family members (old parents).  She has a retail shop and has applied for a loan of 1500000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more items (sugar, salt, soap, cooking oil, maize, flour, and rice).  She sells retail to many people seven days a week at the market.  Her major business challenges include transportation of commodities (from Kikuubo in Kampala city to her shop) and the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda.  She aspires to see her business grow into a wholesale shop and also to buy a delivery van to make transportation easier.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, maize, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is from Lanchkhuti district of West Georgia. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband and two grown sons. Her elder son works at cleaning services and the younger is a logistic at the kindergarten. Nani runs the agricultural business. In particular, she has two milk cows for dairy products. The family grows nuts and maize on the family-owned land. In addition, the family has a pig, eleven piglets and bee hives with bee colonies,which give them honey.  Nani sells her agricultural products at the local open market.

She has requested a loan to purchase agricultural land. The land has a profitable location for her bee-keeping business and Nani will arrange bee-hives there to increase their productivity.  This will give her an opportunity to expand the family business and get an increased income.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land and place bee-hives there.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de postales que junto con su esposo venden en forma inpendiente,la socia tambien sigue trabajando enseñando a niños del nivel primario,la socia vende los postales desde las 3:00 p.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,y en las mañanas trabaja enseñando niños,la socia ya tiene 6 años en su negocio de venta de posteles,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender los postales.La socia solicita le credito para comprar materiales para las postales como papeles y pinturas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues working selling post-cards that she and her husband sell independently.  She also continues working as an elementary school teacher.  She sells post-cards from 3pm to 7pm and works mornings teaching children.  She’s been in the post-card selling business for six years.  Her dream is to have a locale wherein to sell her post-cards.  She requests the loan to buy materials like paint and paper for the post-cards.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy paint and paper.

loans.name: Yerson Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba pero ahora vive en la ciudad de Huayocari de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, él tiene 28 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, él se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura pues es una herencia de sus padres pero él también trabaja como chofer de maquinaria pesada para una entidad pública y le va muy bien, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar abano entre otras cosas, él pertenece al banco comunal “Pro Mujer De Huayocari” de la Asociación Arariwa pues es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Yerson Alfredo was born in the city of Huayllabamba, but now lives in the city of Huayocari in the province of Calca, in Cusco department. He's 28 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children. He raises livestock and farms, as he inherited land from his parents, but he also works as a heavy equipment operator for the state entity, and it is going very well. 

On this occasion, he needs the loan to buy fertilizer and other supplies. He belongs to the "Pro Mujer de Huayocani" communal bank of Asociación Arariwa, as he is a responsible person.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Johana Vanessa

texts.es: Johana tiene 43 años de edad estado civil divorciada, tiene 2 hijos que estudian en una escuela publica. Desde que era muy joven Johana su madre le enseño lo que la confección de ropa eso a ella le encanto por lo que ahora ese es su  trabajo ella comenzó con una maquina en su casa y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio, la cual elabora camisas, pantalones. Por eso con el préstamo ella quiere comprar cosas como: hilo, tela y otra máquina de coser etc.
texts.en: Johana, 43, is divorced and has two children attending public school.  Since she was very young Johana’s mother taught her dressmaking and she loved it.  This is now her occupation.  She started out with a sewing machine at home and the business has gradually been growing.  She makes shirts and pants.  She wants the loan to buy such things as thread, fabric, another sewing machine, etc.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, another sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es:
Samuel es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de su madre ocupando solo una habitación, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona La Merced en la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas ala día y a veces toda la noche en una empresa privada y con lo que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia ya que vive con su madre que esta delicada de salud y es mayor de edad.
El crédito lo requiere para compra de arena, cemento, ladrillos, ya que desea refaccionar la entrada principal de su casa para tener más seguridad.
El sueño de Samuel es mejorar sus ingresos y poder ser más independiente para tener más comodidad y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Samuel is single and has no children.  He lives in his mother’s house occupying a single bedroom.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s La Merced zone.  He currently works more than 10 hours daily and sometimes all night for a private firm and uses what he earns to cover food and basic utility costs for his family since he lives with his mother and she’s in poor health and of advanced age.

He needs the loan to buy sand, cement and bricks because he wants to reinforce the house’s main entrance in order to have better security.  Samuel’s dream is to improve his income in order to be more independent and have more comfort and improve his quality of life.  This is the second time he’s worked with Impro and first with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand to reinforce his mother's house's main entrance.

loans.name: Mirabel Akwi

texts.en:
She was born in 1985 and she is married with two children. She lives in Bamenda, North West region of Cameroon, with her two children.

She has encountered a good number of challenges in her life which include: She dropped out of school because there was no money to continue paying for her school fees. Ill health has also been a serious problem in her family, even to the extent of her losing family members. 

Notwithstanding the above mentioned difficulties, she also suffers from inadequate capital to start up and run a small business of her own which will enable her to cater for her children’s school fees, rent, bills and others. With this loan she intends to buy day-old chicks and feed. Her activity will assist her community, providing them with chicken during festivity periods.

With the proceed from this loan she will educate her children and cater for her children’s hospital bills, ploughing back profit and expanding her business and increasing her savings for difficult days. She prefers a loan from GHAPE because of the gradual installment payments and the low interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase day old chicks and feed

loans.name: Eyvaz

texts.en:
Eyvaz is a 53 year old man, who is married and has one son. He is a sheep breeder and has 20 head of sheep in his herd. He has 16 years of experience in this field.   His wife is a housekeeper, who keeps house and helps her husband to look after sheep. He also has a garden where he raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. 

The village where Eyvaz lives is located in the southern part of Azerbaijan, which has very rigorous climate conditions. In the summer the temperature reaches 105 degrees fahrenheit.  The main problem in the region is water for irrigation and for animals.  Eyvaz is not able to build a water channel for his garden alone. This is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment.   When he heard about water loans, he was extremely excited and applied for a 2000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment, like a tractor for making a water channel, and to hire workers who will dig the land.

He is a trustworthy client of AqroInvest and has a good client history.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment and to hire people

loans.name: Eldaniz

texts.en:
Eldaniz is a 35-year-old farmer who keeps 30 head of sheep and raises wheat. He has 14 years of experience in this field. He is single and his brother and mother help him to run the business. His monthly income is 300 AZN and he has only one wish now--to pipe water to his fields and to his house. Now to water his cows he pastures them to about 1 kilometer to the nearest river. 

When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2000 AZN loan. Making a water channel is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment. He will use this loan to pay for renting special equipment like a tractor for making a water channel and for workers who will dig the land. This will be his fifth loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment rental and for hiring laborers to make a water channel

loans.name: Sando

texts.en: Sando is 35-years old and resides with her husband and three children at Paynesville South.  Her children are between the ages of 2 and 15 and two of the children are in school.  She has a table in the market where she sells rice, onions, pepper, palm oil, black pepper, and salt for the past six years.  She first started by selling mineral water.  Because she always has what her customers need, she make a profit when she sells.  She has requested her third loan to purchase more palm oil, pepper, salt, onion, and rice in order to increase her sales.  Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase food items for resale.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Doña María es la propietaria de un restaurante ubicado en la hermosa ciudad de Bogotá, el cual inició desde el año 1980, cuando observó que en el sector donde estaba ubicada, no existía este tipo de negocios y había muchos trabajadores que no encontraban un lugar cercano para desayunar y almorzar. Fue así,  como decidida inició su emprendimiento,  ofreciendo desayunos,  a los que poco a poco agregó almuerzos diarios, como comidas corrientes y los fines de semana platos especiales, instalada en un local ubicado en su domicilio. Para doña Maria, su día de trabajo lo inicia desde las 4 de la mañana y termina su actividad a las 3:30 de la tarde. Sus principales clientes son profesores de los colegios distritales cercanos y vecinos que conocen la calidad con que prepara los alimentos y a los que les ahorra la preparación especialmente en  los fines de semana. En la actualidad su sueño de crecimiento no se detiene y sabe que necesita ofrecer una mayor variedad de menús diarios, para consolidarse en el sector, y permanecer muy competitiva y por eso planea agregar el servicio domicilio y más adelante crear otro punto donde vender sus alimentos preparados. En su experiencia de 32 años, conoce que necesita invertir y los créditos son una alternativa de crecimiento empresarial, esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará mesas, para aumentar sus clientes en la potencialidad del barrio y comprar en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos, como carnes frutas, verduras y bebidas refrescantes que complementen los deliciosos platos, que en el restaurante de Doña María se ofrecen en un ambiente confortable que agrada a su clientela y a la que ella quiere fidelizar.
texts.en:
Maria is the owner of a restaurant located in the beautiful city of Bogotá. 

She started this business in 1980, when she observed that the location did not have this type of business, and there were many workers did not have a nearby place to eat breakfast and lunch. It was then she began as an entrepreneur, offering breakfast to those who little by little began eating lunch as well. She served ready-to-eat meals and special weekend dishes in her home. 

Maria begins work from 4:00 in the morning until 3:30 in the afternoon. 

Her primary customers are teachers in the local district schools, neighbors who know the quality of the food well, and those who save up for meals especially on weekends. 

Currently, her dream of growth has not stopped. She knows she has to offer a greater variety in her daily menus in order to be successful and remain competitive. For this reason, she plans to add to her home service and later create another location to sell her prepared meals. 

In her 32 years of experience, she knows that she needs to invest, and that loans are an alternative way to grow a business. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan, the first made by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

She will use the loan to buy tables, to increase the number of customers from the neighborhood, buy ingredients at wholesale pricing, like meat, fruits, vegetables, and soda, to complement her delicious meals. 

In Maria's restaurant, she offers a comfortable environment that pleases her customers so she can make them loyal ones.

loans.use: to buy tables, ingredients such as meat, fruit, vegetables, and soda.

loans.name: Bencolleter

texts.en:
Bencolleter is a 43-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 15 years and 23 years. She describes herself to be a social and talkative woman.

She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located near an urban area and her primary customers are residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. 

She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy clothes materials for making clothes for selling. Her business goal is to improve her business and create job opportunities for people within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for making clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jesus Alejandro

texts.es: Jesus de 35 años de edad, es el propietario de una tienda ubicada en su domicilio; él inicio su negocio, porque aprendió a trabajar independiente con la experiencia tradicional de su padre y su abuela. En su tienda, Jesus vende artículos de la canasta familiar, como ranchos, víveres, refrescos, y todos los productos que consumen las familias y que algunas comunidades solo pueden acceder a pequeñas porciones o al detal diariamente, de acuerdo a lo que ingresos que tenga cada hogar. En la tienda, sus principales clientes son las amas de casa vecinas y también visitantes del barrio, cuando necesitan responder a un deseo  o a una necesidad, que allí  pueden solucionar. Sus ventas son directas en mostrador y posee un punto comercial bien posicionado de mas de 20 años,  cuando sus padres y abuelos en él trabajaban y  que ahora él y su hermana reciben,  para que se desempeñen bien y tengan sus propios ingresos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará, productos lácteos, enlatados, embutidos y artículos de miscelánea, para aprovechar con estos últimos artículos,  que se acercan las fiestas y la demanda en el mercado aumenta.   Con su anterior crédito con la Fundación, manifiesta que mejoraron las ventas de su negocio y que este se ha fortalecido aun mas y es lo que justamente espera al invertir su credikiva, pues diversificará y le apuntará a vender cada vez mas, en el segundo semestre del año, donde usualmente las ventas de todos los productos, ocupan el pico mas alto de su cima.
texts.en:
Jesús is 35 years old and is the owner of a store located in his home. He started his business because he learned to work independently with the traditional experience of his father and grandmother. In his store, Jesús sells articles from the basic food basket, such as snacks, staple foods, drinks, and all products consumed by households. Some communities only have access to small portions or products in retail daily, depending on the income of each household. 

In the store, his main customers are neighboring housewives and also neighborhood visitors when they need to respond to a desire or a need, which can be solved there. His sales are direct at the counter and he has a point of sale well-positioned after more than 20 years, when his parents and grandparents worked there. Now, he and his sister work there, so they can do their job well and earn their own income.

Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy dairy products, canned goods, cold meat, and miscellaneous items. With the last items he wants to take advantage of the Holidays, when market demand increases.

With his previous loan with the Foundation, he says he improved sales of his business, which has strengthen it even more. This is exactly what he expects about this Kiva loan investment, to diversify and to sell more and more in the second half of the year, when the sales of all products usually increase to the highest peak.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, canned goods, cold meat and miscellaneous items,

loans.name: Cruz Magdalena

texts.es: Cruz tiene 56 años estado civil casada. Tiene hijos mayores de edad. Cruz cuenta que tuvo que ver la manera de cómo generar dinero a su casa por la falta de empleo que existe en el país. La cual  tomo la decisión  de ponerse una tienda en su casa de venta de bebidas como: gaseosas, agua. El negocio a ella le está resultando muy por lo que su sueño es surtir más su tienda. Con el préstamo  Cruz comprara, bebidas, víveres, arroz, aceite etc.
texts.en: Cruz is 56 years old, single, and has adult children. Cruz says that she had to find a way to generate money for the household due to the lack of employment that exists in the country. So she made the decision to set up a store in her home, and sell drinks such as soft drinks and water. With the loan, Cruz will buy drinks, groceries, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: To buy drinks, groceries, rice, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Baxsheyish

texts.en:
Baxsheyish is 63 years old and on a pension. He breeds cows for milk purposes and has 20 years of experience in this field. He is married and has one son who helps him run the business. He has regular customers and his business brings him a stable income of 150 AZN. However, there is only one problem he has which is the lack of water. Several years ago he bought land for cultivating vegetables, but it is still unused because there was no water for irrigation. Meanwhile, to water his cows, he pastures them at the nearest river about 1 kilometer away. 

When he heard about water loans he was extremely excited and applied for a 2000 AZN loan. Building a water channel is quite an expensive process which requires labor and special equipment.  He will use this loan to pay for special equipment rentals, like a tractor, to build the water channel and for workers who will dig the land. This will be his second loan and he has good client history.
