loans.use: to pay for special equipment to rent and for labor.

loans.name: Victoria Esperanza

texts.es: Victoria de  estado civil viuda, tiene hijos mayores de edad Desde que era muy joven victoria fue a aun curso de corte y confección,  lo que ahora ese es su  trabajo ella comenzó con una maquina en su casa y poco a poco ha ido creciendo su negocio, la cual elabora camisas, pantalones , con la ayuda de una de sus hijas . Por eso con el préstamo ella quiere comprar cosas como: hilo, tela y otra máquina de coser etc.
texts.en: Victoria’s a widow and has three adult children.  Since she was very young Victoria took a dressmaking course and this has become her occupation.  She started out with a sewing machine at home and gradually the business has been growing.  She makes shirts and pants with help from one of her daughters.  She wants to use the loan to buy such things as thread, fabric, another sewing machine, etc.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, another sewing machine, etc.

loans.name: Kalidou

texts.fr:
Né vers 1983 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Kalidou est célibataire et réside chez son père dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
Kalidou s’est très vite initié depuis plus de deux années à cette activité d’achat et vente des téléphones portables et leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.) Son activité est menée dans sa boutique située aux abords d'une route très fréquentée avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant douze mois.
Il sollicite ce deuxième crédit qui lui permettant d’acheter à Bamako 15 DVD, 8 téléviseurs, 45 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 5 cartons de façade, une quinzaine de chargeurs, 25 paquets de carte mémoire, 15 cartons de batterie et 12 douzaines d’écouteur de différentes sortes. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 275 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1983 in Sikasso, Kalidou is single and lives with his father. They both live with their large traditional family in Medina, one of the popular districts in the city of Sikasso.

For over two years, Kalidou has been running his business buying and selling mobile phones and their accessories (face plates, batteries, chargers, earphones, etc.). He conducts his business in his own shop located on the side of a very busy road, and his clientele is composed of people from all walks of life. He is very sought after by his clients due to the high quality of the products he sells.

In order to better serve his ever-increasing customer base, twelve months ago Kalidou decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his second loan with the institution. With this loan, he plans go to Bamako (the capital of Mali) to purchase 15 DVDs, eight televisions, 45 mobile phones of different brands, five cartons of face plates, 15 phone chargers, 25 packs of memory cards, 15 cartons of batteries, and 12 dozen assorted earphones.

He hopes to earn a monthly income of 275,000 FCFA. This income will be used primarily to contribute to family expenses, to pay the interest on his loan and to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase DVDs, TVs, mobile phones and phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Josprinter

texts.en: Josprinter is a 31-year-old married woman with 5 children.  She describes herself to be social and talkative.  She operates a retail business where she sells baskets.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  Her business is located near an urban area and her primary customers are residents from environs.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to improve the business.  She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy baskets to resell.  Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.  She hopes that in the future she will educate her children.  Josprinter is also a farmer and she practices farming during her leisure time for additional income.  This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more baskets to resell.

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of seven children. She is in the milk-selling business and most of her clients are her neighbors.  She makes enough to lead a decent life. Her husband and a son run a Rikshaw (auto) business in town and one son works as a power loan worker. Five other children attend school. The circle of her family is running through four breadwinners. 

She is in charge of providing her family with good food and also providing for their health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business with a loan from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy another cow to meet the increasing demands of her customers. The combination of  her loan and savings would enable her to purchase another cow. She hopes to have more profits and better support her family. She will spend a portion of the profit earned on the better education of her children.

loans.use: to buy another cow to meet the increasing demands of her customers.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia nació en la ciudad de Huayocari y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (El distrito de Huayocari pertenece a la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco), ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene siete hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura pues es una herencia de sus padres entonces ella siembra y cosecha verduras como por ejemplo zanahorias, brocoli, cebollas, habas y otras más para luego venderlas en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del Sicuani donde le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y para hacer trabajar los terrenos de cultivos, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pro Mujer De Huayocari” de la Asociación Arariwa pues una persona responsable y colaboradora.
texts.en: Lucia was born in the city of Huayocari and lives in the same city where she was born. (The district of Huayocari is part of the province of Calca in the department of Cusco). She is 62 years old and is married, and as a result of this beautiful relationship has 7 children. She in in agriculture for a living as it is the heritage of her family. She plants and harvests vegetables such as carrots, broccoli, onions, lima beans and more, to later sell in one of the markets in the city of Sicuani where it is going very well. For this opportunity she is requesting a loan to buy seeds and to work to cultivate the land. She belongs to the communal bank "Pro Mujer De Huayocari" or "Pro Women of Huayocari" from the Arariwa Association as she is a collaborative and responsible person.

loans.use: to buy seeds and cultivate the land.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en: A few years ago, Shama started a beauty parlor in a room that had been used for storage. She utilized this neglected part of her home for a productive purpose as she knew that her family needed extra income. She also knew that her parents must also be collecting things for her marriage and she needed to support them. She works tirelessly to keep the business running. She told Kashf that it was getting extremely difficult to manage the family as the parlor was running on minimum necessities and clients were hesitant to use the services because of the shortage of necessary items. That’s when she took a loan of RS 20,000 from Kashf and said that she will be investing in buying utensils, cosmetics, creams and makeup kits. She is hopeful to increase her income by facilitating more customers at a time.

loans.use: to buy utensils, cosmetics, creams and makeup kits in larger quantity.

loans.name: Ziya

texts.en:
Ziya is a 36-year-old farmer who raises crops such as fruits, vegetables, wheat, and corn. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his family in an IDP Settlement. His son helps him and Ziya hopes that one day his son will continue the family business.  

The IDP Settlement was built several years ago, and there are still some utility problems such as the water supply. People are suffering and he orders special cars with water to irrigate his crops, especially in summertime, when the temperature reaches 105 degrees Fahrenheit.

Ziya’s monthly income is 200 AZN. However, this is not enough to build a water channel for his crops because it is quite an expensive process which requires a labor force and special equipment. When Ziya heard about water loans, he was extremely excited and applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will use this loan to pay for special equipment like a tractor for making a water channel and for workers who will dig the land.

Ziya is a trustworthy client of AqroInvest and has a good client history.

loans.use: to pay for special equipment and hire laborers.

loans.name: Maria Jacqueline

texts.es: María tiene 46 años estado civil soltera tiene hijos. Ella que tuvo que ver la manera de cómo generar dinero a su casa por la falta de empleo que existe en el país. Ella  tomo la decisión  de ponerse una tienda en su casa de venta de bebidas como: gaseosas, agua. El negocio a ella le está resultando muy por lo que su sueño es surtir más su tienda. Con el préstamo  María comprara, bebidas, víveres, arroz, aceite etc.
texts.en: María is 46 years old, is single and has children. Due to the lack of employment existing in the country, she had to find a way to make money for her household. She decided to start a store in her home selling drinks such as sodas and water. The business is working very well for her, and her dream is to stock better her store. With the loan, María will buy drinks, food, rice, oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy drinks, food, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Nazaria

texts.es: Nazaria nació en el distrito de Huayllabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Huayllabamba pertenece a la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco), ella tiene 41 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura pues es una herencia de sus padres entonces ella siembra y cosecha verduras y frutas como por ejemplo zanahorias, brocoli, cebollas, habas, manzanas, duraznos, blanquillo, menbrillos y otras más para luego venderlas en a las revenderos de diferentes mercados pues le va muy bien, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo chanchos, cuyes y gallinas, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar chanchos y cuyes,  ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pro Mujer De Huayocari” de la Asociación Arariwa pues una persona responsable y colaboradora.
texts.en: Nazaria was born in Huayllabamba District and still lives in the same district she was born in.  (Huayllabamba District belongs to Calca Province in Cusco Department).  She’s 41-years-old and is in a common law relationship; she has five children.  She works in agriculture which was an inheritance from her parents.  She grows and harvests vegetables and fruit like carrots, broccoli, onions, lima beans, apples, peaches, white peaches, quince and others to then sell to resellers in various street markets.  She does very well.  She also works raising small animals like pigs, guinea pigs and chickens.  On this occasion she wants a loan to buy pigs and guinea pigs.  She’s a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “Pro Mujer de Huayocari” communal bank and she’s a responsible, cooperative person.

loans.use: to buy pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Silvia Auma

texts.en:
Silvia is a 33y-year-old businesswoman who lives in Juba. She is married and has three children, ages of 4 to 10.  All of them go to school.

Silvia runs a general store, and she has been in business for three years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through other clients. 

She is requesting a loan of SDG 2000 to buy maize, beans, and many other items.  In addition to this business, she has no other source of income.

In five years Silvia would like to expand her business. Her major challenges include high prices in the market.

Silvia says she is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva

loans.use: for buying more items, like maize, beans, onions, etc.

loans.name: Phatih

texts.en:
Ms. Phatih is a 48-year-old married woman. She is hardworking lady and committed to her family and work. She has been in the business of waan-making for the last fifteen years. Waan is a plant like long grass and is used to make ropes after drying. These ropes used for many different purposes. She serves well in her community. 

Ms. Phatih is responsible to provide for her five children. Her husband also helps her in her business by purchasing grass and selling ropes in the market. In order to improve her business she has requested for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase two more machines for rope-making. She is hopeful to improve her income through her increased production. She dreams of spending part of this income on the well-being of her children.

loans.use: To purchase two more machines for ropes making.

loans.name: Muazzama

texts.ru:
Муаззама жительница района Хуросон. Она замужем. Ей 33 года. У нее четверо детей. Муж Муаззамы занимается строительными работами по найму. 
Муаззама предоставляет услугу. Она работает на рынке. У нее имеется собственная небольшая столовая, где она более пяти лет работает поваром. Муаззама берет кредит для покупки продуктов и приобретения посуды.
texts.en: Muazzama is a resident of the Khuroson district.  She is 33 years old, married and has four children.  Her husband is involved in construction work to-hire.  Muazzama provides a service.  She works at a market.  She has a small cafe, where she has been working as a chef for over five years.  Muazzama is requesting this loan to purchase products and dishware.

loans.use: to purchase products and dishware

loans.name: Jerrlyn

texts.en:
Jerrlyn is 23 years old and single, with a daughter who is one year old and in playcare.  She lives at  Paynesville South.   Jerrlyn stopped her education in the eighth grade.  

She has been involved with her business for the past five years.  She sells sardines, lunch meat, hair grease, mayonnaise, milk, toothpaste, and many other Items.   She started  in this business with a little amount  that she received from her father. She makes a profit when she sells and uses the profit to improve her business and attend to the needs of her child. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more sardines, lunch meat, milk, hair grease, and toothpaste for the business. Her plan is to buy land and build a decent house.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, lunch meat, milk, hair grease,  and toothpaste for her business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian, 39, stopped her education in the 10th grade. She lives in Paynesville South with her friend and her son, who is 1 year of age and is currently in school. She has been selling in the community market for the past ten years. She sells cooking oil, rice, pepper, onion, vita (a juice drink), tomatoes, and many other items. She is proud of her business because she makes a profit, and with the profit she buys more goods and meets the educational expenses of her child. She is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more onions, cooking oil, rice, pepper and vita for the business.  Her plan is to give her son a higher level of education and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil, rice, pepper and vita, for the business.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge tiene 55 años estado civil soltero tiene hijos mayores de edad. Jorge comenzó  a trabajar en un negocio familiar en lo que es la ebanistería, comenzó hacer puertas, muebles y ese ha sido su fuente de ingreso a su familia. El trabaja solo desde las 8.00am hasta 18:00pm a veces lo ayuda un sobrino de Él. Con el préstamo Jorge quiere comprar: madera, maquinas de tallar, herramientas etc.
texts.en: Jorge is 55 years old, is single and has children who are adults. Jorge began working in a family business which was a cabinetmaker's workshop. He began making doors, furniture, and this has been his source of income for his family. He works only from 8:00am to 6:00pm, and sometimes his nephew helps him. With the loan, Jorge will buy wood, carving machines, tools, etc.

loans.use: to buy wood, carving machines, tools, etc.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 26-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from one to ten years. She describes herself as a quiet woman. She operates a restaurant where she sells food, tea and snacks. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located near an urban area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power blackouts at night, which mean she is unable to work at night. 

Josephine will use the KES 5,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals for her customers. She also sells charcoal to her local customers and intends to promote her two businesses with the additional sales income she gets. Her business goal is to run a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children. This is Josephine's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell to her customers

loans.name: Luz Del Transito

texts.es: Luz del transito de 39 anos de edad. Casada con dos hijos de 19,8 anos los dos están estudiando. Ella pertenece al departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Su actividad económica es la venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos. Experiencia en el negocio 8 anos.  Luz del transito es una mujer muy trabajadora responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Su forma de trabajo es unas 10 horas diaria de forma ambulante. Ella tiene clientes establecidos a los cuales les ofrece su mercadería al crédito recuperando quincenalmente. Negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un ingreso mas para la familia  y ayudar con los gastos del hogar, que afrentar muchos gastos económicos. En la actualidad el negocio ha sido rentable y visto ganancias y mejoría en sus ingresos.  El objetivo del préstamo es invertir en capital trabajo y surtir su negocio como ropa nueva como pantalones, faldas, blusas, ropa interior, camisetas. Luz del transito tiene sueños y metas como es ver formados a sus hijos en un profesional. Luz del Transito agradece la ayuda de los inversionista kiva  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre económicamente como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Luz del Transito is 39 years old, married, and has two children (ages 19 and 8) who are studying. She lives in the Department of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. Her business involves selling new clothes and cosmetics. She has eight years of experience. Luz del Transito is a hardworking and responsible woman who desires to achieve personal growth. Her job involves working about 10 hours a day as a street vendor. She has established customers to whom she offers her merchandise. Luz del Transito offers her merchandise on credit and collects payment every 15 days.

Her business emerged out of necessity because she had to have income for her family and to help with the many household expenses. At the moment, her business is profitable and she has seen improvements in her earnings and her income. The goal of this loan is to invest the money as operating capital for purchasing new clothes such as trousers, skirts, blouses, undergarments, and T-shirts.

Luz del Transito has dreams and goals, such as seeing her children become professionals. She is grateful for the assistance Kiva lenders are providing to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries, such as Nicaragua. This enables them to have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy trousers, skirts, blouses, undergarments, and T-shirts.

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is 43 years old and married, with four children.  

He recycles old vehicle tires to make sandals, which he sells to make profit.  Besides, he does farming for extra income generation.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business, hence his improving living standards.

He needs a loan of KES 20,000 to buy old vehicle tires for making sandals.  Duncan desires to own permanent business premises in the future.

loans.use: To buy old vehicle tires for making sandals

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат  певец. Он солист  группы и  почти  12 лет  зарабатывает этим видом деятельности себе на жизнь. Фуркат женат и имеет на воспитании троих детей. Его жена работает медсестрой в детской поликлинике. Фуркат живет со своими родителями.  Он всегда мечтал построить свой  дом и в прошлом году он начал строить дом но закончить на смог так как у него не хватило   денежных средств.   Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.   Фуркат хочет достроить дом и в ближайшем будущем переехать туда. На полученный кредит хочет купить строительные материалы. Благодарит  Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Furkat is a singer.  He is a soloist in a group and has been earning a living with this type of work for almost 12 years.  Furkat is married and raising three children.  His wife works as a nurse at a children's hospital.  Furkat lives with this parents.  He always dreamed of building his own house and started building it last year, but could not finish the construction because he did not have enough money.  This is why he came to Arvand for financial support.  Furkat wants to finish building the house and move there in the near future.  He wants to purchase construction materials with this loan.  He thanks Arvand for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials and finish building his house

loans.name: Medjikoué Geneviève's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Medjikoué Geneviève la responsable, âgée de 30 ans, est mariée et mère de 04 enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 15ans et 06 ans. Elle vend des condiments depuis quelques années et fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'augmenter son capital et de couvrir les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un appui financier à Finadev en vue d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Medjikoué Geneviève se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group of two women who are joint loan guarantors. Medjikoué Geneviève, the leader,  is 30 years old, and married with four children all of which go to school. The oldest is 15 and the youngest is six. She has been selling condiments for some years and buys her stock at a market in Benin. Hoping to increase her capital and satisfy her customers' expectations, she has requested and obtained financial support from Finadev in order to increase her supplementary income and participate in the cost of her children's school fees. Medjikoué Geneviève is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 5 baskets of tomatoes, 2 baskets of pimentos, 1 basket of onions, 1 box of cubes, 1 bowl of corn and 1 bowl of beans

loans.name: Newton

texts.en:
Newton is a 30-year-old man. He is married to Lucy and is a father of four children. He lives in Kiambu with his family. He buys and sells used clothes in the local area and has been doing so for three years. He makes a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This will be Newton's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of clothes for resale. In the future he wants to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en: Manuel used his previous loan to buy classroom furniture. Now his pupils have a good learning environment. His desire is to construct more classrooms in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES to buy books and writing materials for the classroom.

loans.use: To buy books and writing materials for the classroom

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann, who is a teacher by profession, requested a loan of KES 20,000 that she used to buy books, chairs, and tables.  The number of pupils has grown, and she has employed one more person in the school.   Now, she has seven employees.

She hopes to grow the kindergarten school and buy a school bus.  She has requested a loan of KES 50,000 to buy a piece of land for the school expansion.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for school expansion.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 35 years old, married, and blessed with a four-year-old child.  

He does farming, mainly growing tomatoes, french beans, and kale.  He also does livestock farming.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has adopted a savings culture because he has been trained in financial management.

Michael needs a loan of KES 10,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.  He hopes to expand his farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Pauline Laure

texts.fr: Laure est jeune femme âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 1 mois et 16 ans quatre de ses enfants sont  scolarisés.Elle est commerçante dans un quartier de la capitale où elle ouvert call box dans lequel elle commercialise le crédit de communication et les friandises depuis 1 an. Sa gentillesse et sa sociabilité ont fait d' elle une commerçante incontournable dans son domaine d'activité.Voulant étendre et son activité,elle sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d' augmenter les stocks de marchandises, et de friandises pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle qui augmente au jour le jour et augmenter son bénéfice. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et épargnera le reste pour aider son époux à résoudre certains besoins de leur famille.
texts.en:
Laure is a young woman, 37 years old, married, and the mother of five children, who range in age from 1 month to 16 years. Four of her children are in school. Laure is a merchant in her district of the capital where she opened a call box. There, she has been selling phone minutes and snacks for a year. Her kindness and sociability has made her into a  businesswoman who cannot be ignored in her business domain. 

Wanting to extend her business, she is requesting a loan enabling her to increase her inventory of merchandise and snacks, so as to increase her profits and to satisfy further a customer base growing from day to day and to. She will reinvest part of her profits into her business and save the rest in order to help out her husband in resolving certain family needs.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of phone minutes and snacks to sell

loans.name: Ndelila

texts.en:
Ndelila is 59 years old, married and has five children. She is so talented in weaving. In her local community, she is famous because of her well-woven baskets. This has earned her a good reputation, hence attracting customers. In addition, she does farming for more income generation.

Ndelila hopes to expand the business in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy sisal (an agave fiber) for weaving.

loans.use: to buy sisal for weaving

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is widowed with three children.  She is able to raise her children with the income from her dairy farming business.  She has only been farming for two years and has really improved her business.  Through the training conducted by Faulu Kenya in business management, she has learned how to plan and budget.

Margaret hopes to expand her farm in the future.  She needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Joseph Jojo

texts.fr: Joseph est un homme de 33 fiançé père de deux enfants de 6 et 8 ans qui vont à l'école. il est commerçant et a ouvert une petite boutique dans laquelle il vend des accessoires téléphoniques et crédit de communication depuis 7 ans. son activité fonctionne grâce à son bon emplacement et son expérience dans ce domaine qui lui ont permis d'agrandir sa clientèle au fil du temps. Il sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de marchandise saccessoires téléphoniques ainsi que le crédit de communication) celà lui permettra d'éviter la rupture de stock à laquelle il est souvent confronté pour cause la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à faire écouler une bonne partie de son stock pour pouvoir s'approvisionner à nouveau. Ceci va lui permettra non seulement de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, mais aussi d'augmenter ses ventes et donc ses bénéfices. Il réinvestira une partie de ces bénéfices dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Joseph is a 33-year-old man who is engaged to be married. He is a father with two children, aged 6 and 8, who go to school. Joseph is a merchant and has opened a small shop. He has been selling phone accessories and phone minutes there for seven years. His business is due to having a good location and to his experience in this domain. This has enabled him to grow his customer base over the course of time. 

Joseph is requesting a loan to increase his stock of phone accessories, as well as phone minutes, thus enabling him to avoid merchandise shortages, with which he is often confronted, since his meager capital compels him to sell a good part of his inventory in order to be able to stock up again. He would not only be able to satisfy his customers further but also to increase his sales and therefore his profits. 

He will reinvest part of his profits into his business to expand it. And the rest will allow in to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of phone accessories, as well as phone minutes to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 62 years old and married, with six children.  

He does farming to earn a living.  He mainly grows tomatoes and cabbages.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to grow his business.  He has also been trained in financial management.  This has helped him to save his money.

Simon needs a loan of KES 20,000 to buy fertilizer and seeds. He hopes to become financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 39 years old, married, and has four children.  He raises livestock, mainly rearing goats.  He employs one person in his business.  

Francis is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, which he will use to buy goats.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has expanded his business.  His desire is to own more goats in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay his laborers.

loans.name: Alcatraz Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alcatraz es la primera vez que esta solicitando un crédito a la institución, están muy comprometidos en no quedar mal, es un grupo conformado por cuatro personas los cuales todos tiene una diferente actividad productiva y es por eso que están solicitando un crédito para invertir en sus actividades como por ejemplo Juan invertirá en su invernadero de frambuesas, Guillermo y Cecilia en una tienda de abarrotes y Virginia en un molino de nixtamal. El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque Alcatraz significa abundancia. 

Juan es el representante del grupo, tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, siempre ha vivido en comunidad y por el momento se encuentra viviendo con sus padres. Juan tiene un invernadero de frambuesas, platica que obtuvo su invernadero gracias un apoyo por parte del papá de su novia “Yo no sabia nada acerca de frambuesas pero recibimos una capacitación donde aprendí a plantarlas y como hacer que crezcan pare obtener una buena cosecha". Juan tiene 8 meses de experiencia en esta actividad. Lamentablemente, no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para hacer crecer su negocio, es por eso que solicita un crédito. Con el apoyo de VisionFund México, comprará tubos, plantas de frambuesas y hule. Para Juan es emocionante ver la cantidad de cosecha que obtuvo en los 6 meses pasados, especialmente porque la cosecha de frambuesa es exportada a los Estados Unidos "aunque me va muy bien con mi negocio, sí me gustaría hacerlo mas grande para poder mejorar mi calidad de vida y mi vivienda". Juan está muy agradecido con la institución ya que gracias al crédito podrá comprar el material que le hace falta para su huerto.
texts.en:
This is the first time the “Alcatraz” group is requesting a loan from the institution.  They are very committed to do well.  It’s a group of four people each with a different productive activity and this is why they are requesting a loan to invest in their respective activities.  For example, Juan will invest in his raspberry nursery, Guillermo and Cecilia in a grocery store and Virginia in a nixtamal [corn for making tortillas and tamales, etc.] mill.  They chose this name because Alcatraz means abundance.

Juan is the group representative, he is 28-years-old, unmarried and has always lived in the community.  For the moment, he’s living with his parents and Juan has a raspberry nursery.  He got the nursery thanks to support he received from the father of his girlfriend.  Juan commented: “I didn’t know anything about raspberries but we received some training where I learned how to plant them and how to make them grow and obtain a good harvest."    Juan has been doing this activity for 8 months now and the only difficulty is the lack of resources to enlarge his business.  He is requesting the loan to buy tubes, raspberry plants and the rubber.  Juan is motivated most from seeing the amount of harvest he got during the last six months because the raspberry harvests are exported to the United States.  Juan says, "Although I do well in my business I’d like to make it bigger to improve my quality of life and to make some home improvements, among others."  Juan is very grateful to the institution FRAC because thanks to the loan he will be able to buy what he needs.

loans.use: to buy rubber, raspberry plants and iron

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
George  is a married man. He has four children, with ages ranging from 2 years to 12 years. He describes himself as a business-minded and customer-friendly man. 

He operates a restaurant where he sells food, tea, and snacks.  He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located within a viable urban area, and his primary customers are local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving.

He will use the KES 5,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.  His business goal is to run another restaurant within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy, de 45 años de edad,  es una mujer  alegre y trabajadora. Convive con su pareja, ya varios años en su casa propia, fruto de esa unión tienen 04 hijos, asimismo brindan su apoyo a una sobrina, quien también viven con ella. Lucy, se dedica a la fabricación de palos de escoba, actividad que lo realiza en un local alquilado en donde tiene todas las herramientas necesarias para su trabajo. Es así que atiende los pedidos de sus innumerables clientes. Lleva más de 15 años  dedicándose a este trabajo, en el que su pareja siempre le da el apoyo necesario; del mismo modo cuenta con el apoyo de 02 ayudantes, así aligera más su trabajo. Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene y por tanto se siente orgulosa de ello, así ayuda a otras personas dandoles trabajo y desarrollarse juntos como empresa. Ahora que su negocio va surgiendo, desea instalar otros puestos en diferentes ciudades. Este es el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP, y con ello comprará la materia prima necesaria para su negocio como: es la madera en mayor cantidad y menor precio generándole mayor ganancias,
texts.en:
Lucy, 45, is a cheerful, hardworking woman.  She has lived with her spouse for several years now in her own house.  They have four children and also support a niece who also lives with them.  Lucy works manufacturing broom sticks, an activity she carries out in a rented space where she has all the tools necessary to do her work.  She fills orders for her innumerable customers this way.

She’s been in business more than 15 years and her spouse always gives her whatever help she needs.  She also gets help from two helpers making her work a little easier.  She considers her business to be profitable because of the demand it has and she’s proud of this.  She helps others by providing employment for them and they all develop together as a firm.  

Now that the business is surging forward she wants to set up other stands in different cities.  This is her fourth MFP loan and she will use it to buy raw materials like wood in larger amounts and at a lower price for her business thus generating higher profits.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Rosetta

texts.en:
Rosetta is a 43-year-old married woman who lives in Paynesville South. She has four children that are between the ages of 5 and 28. Three of the children live outside the home and are independent; only the youngest child stays with her at home. Rosetta was educated through the eighth grade, and her husband is a teacher.  

She has a table in the market where she sells rice, beans, cooking oil, palm oil, onion, tomatoes, Vita, and salt. She has been selling for the past fifteen years. She is proud of her business because she makes profit after each daily sale. With the profit she repays her loans and buys goods to improve the business. She has requested her fourth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more beans, cooking oil, palm oil, and onions for the business. Her dream is to lay a good foundation for her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, cooking oil, palm oil, and onions for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his hogs, as well as fertilizer

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 19 years to 26 years. She describes herself to be a hard-working woman. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes.  She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located within a busy conducive market, and her primary customers are local residents from a nearby slum and businesspeople.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy clothes for selling.  Her business goal is to run a retail store within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

She hopes that in the future, she will build a house for her family and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a widow and has six children, four of whom attend school. She has a business of selling green bananas, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She sells to all categories of people on a retail level. She works seven days a week. 

Ruth is requesting a loan for 1000000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of green bananas at the market.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She hopes to become a wholesaler and also to build rental rooms.  She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses includes school and utility bills.

loans.use: to purchase more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is married with four children, and only one child goes to school. She sells hardware and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of cement, iron bars, iron sheets and nails. She generates additional income through tailoring. She works from her home seven days a week and sells on a wholesale basis only.  Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves.  She aspires to own a fully stocked hardware shop and to buy a delivery van to ease in transportation costs.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement, iron bars, iron sheets and nails

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, vive con su esposo y sus hijos que son cuatro, son una familia humilde ella se dedica a la venta de frutas, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia viéndose en la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su esposo en las necesidades del hogar.

Ella necesita comprarse frutas frescas para poder aumentar el negocio, por eso solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en manzanas, bananas, papaya, uvas y fresas, este dinero del préstamo le ayudará a mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio para que sus clientes aumenten la demanda y le generen mayor venta.

El objetivo de ella es a través del negocio poder tener la capacidad para cubrir los gastos diversos en su hogar, ir poco a poco creciendo dentro del mercado e ir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Gloria lives with her husband and their four children. They are a modest family, she sells fruits. This business started with her own initiative, because she saw the need to have a source of income to help her husband in the household needs. 

She needs to buy fresh fruits to expand the business, that's why she is requesting a loan which she will invest in apples, bananas, papayas, grapes, and strawberries. The loan money will help to improve availability in the business so it will increase customers' demand and generate greater sales.

Her goal is to have the capacity to cover the various expenses of her household through the business. She wants to slowly grow within the market and keep improving the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, papaya, grapes and strawberries.

loans.name: Victo

texts.en: Victo is married with five children, and four of her children go to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a retail business and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more commodities for her retail shop like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, maize flour, cooking oil and rice. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality, defaulters and thieves.  She aspires to own a fully stocked wholesale shop and to build her own house. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, maize flour, cooking oil and rice

loans.name: Merlin Noel

texts.fr: Noel est une jeune homme de 33 ans commerçan, il a ouvert un prêt à porter qu'il gère dans un quartier de la capitale depuis 6 ans déjà. Son accueil chaleureux, sa créativité,ses bons conseils vestimentaires et son expérience lui ont valu une clientèle assez importante. la croissance de sa clientèle lui pose un problème parce qu'il n'arrive plus à la satisfaire tout ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à aller au déballage chaque week end pour acheter en détail et revenir vendre. et ça ne rapporte pas assez d'où l'importance de ce crédit qui lui pertttra de s'acheter un ballot de vêtements pour sa boutique. ceci lui permettra de satisfaire non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle, mais aussi de réaliser plus de bénéfices. Il souhaiterai réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité afin de l'agrandir et aider sa famille.
texts.en: Noel is a young man of 33 who is a shopkeeper. He opened a ready to wear boutique in a quarter of the capital that he has been running for six years. His warm welcome, his creativity, his good advice about clothing, and his experience have gained him quite a large clientele. The growth of his clientele has become a problem for him as he can no longer satisfy all of his customers due to his small capital. This means that he has to go to sales every weekend to purchase his stock retail and to come back to sell it. This does not bring in sufficient return, hence the importance of this loan which will enable him to buy a bundle of clothes for his shop. This would enable him not only to satisfy his customers, but also to make more profit. He would like to reinvest the profits in his business in order to expand it and help his family.

loans.use: To purchase a bunle of clothes.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah is married with two children, and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a beauty salon and has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, braids and Vaseline. She works on all types of hair seven days a week.  Her major business challenges include thieves and the ever increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda.  She aspires to own a fully stocked beauty salon and also to build her own house.  She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and no piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves, Vaseline and braids

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 30, lives in Paynesville South. She is a single parent with a child eight years old, and is currently in school. She graduated from high school, but did not further her education. 

Josephine has a boutique where she sells different types of ladies' wigs, make-up, shoes and handbags. Because of her quality merchandise, customers flow in every day. She improve her business, and takes care of the needs of her child with the profit that she generates from the business. She has requested her third loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more shoes, handbags and wigs for the business. Her future plan is to further her education.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' shoes, handbags and wigs.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 38 year old married woman and a mother of five children. The man shown in the photo is Irshad’s husband. 

Irshad has been in the sweater weaving business with her husband for the past 10 years. She is trying hard to fulfill her children's needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

Irshad offers various handmade and machine made sweaters in different colors, and she is famous for providing good quality sweaters in her community. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family.  Her husband facilitates her sweater weaving by machine. She has two weaving machines, one for herself and one for her husband. In this way, she is able to handle her family needs and requirements effectively.  

To help her to continue her operation, she has applied for a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.  She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy mobile phones, accessories, and repairing tools for her son's mobile  business

loans.name: Souliath Abeke's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Souliath Abeke la responsable est âgée de 32 ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 10ans et 03ans. Souliath Abeke vend des sacs de charbon à son domicile depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes à un prix abordable en vue de les revendre aux détaillants et aux ménages. Dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Ce financement lui permettra de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Souliath Abeke se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of two women who mutually guarantee each other. Souliath Abeke, the group's official, is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children, all in school. The oldest and the youngest are 10 and 3 years old, respectively. Souliath Abeke has been selling sacks of charcoal out of her home for a few years. She gets her supplies from wholesalers at affordable prices with the aim of reselling them to retailers and households. 

With the goal of bolstering her working capital and satisfying her customers, Souliath Abeke requested and obtained financing from Finadev. This financing will enable her to maximize her profits and to help with her children's schooling. 

Souliath Abeke is the one found at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase 25 sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Bertrand

texts.fr: Bertrand est une homme de 43 ans marié père de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 6 et 14 ans tous vont à l'école. Il est commerçant dans un marché de la capitale depuis 6 mois ou ilvend les vivres secs (arachide, haricot, sel...), c'est grâce à ce petit commerce qu'il subvient aux besoins de sa petite famille. Son commerce fonctionne mais il a juste un problème de capital qui l'empêche d'acheter des quantités importantes pour revendre, elle est obligé d'acheter à chaque un ou deux sacs, d'attendre qu'elle finisse de vendre pour acheter à nouveau. Grace à ce crédit, il pourra acheter plusieurs sacs, ce qui lui permettra de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, augmentera ses ventes et dont ses bénéfices. Il réinvestira une partie du bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit dans son activité en ajoutant les sacs de riz et d'arachide,et économisera l'autre pour la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
Bertrand is a 43-year-old man, married, and the father of four children, from 6 to 14 years old. All of the children go to school. Bertrand has been a merchant at a market in the capital for six months. There, he sells dried staple foods (peanuts, beans, salt, …) With this small business, he is supporting his small family. His business is operating, but he has just one problem involving capital funds that prevents him from purchasing large amounts of goods to sell. He is compelled to purchase one or two sacks at a time, wait until they are sold, and then make his purchases again. 

Thanks to this loan, Bertrand will be able to purchase more sacks of goods enabling him to satisfy his customers better and to increase his sales and thus his profits. He will reinvest part of his profits into his business by adding sacks of rice and peanuts. And he will save the rest for his children's education.

loans.use: to increase his stock of peanuts, beans, and salt

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single mother of six children. Three of her children go to school. She supports her children. She has a business of selling bark cloth. She works at the market and sells on a retail basis only. She works six days a week. 

Jane has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of bark cloth. Her major business challenges include transportation of bark cloth from the villages of Masaka to her stall at the market and thieves. 

She aspires to own a delivery van to ease transportation and to buy a plot and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of bark cloth

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en: Olivia lives in Paynesville South. She is 27 years old and single with a child who is six years old and attending school. For the past five years Olivia has been selling hair grease, bath towel, children's accessories, toothbrushes, children's underwear and many other items. A difficulty she faces is low sales during the rainy season. She is proud of her business because she feels independent and self-reliant. Olivia is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise. She plan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more hair grease, bath towels, toothbrushes, and children's underwear.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila, 34, is a humble, hardworking person living with her two children who attend school. She is single and has to work extra hard to provide for their daily needs. Sheila works in food vending, selling from her home. She sells a variety of food stuffs including fried potatoes, dumplings and flat breads.
Sheila is requesting a loan from Yehu in order to have the money needed to buy more ingredients like wheat flour, beans, and cooking oil. She also plans to expand the business to have more space.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like wheat flour, beans, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is a very hardworking man who always has the urge to move forward. He is grateful and says that since the last loan his business has grown tremendously. Emmanuel says that he was able to increase the number of goats he purchased from three to eight. He is now requesting a new loan to invest in his current business. With this loan, he plans to purchase two bulls for resale. He is sure to earn a good income from this investment. His hope is to become a livestock farmer. It should be noted that Emmanuel also runs a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase two bulls for sale.

loans.name: La Magia Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “La magia del Sur” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de leña, venta de colaciones, menaje, mueblería, artesanía, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Villarrica.
Pamela, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ocupando el quinto lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste una polera de color negra, una falda de colores, pantys de color negra y zapatillas de color gris, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto y largo.
Ella se dedica al rubro de venta de ropa de bebe y para adultos, desde hace 3 meses. Comenta que trabaja como vendedora ambulante ofreciendo su mercadería a domicilio y a veces a conocidos, su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad ya que su hijo es muy pequeño.
La mercadería que va necesitando la adquiere de familiares o amigos y algunas veces compra en la ciudad de Santiago a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará solo ropa de bebe.
Una de las metas de Pamela es cambiar de rubro como comida rápida, ya que necesita tener más ingresos para sustentar a su familia y así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Pamela vive junto a su esposo y su hijo pequeño de 11 meses de vida. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es crecer en los rubros que emprenda nuevos caminos, y en lo personal terminar sus estudios para obtener su titulo.
Ella se encuentra muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Villarrica es una  ciudad al sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de La Araucanía. Es una ciudad pequeña, pero cuenta con todos los servicios básicos y turísticos, siendo uno de los principales centros de servicios del área cordillerana y principal centro turístico de la región, junto con Pucón. Durante los meses de verano se realizan numerosas actividades y eventos culturales, artísticos y deportivos, Además de las innumerables alternativas de Ecoturismo, Turismo Aventura y Etnoturismo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “La Magia del Sur” (Magic of the South) and it has 17 enterprising members who are in a variety of lines of work among which are: firewood sales, food sales, household goods sales, crafts, furniture store and services, among others.  All of them are from the city of Villarrica.

Pamela is a member of this communal bank and in the photo she’s standing fifth from right to left wearing a black shirt, print skirt, black leggings and gray shoes; her hair is dark brown and it’s long and worn loose.

She has been selling clothes for adults and for babies for the last three months. She comments that she works selling from place to place offering her goods door to door and sometimes to acquaintances.   She manages her time according to her availability since her son is still very little.

The merchandise she needs she gets from family members or from friends and sometimes she buys it in the city of Santiago at low cost which is advantageous economically.  She will use the loan just to buy clothes for babies.

One of Pamela’s goals is to change her line of work to fast-food sales because she needs to earn more income to support her family and have the option of a better quality of life.

Pamela lives with her husband and 11-month-old little boy.  Her dream on a work level is to grow in lines of work that lead to new paths and on the personal level to finish her education and graduate with a degree.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity provided by Fondo Esperanza because it allows her to invest in her business.  With respect to the communal bank she forms part of, she comments that good communication exists among them.  On the other hand, the training has been useful to learn sales and bookkeeping strategies.

Villarrica is a city in south Chile located in the La Araucanía region.  It’s a small city but it has all basic and tourism services.   It’s one of the main service centers for the mountain region and main regional tourism center alongside Pucón.  During the summer months many activities and cultural, artistic and sporting events are organized.  There are also innumerable ecotourism, ethno tourism and extreme sports alternatives available.

loans.use: to buy baby's clothes.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 34 years old. He is married with one two-year-old son. He lives with his family in the town of Kaloleni. He has been working on his farm, growing a variety of crops for a long time, but has been involved in a goat meat business just since 2011. He sells his goats at the market every Monday, Wednesday and Friday.
He is requesting a loan for 20,000 KES, with which he is going to buy more goats for resale. This loan will help him to earn a greater income for his family. His goal is to own butcheries in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goats for resale.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is married with four children. Two of her children go to school. She has a retail shop business and sells to all categories of people on retail. She supports her immediate family members. 

She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cooking oil, bags of bread and rice. She has been in this retail business for 11 years. Besides this retail shop business she grows mushrooms at her home. She works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation of commodities.   

She aspires to own a supermarket and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, cooking oil, bread and rice

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Fatmata. She is married with one child aged eight. In 1997, Fatmata established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her family. Working seven days a week and six hours a day, she earns about Le900,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000. Fatmata requires a loan to buy more cartons of fish and pay for transportation. In the future, Fatmata plans to educate her children in a university and construct a mini cool-room for herself. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish for resale.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en:
Nonita is 56 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Nonita runs a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.

Nonita has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items, such as snack foods, sugar, soap, milk, and noodles.. 

In the future  Nonita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. Corazon is married, and she has a business selling chicharon (fried pork rind) in the Philippines.

Corazon requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her chicharon.

Corazon has been in this business for five years.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her chicharon.

loans.name: Tuongozane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwadji  est la doyenne et présidente du collectif de crédit Tuongozane, cliente au 25e cycle, âgée de 52 ans, mariée et  mère de 8 enfants  et plusieurs petits fils. Son mari exerce le petit commerce. Elle a commencé son activité avec son fonds propre reçu de son mari ayant une valeur équivalente à un bidon d’huile. La cliente est vendeuse d’huile de palme dans le marché central de Virunga. Il y a 10 ans, elle exerce cette activité. Avec ce nouveau prêt, la cliente souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 15  bidons d’huile de palme. La cliente vend également des souliers en plastic (babouches) pour accroître son revenu. Dans l’avenir, elle planifie de changer l’activité et faire le commerce général et construire confortablement sa maison. La cliente salut l’initiative de l’IMF Hekima dédiée pour  l’autonomisation des pauvres femmes non bancables. Les dividendes de ce projet de micro crédit de Hekima sont énormes pour cette cliente dit-elle,  Celle-ci est restée très longtemps loin de ses enfants suite à des guerres répétitives en RD Congo, grâce aux crédits de l’IMF Hekima, elle avait aisément payé le billet  transport d’avion de ses enfants de Buyimayi jusqu’à Goma.
texts.en:
This client, Mwadji, is the senior member and president of the credit collective Tuongozane. At 52 years old, she is on her 25th loan cycle, and she is a married mother of eight children and several grandchildren. Her husband runs a small business. Mwadji started her business with funds from her husband that amounted to the equivalent of a container of oil. She is a vendor of palm oil at the central market of Virunga and has been in this business for ten years. 

With this new loan, this client would like to increase her sales by purchase 15 containers of palm oil. She also sells plastic footwear (slippers) to increase her revenues. For the future, she plans on switching her business to general commerce and building a comfortable house.  

This client salutes the initiative taken by the microfinance institution Hekima dedicated to autonomy for poor women having no access to banks. The dividends from this Hekima micro-loan are enormous for this client, she says. She remained away from her children for a long time due to the repeated wars in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. Thanks to Hekima loans, she had easily paid the airfare from Buyimayi to Goma for her children.

loans.use: to purchase 15 containers of palm oil to sell

loans.name: Mure

texts.en:
Mure, 35, is married and living with his spouse and five children in the suburban of Kaloleni, Kenya. He has always been a merchant. For a time he sold farm produce, and over five years ago decided to open a small grocery store selling foodstuffs and miscellany. He sells various items, including basic grains, canned goods, cleaning supplies, eggs, sweets, dairy products, rice, etc. 

Mure has requested a 30,000 KES loan to stock his store with flour, sugar, rice, and other small, fast selling items. With this investment he will increase his inventory and sales. His plans are to open a bigger shop so that he will be able to improve his income and his family’s quality of life this way.

loans.use: to stock his store with flour, sugar, rice, and other small, fast selling items.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal, 49, lives in a rental house in the town of Kaloleni. She is single and childless. For the past seven years, she has been involved in food vending,  selling along the busy streets of the town. In addition, she sells charcoal to supplement her income. She’s asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like wheat flour and spices; and sacks of charcoal for resale. Racheal is very hardworking and is always seeking ways to improve in life.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like flour, spices and beans; and sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old. She is a strong and hardworking person whom her family can count on for everything they need to have a stable and happy life. She lives with her husband and four grown children.

Mary runs her own business: food vending and selling at the market. Mary is asking for a loan to buy a large amount of basic ingredients such as wheat flour, beans and raw potatoes so that she can increase her production and thereby increase her sales.

She also has a vegetable stall that is located at her home. Both businesses have produced commendable results.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients such as wheat flour and beans, as well as other items.

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita, a mother of three children, is in her fifties. She is a Romani woman from one of the most vulnerable ethnic minority communities of south central Albania. Like almost everyone in her ethnic neighborhood, Drita has been selling used clothes in the Roma clothing market in her city that is known as the largest in Albania.

She has been doing this for the past 20 years and has no plans to stop any time soon. She claims that she makes an income from it. Now that her children are somewhat independent, she plans on improving their poor living conditions with the little money she might be able to save.

Drita is requesting a loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek from VisionFund Albania, in order to buy more seasonal used clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy seasonal used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Dila

texts.en:
Dila is 51 years old and married with four children. They live in a little town of approximately 10,000 inhabitants in a northern district of Albania. This is Dila’s first time applying for a loan from VisionFund Albania and she wants to buy used clothes to resell. This has been her activity for the past five years, since her husband lost his job. For many months, their family was left without an income which caused them a lot of anxiety.

Dila made money, but found that the money was just enough to survive with the children to raise. Now that her children are all grown, she plans on improving their living conditions.

The loan of 150,000 Albanian Lek she is requesting from Kiva will help her to buy an inventory of seasonal used clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy seasonal used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. She is married and has sold fish for the past thirty years.

Teresita is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy extra fish to sell in her food stall. She would like to save money to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy extra fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family.

For the past year Analyn has run a general store and sold food as well. She has already borrowed and paid off eight loans from NWTF. She is now applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy extra stock to sell in her shop.

Analyn’s ambition is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy extra stock to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Carmencita has been in this business for three years. Carmencita earns more income from farming rice.

Carmencita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 34 years old, married and has three children. 

Irene is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Irene has been raising pigs for 10 years now and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Irene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jeramae

texts.en:
Jeramae is 34 years old and has four children. Jeramae is married and all her children are going to school.

Jeramae is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jeramae requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

Jeramae has been raising pigs for two years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jeramae would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicine and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 57 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lolita has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Lolita has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Carmelina

texts.en:
Carmelina is 62 years old, married and has four children, three of whom are in school. She has been farming corn for the past ten years.

Carmelina has taken out and paid off fourteen loans in the past through NWTF. She is now applying for another loan in the amount of 16,000 PHP to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Carmelina would like to save enough money to buy more farmland in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. Juliet is married and has a motorcycle rental business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle.

Juliet has been in this business for five years now and earns additional income from her vulcanizing shop.

In the future, Juliet would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Marana

texts.en:
Marana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items like detergent, sardines, shampoo and other groceries for her general store business.

NWTF is presenting Marana's business profile again to help her obtain another loan to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional food supplies and goods to sell

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Ms. Kosar is a 31-year-old hardworking and energetic lady. Kosar is shown in the photo with her daughter.  She has a general store business. She has been performing this business for the last four years. Her business was not well before taking a loan from Kashf. 

She is a mother of two children. Her husband is a taxi driver and unable to earn enough to support his family alone. That is why Kosar initiated her own business to contribute to the family income. Her husband encouraged her, and now is happy with the growth of the business. 

Currently, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase plastic pots, ladies' shoes, and children’s garments to meet her community and customer demands. 

She is fully confident and has a future vision to make a big store in her community.

loans.use: to purchase plastic pots, ladies' shoes, and children's garments.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.en:
Marcosa is 52 years old and has six children. Marcosa is married and three of her children are in school.

Marcosa is in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Marcosa requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock.

Marcosa has been raising livestock for nine years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marcosa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 55 years old and married. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Mercedes has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Mercedes requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as bread, soft drinks and other groceries.

Mercedes has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Mercedes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items such as bread, soft drinks and other groceries

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has been in the business of buying and selling rice for the past five years. She grows rice on the side as well.

Gilda has been sustaining her business through both her own efforts and with loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 18,000 PHP loan to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Gilda’s ambition is to keep her business growing

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Cecilla

texts.en:
Ma. Cecilla, 33, is a hardworking entrepreneur. She is married and has two children, one of whom is in school.

For the past three years Ma. Cecilla has sold ready-to-wear clothing. She is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more of them to sell.

Ma. Cecilla’s ambition is to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an herbal products retail business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more herbal medicine and products to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for seven years and earns more income from raising livestock.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more herbal medicines to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 40 years old and married with four children.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a used clothing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Elsa has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running this business for 20 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Elsa aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Robert Enrique

texts.es: Robert tiene 46 años estado civil casado, tiene 1 hijo de 16 años. Robert comenzó hace 2 años, con la liquidación de su ex empresa donde laboraba de ahí se compro un carro, el cual en la actualidad se desempeña como taxista. El trabaja solo de 10:30am hasta 21:00pm. Con el préstamo él quiere arreglar su carro comprando .llantas ,pintura para el carro, y mejorara su casa etc.
texts.en: Robert is 46 years old, married and has one 16 year old child. Robert began working as a taxi driver two years ago when he bought a car with the proceeds of the liquidation of his former company.  He works from 10:30am to 9:00pm.  With the loan he wants to fix up the car he bought with tires, car paint and improve his home etc.

loans.use: to buy tires, car paint and improve his home etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and works hard to support her family. For the past four years she has sold vegetables and seasonings in her food stall in the Philippines.

Elena is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more vegetables and seasonings to sell. Her ambition is to keep her food stall growing.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and seasonings to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jose Israel

texts.es:
José, es agricultor y promotor social, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, el tiene tres años de trabajar como promotor social y cuatro años de trabajar como agricultor, esto le ayuda a diversificar sus ingresos.

El solicita un préstamo para poder realizar la compra de materiales agrícolas como el abono, pago de mozos, herbicidas, esto le ayuda a poder obtener lo necesario para que la producción de maíz mejore y así generar sus ganancias.

Su aspiración es mejorar las condiciones del hogar, que la producción sea más abundante, poder ayudar a su familia y generar mejores mayor estabilidad.
texts.en:
José is a farmer and community activist. He lives with his wife and two children. José has worked as a community activist for three years and as a farmer for four years. This has helped him to diversify his income.

José is requesting a loan so that he can buy farming supplies, such as compost and herbicides. He will also pay his workers. This will enable him to obtain what he needs to improve his corn production and generate more income. His aspirations are to improve his conditions at home, achieve a more abundant production, help his family, and have greater stability.

loans.use: to buy compost and herbicides and to pay his workers' wages.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: This is 44-year-old Alice. She is married, and has 3 children aged 30, 23 and 10. In 2007, Alice established her cigarette, soap, Peak milk, biscuit, battery etc. business. She began her business because she did not go to school and was trained up as a business woman. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours  a day, she earns about SLL1,000,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,500,000. Alice has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cigarettes, biscuits, milk, etc. for resale and to use the balance of the money on transportation.
