In the future, Alice plans to have another outlet, build a house and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy sardines, mayonnaise, milk, sugar, drinks and toiletries for her business.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru:
Светлана замужем. У нее есть взрослая дочь. Светлана имеет свой бизнес.

Светлана продает на центральном рынке города женскую одежду на протяжении 7 лет.  Торговое место у нее собственное. Светлана всегда вежлива с клиентами. Она умеет выбирать товар, на который есть спрос. Светлана хочет развивать бизнес и увеличивать тем самым доход семьи.

Светлана просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 10000 гривен на закупку  женской одежды к осенне-зимнему сезону.
texts.en: Svetlana is married. She has a grown daughter. Svetlana has her own business. For seven years, she has been selling women’s clothing at the central market. She has her own sales outlet. Svetlana is always friendly with her customers. She knows how to choose wares that are in demand. Svetlana would like to develop her business further and thus increase her family’s income. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000  UAH in order to stock up on women’s clothing for the fall and winter season.

loans.use: to stock up on winter clothing.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is married and works hard to support her family. For the past four years she has bought and sold bananas in the Philippines.

Mary Jane is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy extra bananas to sell. Her ambition is to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to buy extra bananas to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 40, is a married woman with three school-going children. She lives in a suburban neighborhood of Kaloleni. She’s been working for the past year operating a butcher shop.

Janet is a dedicated woman who wants to get ahead and feel responsible. Her spouse is a councillor. 

The loans help her buy a freezer, meat trays and a scale. She dreams of having several businesses in the future.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, meat trays and a scale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu, 48, is married and has three children aged 25, 22 and 20 years. In 1992 Kadiatu started selling spare parts for motor bikes so as to help support her family. She works nine hours a day, six days a week and earns about 1,200,000 SLL a month.

Kadiatu would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL through ARD in order to buy more spare parts of different sorts to sell. Her ambition is to keep her business growing.

Kadiatu is working to maximize her profits so she can build her own house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts of different sorts to sell.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en: This is 41-year-old Saidu. He is married with two children aged 13 and 8. In 1994, Saidu established his business selling pure water, biscuits, luncheon meat, sardines, milk etc.. He started his business because he was trained as a businessman. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,500,000. Saidu requires a loan in order to Purchase more of his business stock for resale and use the remaining money on transportation. In the future, Saidu plans to develop his business to a higher level and to educate his children on a university level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more pure water, biscuits, luncheon meat, sardines and milk for his business.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti, 26 years old, is a very hardworking woman who lives with her two children and runs a beauty salon. Her life partner works as a teacher. Like all responsible mothers, Mwanasiti works with the goal of living better because her income permits her to give her children what they need.

Mwanasiti is requesting a loan from Yehu, with the desire to improve her beauty salon with beauty products with recognized brands. She plans to get hair dyes, skin creams and shampoos to offer her clients better service and attract new clients. She hopes this will improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy beauty products like hair dye, skin cream, shampoo, etc..

loans.name: Naomi Group

texts.en: Pi Kimboi is married and has five children, two boys and three girls. In 2010, she set up a small variety shop in her village. She sells eatables, toiletries, biscuits, soft drinks and many other items. Hers is not the only shop in the village but being a hardworking and sociable person she has more customers. She is excited and extremely happy to own and run her small shop and wishes to expand her business for which she requires capital. Most of her earnings are used for the household and children’s educational expenses. She is asking for a KIVA loan of INR 10,000 to add more items and start saving for her children.

loans.use: to expand her small variety shop with more eatables, toiletries, biscuits, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata, 31, is married and has three children aged nine, two and one year. In 2009 she started selling palm oil and rice so as to help support her family. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month.

Aminata is applying for a 4,500,000 SLL loan to buy palm oil, cooking oil, rice and other goods to sell. She will use the balance to cover transportation costs.

Aminata’s ambition is to open another shop, educate her children and to buy her own house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, cooking oil, rice and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Kadijatu

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Kadijatu. She is married with three children aged 26,18 and 9. She has two additional dependents who live with her for assistance. In 2009, Kadijatu established her grocery business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband taking care of the home. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le800,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le4,000,000 to buy more types of drinks and other merchandise. She plans to use the remaining money on transportation. In the future, Kadijatu plans to build a house on a plot of land and improve her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of drinks.

loans.name: Foday

texts.en: Foday, 65, is married and has two children ages 35 and 30. He has one additional dependent who lives with him for schooling. In 1997, Foday established his charcoal, palm oil and garri (fermented cassava) business. He began his business because he was trained as a businessman. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy more bags of charcoal, palm oil and garri for resale. In the future, Foday plans to build more stores and educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal, palm oil and garri from farmers in the province and to sell to customers in the city.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is from the suburban town of Kisauni. For three months, she has owned a small business selling all types of clothing. She says she is doing very well. She lives with her spouse and two young daughters. Agnes works hard to provide them with all that is necessary for a better life so that they will not be deprived of anything.

Agnes has requested the support of Kiva and Yehu to buy more bales of clothes like shorts, blouses, trousers, etc, to be able to stock up and offer her customers a broad range of clothing.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothes like shorts, blouses, trousers, etc,

loans.name: Victoria Marina

texts.es: Victoria de estado civil soltera, tiene hijos .Victoria Comenzó con poca mercadería a vender  víveres ella vendía cola, arroz,  para luego formar una  tienda de víveres en su casa pues eso es lo que ahora es su sustento de vida para Ella y su familia. Desde las 7:00am abre su negocio. Ella anhela que su negocio crezca más y poderlo surtir con mas productos. Pues con el préstamo el comprara mas víveres como .arroz, azúcar, aceite etc.
texts.en:
Victoria is a single mother.  She started with very little merchandise to sell.  Starting with the sale of food items like soda and rice, she later started a grocery store in her house, which she and her family rely on to sustain them.  She opens her business at 7:00am.  

She is very hopeful that her business will continue to grow so that she can stock more products.  She would like to use the loan to buy more groceries, such as rice, sugar and oil.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Hawa. She is married and has 2 children, ages 15 and 20 years. Hawa has 2 additional dependents who live with her for assistance in schooling. 

In 2002, Hawa established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Hawa requires a loan in order to buy more cartons of fish, use some money on transportation, sell and get more profit. 

In the future, Hawa plans to educate her children to university, and construct a mini-cool room in her village. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish for resale

loans.name: Sahei Group

texts.en:
Sahei Group, which means orchid flower in Thadou, has 16 members all from the Kuki tribe living in the village of Saikul in the Northeastern part of India. 
  
Pi Ngaineng (the woman with raised hand) is a mother to three children.  She is a very hardworking woman and before joining the group and starting her own business, she had to take any job that came along, often times working as a daily wager (day laborer) to supplement her husband's income. 

In 2010 she joined the group to fulfill a dream of starting a small variety shop to service her villagers.  With her friends’ and group members support she borrowed a loan of INR 5000 from WSDS and with the money she immediately opened a small variety stall in her house. She sells items like soap, sweets, soft drinks, hair oil, eatables, and many more.  She opens her shop only in the morning and evening, as villagers work in the field during daytime.

As with many of the group members, she has multiple ways of providing for her family.  With the  earnings from the variety store, she bought piglets and is raising them to be sold at the market soon.  She also has a kitchen garden that provides enough vegetables to sell at the market, for the pigs to eat and for her family's food.   

She is motivated to serve her village's needs better and wants to expand her business to do that.

loans.use: to buy soap, sweets, soft drinks, and hair oil for her small village store.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 59-year-old married woman from Cortes, Bohol. She has three children, ages 16, 20, and 25 years old. 

She has been in the sari-sari (variety) store business for four years. She earns PHP 3,000 a month by doing her sari-sari store.  She sells soft drinks, tuba (coconut wine), and fruit-flavored juices like orange, pineapple, and mango. 

Rufina is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy additional soft drinks like Coke and Pepsi. 

In the future, Rufina would like to expand her business to support her family at the same time to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks like Coke, Pepsi, and tuba  (coconut wine).

loans.name: Yasin Group

texts.en:
This group is called Yasin which consists of four women who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They are taking a loan of 230,000 YER.

Rathia is 31 years old, and a married woman who lives with her two children in Sana`a, Yemen. She works in traditional masterpieces. She is a professional in her work where she makes and sells pieces of art from cement, sand and other materials. She makes them in a wonderful way that earns the admiration of clients. She is hardworking and likes her work. 

She has been working in her business for fifteen years and would now like to ask for financial assistance. She has applied for a loan of 70,000 (YER) from AMB which will be used to buy construction supplies for her business. She believes that she could increase her income to be able to cover her family's needs and become a successful entrepreneur someday.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her business.

loans.name: Amara

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Amara. He is married with two children aged five and three. In 2003, Amara established his electronics business. He began his business because he came from a very poor home and had no one to pay his school fees. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le4,500,000 to purchase more electronics to sell. In the future, Amara plans to build his own shop, travel to Dubai, and educate his children in the university. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy electrical cables and lamp holders to sell to clients building houses.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Сабохат проживает в районе Хуросон. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж работает шафером в селе. Сама Сабохат имеет среднее образование. Она арендует торговую точку на рынке села Айни, где занимается продажей фруктов и овощей. В этой области Сабохат пятнадцать лет. 
Сабохат просит кредит для увеличения оборота. Она хочет расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Sabohat lives in the Khuroson district.  She is 40 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband works as a driver in a village.  Sabohat has a secondary education.  She leases a retail outlet at a market in the Ayni village, where she sells fruits and vegetables.  Sabohat has been in this business for fifteen years.  She is requesting this loan to increase product turnover.  She wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits (grapes)

loans.name: Leihao Group

texts.en:
Leihao Lom is a 14-member group which was formed by community mothers who wanted to ensure more opportunity for their families.  Many of the members have multiple ways of earning (such raising pigs and other livestock, traditional weaving for tribal ceremonies and to sell at the market, agriculture for sale and to provide for their families).  They will all be using their loans in similar ways. 

Pi Nengneihoi, the one with her hand raised, is 31 years old and is a happy mother to her baby daughter.  Her daily life is busy with a baby, rearing 3 piglets, household duties which include growing vegetables, but she finds time to weave early in the morning for about 2 hours and late at night about 2 hours.  It is the village tribal tradition that women weave intricate and time-consuming garments for tribal ceremonies and if they wish, for selling at the market.  She provides earnings for her family by weaving every day and bringing her weavings to the market. 

She dreams of expanding her piglet farm to add four more to the three she already has.  She enjoys raising piglets until they are full grown where she sells them at the market.     

Pi Nengneihoi, with the KIVA loan of Rs. 10,000/- (INR) wanted to buy four more piglets @ Rs. 2000/- per piglet, and the remaining Rs.2000/- will be spent on buying thread for weaving traditional shawls. 

She will repay the loan by selling the traditional shawls that she weaves and her husband will help her in rearing the piglets.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for her piggery and thread for traditional tribal weaving.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris, 32, is married and has one child, age 6. She has two additional dependents who live with her for schooling. In 2007, Doris established her grocery business. She began her business because after she left school, there was no employment for her. Working seven days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 1200000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Doris requires a loan in order to buy more drinks in a very large quantity for resale. She would use the remaining money on transportation. In the future, Doris plans to become an international businesswoman and provide her children with quality education.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks to sell in her grocery business and for transportation.

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en: Fanta, 50, is married and has three children, ages 25, 20 and 18.. In 1990, Fanta established her fish-selling business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in taking care of the home .Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Fanta requires a loan in order to purchase more fish for resale. She would use the remaining money on transportation. In the future, Fanta plans to finish a two-story building. She thanks you for your support..

loans.use: to buy fish for resale

loans.name: Umu

texts.en: Umu, 35, is married and has four children, ages 5, 10, 13 and 18. She has three additional dependents who live with her as sales assistants.  In 2000, Umu established her business selling pepper, ginger, lime, garri (fermented cassava), etc. She began her business to assist her husband in running the home. Working seven days a week and nine hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Umu requires a loan in order to buy pepper, ginger, lime, etc. She would use the remaining money on transportation. In the future, Umu plans to support her children in schooling on to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy pepper ,ginger and lime in large quantities at reduced prices from the provinces.

loans.name: Dorcas (B) Group

texts.en:
The 14 group members of Dorcas (B) Lom also belong to the Kuki tribe and live in a small community in Manipur, located in the remote northeast region of India.   

Pi Paokholhing, with raised hand, is 54 years old and has two daughters.  She is known in the village as an expert traditional weaver, using ancient techniques to keep her tribal customs alive.  Many other women in the group seek her advice on weaving and complex designs.

With the support of other members, she wants to add another source for her family's income by buying piglets to raise and eventually sell for profit. 
 
Pi Paokholhing wants to access a KIVA loan of Rs. 10,000 to buy 2 piglets for rearing that will cost her Rs.6000 INR and the remaining Rs. 4000 INR will be spent on buying thread for weaving traditional shawls. She will buy one piglet and one sow for breeding purposes. The pig will be sold after 9 months @ Rs. 20,000 INR and will contribute towards the next year’s educational expenses for her daughters while the repayment of the KIVA loan will be met by selling the traditional shawls.

loans.use: to buy one piglet, one sow for breeding and thread for weaving tribal shawls.

loans.name: Foday Y

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Foday Y. He is married and has 4 children, ages 6, 8, 12 and 22 years; all are school-going children.  

In 2002, Foday Y. established his clothing (Bamakoh, cotton, Collingine, etc.) business. He began his business after he sat for the High School Examination and there was no one to sponsor his education. He decided to join tailoring, and when he specialized, his boss gave him one machine. Foday Y. used the machine for some years and left his boss and opened his own shop. He is a hardworking tailor. Some customers are difficult to satisfy.

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 2,704,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Foday Y. has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy Bamakoh cloth - 33 pieces @ 150,000 SLL. The balance, 50,000 SLL, will be used for transportation. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits. 

In the future, Foday Y. plans to complete his building construction, educate his children and open another outlet. This loan will help to achieve some of his future plans. He thanks ARD for improving his life. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more Bamakoh cloth for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy timber for resale.

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Нурулло житель района Хуросон. Ему 32 года. Нурулло женат. Он является отцом троих детей. Нурулло уже пол года как приехал с России. Он хочет продолжить свою деятельность. Нурулло занимается животноводством. Он в основном разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. В этой области Нурулло имеет богатый опыт. Он просит кредит для закупа телят и одного бычка.
texts.en: Nurullo is a resident of the Khuroson district.  He is 32 years old, married and a father of three children.  He came back from Russia half a year ago.  He wants to continue his business.  Nurullo is involved in animal husbandry.  He primarily breeds cattle for future sale.  Nurullo has a rich experience in this area.  He is requesting this loan to buy calves and one bull.

loans.use: to buy calves and one bull

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Gibrilla.  He is married, but has no child.   

In 2005, Gibrilla established his business making chairs, beds, cupboards, dividers, dressing mirrors, speaker boxes, and tables. He began his business because he stopped at Form (4) and went further to the technical institute.  After graduation, he joined his father's carpentry workshop, and later he established his own workshop.  

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SSL 2,517,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of SSL 3,000,000.  Gibrilla requires a loan in order to buy timber (12 pieces @ SSL 25,000), 2" sponges (5 pieces @ SSL 180,000), 4" sponges (5 pieces @ SSL 300,000), and velvet cloth (30 yards @ SSL 10,000). 

In the future, Gibrilla plans to build a house; buy a carpentry machines, and acquire a bigger workshop.  This loan will help to improve the workshop. 

He is a hard-working man.  He thanks ARD for accepting his loan  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Angela Veronica

texts.es: Ángela tiene 26 años de edad estado civil casada, tiene 2hijos. Ángela comenzó con esta actividad por la falta de empleo que existe en el país ya que ella quería encontrar trabajo pero no encontró  Ángela desde ese entonces se decidió a vender todo lo referente a cosméticos y le ha ido muy bien, la cual trabaja en las tardes a ofrecer a sus vecinos los productos que posee. en un futuro ella quisiera vender ropa y el anhelo de Ángela es arreglar su casa. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar: perfume, cremas, colonias, desodorantes, talcos etc.
texts.en:
Ángela is 26 years old and is married with two children.  

Ángela started her business out of necessity.  She could not find work due to the lack of employment opportunities in her country, so she decided to sell everything related to cosmetics.  She has been successful with this business. Her hours are in the evening, so that she can provide her neighbors with products.  

In the future, she would like to sell clothing and her dream is to fix up her house.  With the loan, she would like to buy perfume, creams, colognes, deodorant, powder, etc.

loans.use: perfume, creams, colognes, deodorant, powder, etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Елена не замужем. У нее нет детей. Елена имеет свой бизнес.
Елена продает женскую бижутерию на рынке родного города. Также она арендует несколько стеллажей в магазине. Занимается Елена торговлей с 2004 года. Она знает, на какой товар есть спрос. Елена ответственная и обладает деловой хваткой. У нее большое желание развивать бизнес. 

Елена просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 23000 гривен на закупку нового товара: подвески, кольца, браслеты и заколки.
texts.en: Elena is not married and does not have children.  She has her own business.  Elena sells women's jewelry at a market in her native town.  She also leases several displays at a store.  Elena has been involved in sales since 2004.  She knows which merchandise is in demand.  Elena is responsible and has a good business grasp.  She has a lot of desire to develop the business.  Elena is requesting a loan in the amount of 23,000 hryvnia to purchase new merchandise, such as necklaces, rings, bracelets and hair clips.

loans.use: to purchase new merchandise, such as necklaces, rings, bracelets and hair clips

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has 4 children, ages 10, 15, 18 and 25; three are school-going children. Fatmata has 1 additional dependent who lives with her to be fostered.  

In 1991, Fatmata established her local goods (cola nuts, palm oil, rice, fertilizer, etc.) business. She began her business as she was unprivileged to attend school. She was introduced to farming. When she became fully matured, her grandmother gave her some cups of rice and money to make rice bread cake for sale. From the cake, she started a local food stuff business which has grown over the years. Fatmata is a hardworking and trustworthy businesswoman. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 2,724,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy palm oil- 20 rubbers (containers) @ 90,000 SLL, dry pepper- 7 bags @ 350,000 SLL, cola nuts- 1 bag @ 400,000 SLL, groundnuts- 2 bags @ 150,000 SLL. The balance, 50,000 SLL, will be used for transportation. Sometimes the palm oil would not be of good quality.

In the future, Fatmata plans to build a house, provide quality education for her children and open another outlet. She thanks ARD for improving her standard of living. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy local food stuff for her business

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Osman. He is married with one child, aged four years, and is a school-going child. In 2002, Osman established his building materials business. He sells floor mats, door locks, foam mattresses, paint brushes, threads, nails, pillows, extension cables, bulbs, plastic chairs, twine, Cellotex, etc.. 

When he was younger Osman assisted his uncle with his business after school hours. After sitting his high school exams, his uncle fully engaged him in the business by helping him establish his own business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 3,000,000 every month. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Osman has already received and successfully repaid four loans and now requires a new loan in order to buy merchandise (ten large foam mattresses @ Le360,000; six small foam mattresses @ Le220,000. The balance of Le80,000 will be used for transportation. In the future, Osman plans to become an international businessman, build a house and buy a car. He wants to further his education and provide quality education for his child. The loan will generate more income. Inadequate capital is his major challenge. He is an honest and hardworking businessman. He thanks ARD for improving his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for his business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.es:
Anita, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, alegre y muy dinámica.  Es casada y vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo, padres y sus 02 hijos, quiens estos últimos están estudiando en la universidad para forjarse un mejor futuro. El trabajo que realiza Anita es el alquiler de cabinas de Internet, donde tiene 06 computadoras bien instaladas y siendo muy concurrido ya que es la única que ofrece este servicio por la zona, está instalado en un local acondicionado en su propia casa.  Este negocio viene funcionando desde hace más de 06 años, tiempo en cual le ha valido para hacerse muy conocida. En este trabaji cuenta con el apoyo de un ayudante a quien reconcoe su salario por medio tiempo, en las tardes, puesto que en las mañanas la apoya su hija.
Considera rentable su negocio  y eso le ayuda a tener un sustento en la economía familiar y para pagar los estudios superiores de sus hijos, que la llenan de orgullo. Ahora desea ampliar y crecer su negocio. Este es el préstamo número 04 que viene solicitando a la institución MFP, y con ello comprar teclados de computadoras, Mouse, cables de Internet y demás accesorios para las computadoras, pues nos comenta que por el uso continuo los actuales ya están malogrados.
texts.en:
Anita, who is 44 years old, is a driven, cheerful and very dynamic woman. She is married and lives in the home she owns with her husband, her parents, and her two children, who are going to college in order to build a better future for themselves. 

Anita works renting out Internet booths. She has six computers that have been properly installed and her business is very busy because she is the only one offering this type of services in the area. The business is located in a space she set up at home and has been open for six years. During this time she has managed to become very well-known. She has a part time helper who assists her, whom she pays a salary. He works in the afternoons because her daughter helps her in the mornings.

She considers her business to be profitable. It helps her supplement her household income and pay for her children's higher education, which fills her with pride. Now she wants to expand her business and grow. This is the fourth loan she requests from the MFP institution, and she will use it to purchase computer keyboards, mice, Internet cables, and other computer accessories. She tells us her current ones are damaged due to constant use.

loans.use: to purchase computer keyboards, mice, Internet cables, and other accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Al-Sosn Group

texts.en:
This group is called AL-Sosn which consists of three women and one man. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB.

Swsn is 30 years old, single, and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. She is a hairdresser whose customers are women. She has been talented from infancy to work in her field. She is also talented as a singer who sings in weddings. She is an industrious individual who has been working for fifteen years. Thanks to her efforts, she has acquired many customers. 

She is requesting a youth loan of 50,000 YER from AMB so that she can buy cosmetics for her business. She is grateful for the assistance she has received.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Al-Ala Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-ala and is made up of six women who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Jamila is 42 years old, married and has nine children. She started her business on a small scale of cloth selling five years ago. Over time, her income has increased and she is able to cover the cost of her children's expenses. She has to expand her business activities so she requested a loan of 50,000 YER to buy dresses, pants and blouses, etc.. This would enable her to earn large profits by catering to a large number of clients. She hopes to grow her children up good and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants and blouses, etc. for her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old and married with two children.

Susan works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more additional stocks of groceries and foodstuff to sell.

Susan has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Susan aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and foodstuff to sell.

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Petrona es viuda, con un núcleo familiar de 4 personas, ella y sus tres hijas, mayores de edad e independienteses originaria del departamento de Masaya, tiene la edad de 62 años,  es  comerciantes desde hace 20 años en la venta de Lotería nacional; Vende de forma ambulante en el sector de Masaya,  posee su propia clientela ya que también a raíz que fallecio su esposo  le dejo sus clientes, sale a vender de lunes a sábados, maneja su propio horario de trabajo, manifestando que ella siempre le ha gustado tener su dinero propio por lo que hasta cuando Dios le de vida siempre seguirá haciendo lo que a ella le gusta.

Doña Petrona actualmente solo una de sus hijas se quedo viviendo con ella, y desidio hacerle compañía para que no estuviera sola, conversa que quiere  realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda y que esta muy deteriorada y quiere hacerle unas remodelaciones.

Cabe mencionar que los sueños de ella es tener un mejor nivel de vida  para su familia, y tener un techo digno.
 Por lo que se presenta a nuestras oficinas Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo el cual pueda comprar los materiales necesarios para la remodelación de su casa.
texts.en:
Petrona is a widow and has a family of four, including herself and her three daughters, who are adults and live on their own. She is originally from the department of Masaya. She is 62 years old and has worked selling national lottery for twenty years. She does so as a street vendor in the Masaya area. She has regular customers, because when her husband passed away he left her his customers also. She goes out to work Monday through Saturday and sets her own schedule. She says she has always enjoyed making her own money, so she will keep doing what she enjoys for as long as God allows her. 

Currently only one of Petrona's daughters has come to live with her because she decided to keep her company so that she didn't have to live alone. She says she wants to make some improvements to her home, which is very deteriorated, and do some remodeling.

Her dream is for her family to have better living standards and to have a decent roof over their head. That is why she has come to our Ceprodel office, to request a loan so that she can buy the materials she needs to remodel her home.

loans.use: to purchase zinc and cement and pay for labor.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her blacksmith business.

Tita has been in this business for 30 years. She earns more income from buying and selling charcoal.

Tita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of three children, Consorcia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from running a beauty parlor.  Consorcia is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy meat, chicken, and other ingredients for her food vending business.

Consorcia has sustained her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, and other ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Nour Al-Din Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nour Al-Din and consists of three ladies and one man who live in Sana`a, Yemen.

Awatf, 28, is a married woman and has three children. She only studied through primary school. She would like to buy home appliances for her house, but doesn’t have enough money. She is therefore requesting a loan from AMB to help her cover the cost of purchasing electronics in order to improve her living conditions in the house. Taking this loan will offer a more comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy home appliances/electronics

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 41 years old, married, and has one child, who is in school. 

Milagros is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

Milagros has been raising pigs for three years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her work.

In the future, Milagros would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for the pigs.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal HATUNCHASKAS,la socia continua trabajando en el restaurante de un hotel como cajera,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su trabajo,la socia es una persona responsanble y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para pagar los estudios universitarios de su hija.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is a member of the Hatunchaskas Communal Bank. She keeps on working as a cashier in a hotel restaurant. She has been working as a cashier for a few years and things are going well thanks to the dedication she daily works with. Luz Marina is a responsible and persevering person, as though this activity she provides for her family.
She is requesting a loan to pay for her daughter’s university fees.
She is grateful for the loan she has received and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's university fees.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years. Mercidita earns more income from rice retailing.

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business. Mercidita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries and school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 43 years old and married with two children.

Vivian works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional grocery and food items to sell in her general store.

Vivian has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Vivian aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married, with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Helen is 37 years old and has two children in school.

Helen has a photography business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy film and other accessories to be used in photography.

Helen has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business to have her own block for a photo studio.

loans.use: to buy film and other accessories used in photography.

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Bebiana works hard to support her family.

She has a computer rentals business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Bebiana is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional unit for her computer rentals business.

Bebiana has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional unit for her computer rentals.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.ru:
Валентина замужем. У нее есть взрослый сын. Валентина имеет свой собственный бизнес.
Валентина занимается продажей обуви на протяжении 17 лет.  Она имеет несколько торговых точек на рынке. Валентина имеет большой ассортимент женской обуви, и всегда может расположить к себе клиента. Она трудолюбивая и ответственная. Валентина рассматривает идею о закупке новой обуви из Китая, но сомневается, так как переживает о качестве товара. Валентина заботится о своей семье и хочет увеличить доход. 
Валентина просит предоставить ей кредит в сумме 21000 гривен на закупку новой коллекции обуви к осенне-зимнему сезону.
texts.en: Valentina is married and has an adult son.  She has her own business.  Valentina has been involved in shoe sales for 17 years.  She has several retail outlets at a market.  Valentina has a wide selection of women's shoes and can always position herself favorably to a customer.  She is hardworking and responsible.  Valentina is reviewing an idea of buying new shoes from China, but has concerns about the quality of merchandise.  She cares about her family and wants to increase her income.  Valentina is requesting a loan in the amount of 21,000 hryvnia to purchase a new collection of shoes for the autumn-winter season.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of shoes for the autumn-winter season

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.ru: Руслана в разводе. У нее двое детей. Руслана занимается продажей нижнего белья, носков, детских колгот и т.д.  Прошлый кредит, который она взяла в киве, помог ей увеличить доход. Она просит дать ей кредит в сумме 4000 гривен на пополнение ассортимента и закупку нового товара к зиме.
texts.en: Ruslana is divorced and has two children.  She is involved in selling undergarments, socks, children's stockings, etc.  The last loan that she obtained from Kiva helped her to increase her income.  Ruslana is requesting a loan in the amount of 4000 hryvnia to refill her merchandise selection and purchase new goods for the winter.

loans.use: to refill her merchandise selection and purchase new goods for the winter

loans.name: Melba Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Melba, es originaria de Nindirí, municipio del departamento de Masaya,  su núcleo familiar compuesta por su esposo y sus tres hijos en edad escolar.

Ella vende tortilla desde la mañana durante todo el día  y tiene una pequeña pulpería a orilla de la calle el cual esta siempre cerca de su casa por lo que se puede hacer cargo de los dos negocios, tiene de experiencia en el ramo 4 años de comercializar su producto. 

Siente que su negocio han ido aumentando gracias al esfuerzo obtenido se siente satisfecha y quiere seguir luchando para darles una mejor condición de vida a su familia y poder dándoles la educación adecuada a sus hijos.

Se acerca a Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo que pueda comprar la mercadería tales como de Leña, maíz, arroz, azúcar, comal jabón extra salsa de tomate y cal para nesquisar el maíz. Y de esta manera seguir dando siempre lo mejor a sus clientes que le ayudara a tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Melba is originally from Nindirí, a town in the department of Masaya. Her family are her husband and their three school-age children. She sells tortillas all day from morning and has a small grocery store on the side of the street, which is always near her home, so she can manage both businesses. She has four years of experience selling her products. 

She feels that her business has been growing because of the effort she has put into it. She feels satisfied and wants to keep fighting for better living standards for her family and to give her children a proper education.

She has approached Ceprodel to request a loan so that she can purchase merchandise like firewood, corn, rice, sugar, pans, soap, tomato sauce, and lime to cook the corn with. This will allow her to continue giving her customers the very best, which will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, corn, rice, sugar, pans, soap, tomato sauce, and lime to cook the corn.

loans.name: Mercedes Ismael

texts.es: Mercedes de 25 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador y lleno de deseos de salir adelante. Él se dedica a la compra, crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, obteniendo a lo largo de los años mucha experiencia lo que le permite contar con varios clientes los cuales constantemente le compran las reces. Mercedes solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar una vaca, ya que recientemente vendió una con lo que pueda contar con la misma cantidad y que estas puedan multiplicarse. Esto le permite seguir incrementando su negocio y de esta forma percibir mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Mercedes is 25 years old. He is a very hard-working young man, full of desires to get ahead. He works buying, raising and selling cattle. Over the years, he has gained a lot of experience which has permitted him to attract numerous customers who regularly buy his cattle. Mercedes is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which he will use to buy a cow, since he recently sold one, and thus he can have the same quantity, and they can reproduce. This will permit him to keep expanding his business and thus achieve better earnings.

loans.use: to buy a cow for his business.

loans.name: Tomas Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Tomas tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 1 hija, es soltero. Reside en compañía de su hija en una comunidad del Municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortes.
Don Tomas tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la ebanistería, el fabrica muebles de cocina, camas, juegos de comedor, sillas mecedoras, y diversos productos de madera.
En la actualidad ha solicitado  un préstamo por la cantidad de 15,000 Lempiras los que piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima como ser madera, resortes, almohadilla o foam.
Él manifiesta que tomo el préstamo porque el capital con que cuenta es muy limitado, además espera que al aumentar la producción aumentaran sus ingresos.
Su mayor anhelo es que su hija logre graduarse de una carrera universitaria y piensa que con su negocio  y el apoyo financiero que recibe, lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Tomás, 52, has a daughter; he’s single.  He lives with his daughter in a community in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortes Department.  Tomás has been working as a cabinet maker for 20 years.  He manufactures kitchen cabinets, beds, dining room sets, rocking chairs and various other wood items.  He’s currently requesting a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy raw materials like lumber, springs and foam.

He states that he took out the loan because his capital is very limited and he hopes that by increasing income his income will also increase.  His greatest hope is that his daughter succeeds in graduating university and believes that with his business and with the financial support he gets she will do so.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like lumber, springs and foam.

loans.name: Airen

texts.en:
Airen works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fashion accessories business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year.

Airen requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more accessories to sell.

In the future, Airen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more accessories to sell.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling empty sacks in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell.

NWTF is presenting Florida's business profile again for funding of another loan in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de granos secos como papa, trigo, cebada entre otros, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de granos secos al por mayor.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the Caminemos Juntas (Let’s Walk Together) Communal Bank. She keeps on running her activity, selling dried grains such as potatoes, wheat and barley. She has been engaged in this activity for many years, and things are going well thanks to the daily dedication she works with. Georgina is a responsible and persevering person, as through this activity she provides for her family.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy dried grains at wholesale prices.
She is grateful for the loan she has received and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy dried grains at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Ines

texts.en:
Ines works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling copras (dried coconut meat) in the Philippines. Ines has been in this business for 29 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending. Ines requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more copras to sell.

In the future, Ines would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more copras (dried coconut meat) to sell.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Alejandra requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Alejandra has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough to secure the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Dalmecia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS, la socia continua con su negocio de venta de artesania, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja con semillas para elaborar lo que son collares y aretes para sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de eta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas al por mayor para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Dalmecia is a member of the Caminemos Juntas (Let’s Walk Together) Communal Bank. She keeps on running her activity, selling crafts. She has been engaged in this activity for many years, and things are going well thanks to the daily dedication she works with. She uses dried seeds to creates necklaces and earrings upon requests for her customers. Dalmecia is a responsible and persevering person, as through this activity she provides for her family.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy dried seeds for her crafts at wholesale prices.
She is grateful for the loan she has received and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To buy dried seeds at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Salvadora Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Salvadora Yolanda es dueña de una pulpería ubicada en la ciudad de León, abre su negocio a las 6 am el cual atiende con sus hijos para esperar a sus más fieles clientes y a sus proveedores, a pesar de ser una madre soltera de tres hijos dos de los cuales son menores de edad;  ha sacado a sus hijos adelante dándole estudios y una mejor calidad de vida. Realiza sus compras en uno de los mercados de la ciudad para comprar frutas, verduras y otros productos que ofrece en su negocio. 

La señora actualmente está solicitando un crédito, el cual invertirá directamente en la compra de granos básicos, gaseosas, jugos, caramelos, chiverías. Al obtener dicho crédito espera obtener mejores ganancias y  surtir su negocio de esta manera satisfacer la demanda de su clientela.

La señora Salvadora Yolanda  está muy agradecida con Ceprodel ya que le ha ayudado a crecer en su negocio y poder salir adelante con su familia brindándole una mejor educación y formación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Salvadora Yolanda owns a grocery store in the city of León.   She opens the store at 6am and with her children waits for her most regular customers and her suppliers.  Despite being a single mother of three minor children, she’s moved her children forward providing schooling and better quality of life for them.  She makes her purchases of fruit, vegetables and other products she stocks at one of the city’s markets.

She’s currently requesting a loan to buy basic grains, soft-drinks, juices, candy and snacks.  She hopes that by obtaining said loan she will earn higher profits and stock her store in a more satisfactory way to meet customer demand.

Salvadora Yolanda is very grateful to Ceprodel because it’s helped her to grow in her business and to be able to move forward with her family providing her children with better education and development.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer muy alegre, emprendedora y dinámica.  Es viuda desde hace ya varios años, y madrede 2 hijos. Vive en su casa propia con su hijo mayor, su nuera y su nieto, a quienes quiere mucho. El negocio que realiza Nelly es la venta de respuestos de motos y mototaxi, para esto tiene un espacio acondicionado en su propia casa, y ya tiene más de 25 años dedicado a ello, pues en un inicio lo incio su difunto esposo. Hoy cuenta con el apoyo de su hijo y su nuera para la atención al público, además de un ayudante para los trabajos pesados de carga como cajas, herramientas y motores. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable y eso le da opción de cumplir con los gastos de su casa, y además le ha permitido pagar los estudios de sus demás hijos, quien uno es independientes.  Tiene planes de seguir incrementado y ampliar su negocio, por ello solicita ahora su crédito número 03 a la institución MFP, para comprar repuestos de motos y mototxi al por mayor, así, mayor cantidad a menor costo, para tener mayor margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Nelly, 60, is a cheerful, enterprising and dynamic woman.  She’s been widowed for several years now and is the mother of two children.  She lives in her own house with her oldest son, her daughter-in-law and her grandson who she loves very much.  

Nelly’s business is selling spare parts for motorcycles and mototaxis.  To do so, she’s set aside space at home and has been in business more than 25 years; the business was started by her late husband.  Today, her son and daughter-in-law help her to take care of the public.  She also has a hired helper for the heavy lifting of crates, tools and motors.  She considers her business to be quite profitable and this allows her to cover household expenses and also has made it possible for her to provide schooling for her other children one of which is independent.  

She plans to continue expanding and enlarging the business which is why she’s requesting her third MFP loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles and mototaxis at wholesale in larger amounts and at lower cost to increase her profit margin that way.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for motorcycles and mototaxis.

loans.name: Bill

texts.es:
Bill, de 29 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor y muy entusiasta. Es soltero, sin  hijos, vive en casa de sus padres a lado de ellos y de sus 03 hermanos menores. El trabajo que realiza Bill es la elaboración de pan de la mejor calidad, siendo su espacio de trabajo, en la casa de sus padres, donde tiene los implementos necesarios como un horno moderno rotativo, amasadora y demás utensilios.  Lleva en ésta actividad más de 02 años, tiempo en el cual ha logrado ganarse de clientela  y esto es debido al buen sabor de sus panes. Pero él no esta solo en esta labor, pues cuenta con el apoyo de un maestro panadero y dos ayudantes para la elaboración de los panes,   así como en el reparto para las bodegas  de la zona.
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene,  y eso le motiva a superarse más para convertirse en un empresario emprendedor, dar trabajo a otras personas y así ayudar con el desarrollo de su localidad; comenta además, que tiene otras ideas de negocio como abrir una heladería (hechos con sabores de frutas de la región) ya que el clima de la región es favorable.  
Por todo ello, se siente contento y agradecido con la institución por el préstamo otorgado ya que le permitió invertir y  crecer en su negocio. En esta ocasión, solicitará su tercer crédito a MFP, para continuar ejerciendo su negocio. Además se siente contento con el apoyo de su grupo comunal, y por ello se compromete en  ser puntual en sus pagos para así poder acceder a futuro otros créditos de mayor cantidad.
Con el monto de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará insumos para la elaboración de pan, como: harina por saco, mantequilla, azúcar y manteca, levadura, entre otros,  así podrá disminuir costos y mejorar sus márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Bill is 29 years old.  He is a young and very enthusiastic entrepreneur.  He is single, with no children, and lives in a house owned by his parents next door to them and his three minor siblings.  

Bill makes a living making bread of the best quality.  He uses space in his parents' home for his work.  There, he has access to the tools he needs, such as a modern, rotating oven; a kneader; and other utensils.  

He as been involved in this business for more than two years, during which time he as been successful at building his clientele due to the good taste of his breads.  He does not work alone.  He counts on support from a master baker and two assistants in making the bread, as well as the distribution of the bread to stores in the area.  

He considers his business to be profitable due to high demand.  This motivates him to get ahead even more and become an enterprising businessman who will provide work to other people and as a result help in the development of his region.  He mentioned that he has other ideas for businesses, such as an ice cream shop (made of local fruits from his region), since the climate where he lives favors that type of business.

He feels content and grateful to the organization for the loans previously granted, as they have allowed him to invest in and grow his business.  Currently, he is asking for his third loan with MFP to continue running his business.  He also feels content with the support of his communal group, and for that he promises to be punctual in his payments so that he can have access to other loans of higher value in the future.

With the amount of 1000 nuevos soles he will buy ingredients, such as bags of flour, butter, sugar, lard, yeast and other items, for making bread.  By buying in bulk, he can minimize his costs and increase his margins.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, butter, sugar, lard and yeast.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS, él socio Roselio continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva años dedicándose a este trabaja el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
EL socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Roselio is a member of the Caminemos Juntas (Let’s Walk Together) Communal Bank. He keeps on working as a taxi driver. He has been engaged in this activity for many years, and things are going well thanks to the daily dedication he works with. Roselio is a responsible and persevering person, as through this activity he provides for his family.
The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for the maintenance works on his car such as changing oil.
He is grateful for the loan he has received and he commits to complying with the repayments of his dues according to schedule.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance works on his vehicle.

loans.name: Francisco Armando

texts.es: Francisco de 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Francisco es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador que desea darle lo mejor a su familia. Él posee una parcela en la que se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, la cual posteriormente comercializa en diferentes departamentos del país, obteniendo muy buenas ganancias. Él desea aumentar su cosecha razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda comprar pesticidas, abono, arados y semillas de frijol y maíz de la mejor calidad para sembrar y así obtener una excelente cosecha. El deseo de Francisco  es mejorar en gran manera  su negocio, garantizando la calidad de su semilla, lo que le permita mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en: Francisco, 41 years old, lives with his spouse and two minor children.  Francisco is a very responsible and hard working father who wants the best for his family.  He has a parcel of land where he grows corn and beans, which he later sells in the different departments of the country making a very good profit. He is wanting to increase his crop production and for this reason is requesting a loan from Integral which will allow him to buy pesticides, fertilizer, plows, and best quality seeds for beans and corn to plant and this way get an excellent harvest.  Francisco wishes to make great improvements to his business, guaranteeing the quality of his seeds, which will help him improve his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase corn for planting.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, está casado tiene un hijo de dos años con su esposa, él se dedica a la reparación de motocicletas, aprendió este oficio siendo empleado de un taller de reparaciones y hoy en día lo realiza independientemente como una fuente de empleo de su propio hogar.

El quiere invertir en el negocio por eso solicita un préstamo que le permita los recursos económicos para comprarse herramientas que son necesarias para poder reparar las motocicletas, comprandose llaves de diferentes clases, también comprará cadenas, escapes, pedales, y otros que son para la reparación y mejora de las motocicletas, esto será una gran ayuda mejorando así el negocio.

El objetivo de Juan es poder mejorar el negocio a través de la ayuda de los préstamos, realizar una buena inversión ya que con ello podrá también asegurar los ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Juan is married and he and his wife have a two-year-old son.  He repairs motorcycles, an occupation he learned while employed in a repair shop.  Today, he works independently and it’s his source of income for his home.  He wants to invest in the business and this is why he’s asking for a loan that will make it possible for him to have the economic resources to buy what he needs to repair motorcycles.  He will buy different kinds of wrenches and also will buy chains, exhaust pipes, pedals and others needed to repair and improve motorcycles.  This will be a great help to improve the business.  Juan’s objective is to be able to improve the business by means of the loans and to make a good investment so that he can also insure his family’s income.

loans.use: to buy wrenches, chains, exhaust pipes and pedals.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de estado civil soltera, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Martha  cuenta que desde que su mama empezó a vender frutas ella le ayudaba, y ella me daba dinero por ayudarla. Hasta que en el pasar del tiempo se compre una carreta en la cual trabaja actualmente trabaja. su sueño es tener un local para vender mis frutas. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar melón, naranja, guineo, huevos etc.
texts.en: Martha’s single and has two adult children.  Martha relates that ever since her mother started selling fruit she’d help her and her mother would give her money for helping her.  In time, she bought a cart that she still works with to date.  Her dream is to have a locale in which to sell more fruit.  She wants to use the loan to buy melons, oranges, bananas, eggs, etc.

loans.use: to buy melons, oranges, bananas, eggs. etc.

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Juan Francisco de 57 años de edad, es un padre de familia admirable que trabaja muy duro para sacar adelante a 4 hijos y su esposa. Juan reside en una zona rural donde la agricultura es la principal actividad económica. Él siembra frijoles y maíz, dos de los granos más vendidos en este país por ser parte de la dieta principal. Este es el negocio que le permite sostener a su familia, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de frijoles y maíz para sembrar, con esto Juan espera sembrar  más y poder percibir más ganancias que años anteriores, así también desea comprar abono, pesticidas, sacos y otros más.
texts.en:
Juan Francisco is 57 years old. He is an admirable family man who works hard to provide for his four children and his wife. Juan resides in a rural area where farming is the main economic activity. He grows beans and corn, two of the best selling grains in the country, since they are part of the basic diet. 

This business allows him to support his family, which is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL. He wants to have enough money to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of beans and corn to grow. Juan hopes to grow more grains so that he can obtain higher profits than previous years and also wants to buy fertilizer, pesticides, sacks, and other supplies.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains to plant.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis, es comerciante de ropa y calzado el vive con su esposa y tres hijos menores de edad, el negocio lo inició hace más de un año trabajando junto con su esposa, tiene un puesto en el mercado y además comercializan de forma ambulante.

El está solicitando un préstamo para poderlo invertir en mercadería para aumentar la variedad en el negocio aprovechando que se avecina una temporada donde aumenta la demanda de los clientes, se comprará blusas, faldas, pantalones, esperando tener aceptación de los clientes. Este préstamo será una gran ayuda para ensanchar al negocio mayor mercadería.

Sus sueños es mejorar la condición de vida y asegurar un mejor futuro,a sus hijos darles una buena educación y la atención en la salud, en su negocio desea sostenerlo un buen nivel, tener un puesto más vistoso en variedad de productos y mejorar el local.
texts.en:
Luis is a clothes and shoes merchant.  He lives with his wife and three minor children.  He started the business more than a year ago and works with his wife.  He has a stand in the market and also sells from place to place.

He is requesting a loan to buy merchandise to increase the variety in the business taking advantage of the approach of a season when customer demand increases.  He will buy blouses, skirts and pants hoping they’ll be well-received by the customers.  This loan will be a great help for him to expand the business with more merchandise.

His dreams are to improve living conditions and insure a better future for his children, to give them a good education and see to their good health.  He wants to maintain a good level of business and to have a more eye-catching stand with a variety of products and to make improvements to his locale.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts and pants.

loans.name: Jose Wilfredo

texts.es: José de 24 años de edad, es soltero y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y triunfar en la vida. Él se ha dedicado gran parte de su corta vida al cultivo maíz, la cual es una de las actividades más usuales en la zona rural del país. José  junto a su padre y sus hermanos se dedica a realizar este trabajo en una parcela que él alquila para realizar este trabajo. José solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de maíz para poder hacer crecer la siembra de su parcela y poder cosechar más granos básicos. Con el aumento de las ventas José tiene la esperanza que podrá contar con una vida mejor y también estudiar para tener un futuro prometedor.
texts.en: José, 24, is single and very much wants to get ahead and succeed in life.  He’s spent most of his short life growing corn, one of the most common activities in the rural part of the country.  José alongside his father and brothers does this work on land he leases.  José is asking for a loan in order to have the money he needs to buy larger amounts of corn to increase his crop yields and harvest more grain.  With the increase in sales, José hopes that he will be able to have a better life as well as to study so that he can have a more promising future.

loans.use: to buy seeds to sell.

loans.name: Yo Progreso Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Yo Progreso” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; artesanía, venta de ropa interior, venta de ropa nueva y usada, feriantes, repostería, verdulería, vendedores ambulantes, venta de utensilios de cocina, venta de ensaladas. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Angol.
Carmen, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una polera de color negra con letras blancas y un poleron negro con franja de color rojo, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa tomado y se ve acompañada de su hijo pequeño.
Ella se dedica al rubro de arreglos computacionales, desde hace 8 años. Comenta que trabaja con su marido, realizan trabajos a domicilio, y otras veces trabajan desde la casa. Se especializan en arreglar teclados, mouse, pantalla, información del disco duro, agregar programas y limpieza de computadores.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los  compra en locales, tiendas y distribuidoras de computación a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará un disco duro, contratar internet (para bajar programas), hacer publicidad para su negocio.
Una de las metas de Carmen es poder tener un local propio donde pueda atender con más tranquilidad a su clientela, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida, y poder darle a sus hijos una buena estabilidad económica.
Carmen vive junto a su marido quienes trabajan en conjunto, y dos hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal es estudiar alguna carrera y que su marido se perfeccione en el área de informática.
Ella esta muy contenta y agradecida de  la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio. Comenta que las capacitaciones han sido fundamentales para su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir d mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones. Respecto a l grupo del Banco Comunal cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación.
Angol se ubica a 128 km. al noroeste de Temuco (capital de la novena región) y a 608 km. al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). Su nombre significa en mapudungun (lengua del pueblo mapuche) “subida a gatas”. Sus habitantes se dedican fuertemente a labores agrícolas y silvo agropecuarias, áreas en las que actualmente han adquirido relevancia, particularmente, aquellas vinculadas a la producción frutícola y hortícola.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Yo Progreso" (I Progress), and is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who are engaged in various businesses, among which are: crafts, selling undergarments, selling new and used clothing, trading, confectioner, greengrocer, street vendors, selling cookware, selling salads. They are all from the city of Angol.

Carmen is a member of the group seen in the photo (second from the left in the first row), dressed in a dark colored shirt with white letters and a black hoodie with a red stripe with dark brown hair and seen here accompanied by her young son. She has worked in computer repairs for the last 8 years. She works with her husband; they do work in people's homes and sometimes work from home. They specialize in fixing keyboards, mouses, screens, hard drive information, adding programs and computer cleaning. They buy the goods and supplies they need from local shops and computer distributors at a low cost, which is economically advantageous.

With the loan she will buy a hard drive, get internet service (to download programs), and advertise the business. One of Carmen's goals is to have her own shop where she can attend to her clients more calmly, and this way opt for a better quality of life and be able to give her children economic stability.

Carmen lives with her husband (with whom she works) and their two children, ages 8 and 4. Her dreams are to pursue a course of study and that her husband improve in the computer field. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity she has been awarded by Fondo Esperanza, as it will let her invest in her business. She says that the training has been critical for her business as well as for her personal development, as she has learned to organize and distribute her supplies and investments in a better way. With regard to the communal bank of which she is a member, she says that they have very good communication. 

Angol is located 128 km. northwest of Temuco (capital of the ninth region) and 608 km. south of Santiago (capital of Chile). Its name means in Mapudungun (Mapuche language) "crawling upwards." The people work hard in agriculture and agricultural goods, areas that have now become important, particularly those related to fruit and vegetable production.

loans.use: to buy a hard drive, get internet service (to download programs), and advertise the business.

loans.name: Nueva Vida Group

texts.es:
El comité “Nueva Vida” se encuentra en el Décimo Sexto Ciclo con  25 integrantes. Cada una cuenta que gracias a la ayuda de su grupo y también a las capacitaciones que reciben están saliendo adelante y ayudan a sus Familias.
La Sra. Elida es la presidenta, y cuenta que ella contacto con sus amigas y vecinas para formar el comité. Ella tiene 6 hijos,  y es por ellos que día a día se sacrifica. Vende comidas y solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Vida” (New Life) Committee is currently working its sixteenth cycle and it is composed of 25 members. Every members says that thanks to their group’s help and to the seminars they receive they are succeeding in getting ahead in life and in helping their families.
Elida is the president of the group and she says that she has contacted her friends and neighbors in order to form the Committee. She has 6 children and it is for them she daily sacrifices herself. She sells meals and she is requesting a loan to buy meat, vegetables, dressings and other ingredients to keep on preparing the meals she sells.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables and dressings.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, quien se dedica al oficio de la agricultura de maíz, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo e hijos, para poder obtener algunas ganancias extras, Cristina también posee una tienda de productos perecederos y un molino, ambos negocios ubicados en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de comprar productos comestibles, de uso del hogar, detergentes y otros más para surtir la tienda, también fertilizante para las semillas y así producir mayor calidad en sus productos y de esta forma contar con más clientes, lo que es muy importante para ella ya que de esta manera aumentara sus ingresos.
texts.en: Cristina is a very responsible and hard working mother who works at growing corn.  She does this together with her husband and children.  To obtain additional income, Cristina also has a store where she sells perishable goods and a mill, both businesses are located at her home.  She is requesting a loan from Integral to purchase edible goods, household goods, detergents and others to supply her store.  She will also buy fertilizers for her seeds and this way be able to produce a better quality product and count on more customers.  This is very important to her because in this way she can increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and merchandise.

loans.name: Cristhian Ulises

texts.es: Cristhian de 25 años de edad, es un hombre muy responsable que cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales, lo que es de  mucho beneficio para él porque más personas buscan sus productos. Cristhian trabaja sembrando maíz y frijoles y también cría ganado vacuno, los cuales posteriormente comercializa. Él solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, principalmente para comprar una vaca y de este modo junto a las que ya tiene iniciar con el negocio de productos lácteos, también para invertir en la compra de más semillas para sembrar, pesticidas, abono y otros instrumentos más que sean de mucha ayuda para la actividad que realiza, y de este modo mejorar en su negocio e ir avanzando más y más.
texts.en: Cristhian, 25, is a very responsible man who has very good personal references. This benefits him greatly because more people seek out his products. Cristhian works sowing corn and beans, and he also raises cows, which he later sells. He is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL, mainly to buy a cow and with this cow, along with the ones he already has, he will start a dairy products business. He will also invest in more seeds to plant, pesticides, fertilizer, and other tools that are helpful for his work. This way he will improve his business and advance farther and father.

loans.use: to buy a cow and farming supplies.

loans.name: Médessè Eugénie

texts.fr: Médessè Eugénie est âgée de 41 ans et vit au Bénin. Médessè Eugénie est mariée à un enseignant du nom de Enock. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Médessè Eugénie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Médessè Eugénie mène comme activité depuis une dizaine d’année, la vente de divers articles (fournitures scolaires) et des boissons à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Médessè Eugénie vend de l’huile végétale. Médessè Eugénie s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Médessè Eugénie sollicite pour la sixième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
