As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Prickta owns the following: 'cow, poultry, pump' but does not own 'pig, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, sewing machine' but does not have 'electricity, running water, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: buy poultry birds

loans.name: Jovenes Exitosos Group

texts.es: ¡Saludos desde Perú!  El grupo Jóvenes Exitosos está conformado por 07 personas, en su mayoría varones todos  dedicados a diversos oficios; su única integrante mujer es Johanna que es la secretaria del grupo. Ella tiene 23 años es madre soltera con un hija pequeña, el trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, empezó este trabajo con la ayuda de su madre  que se dedica a lo mismo, son cerca de 2 años que trabaja con este negocio, ofreciendo diferentes productos a sus clientas; que en su mayoría amigas de su barrio y familiares. Por otro lado su trabajo es de mucha ayuda para ella porque así puede solventar sus gastos  de su hija. Con el fin de seguir mejorando su negocio ha solicitado a EDAPROSPO un nuevo préstamo que le servirá para la compra de productos como perfumes, lociones, joyería y maquillaje, en el futuro desea contar con un lugar propio donde pueda vender sus productos directamente. Johanna esta agradecida a los inversionistas KIVA que la apoyan tanto a ella como a los integrantes de su grupo.
texts.en:
Greetings from Perú! The group Jóvenes Exitosos (Successful Young People) is made up of 7 people, the majority men, all working at various jobs; its only woman member is Johanna, who is the secretary of the group. She is 23 years old and is a single mother with a small daughter; she works selling beauty products by catalog. She began this work with the help of her mother who does the same work. She has been working with this business for around 2 years, offering different products to her customers, of whom the majority are friends from her neighborhood and relatives. On the other hand, her work is of great help to her because in this way she can pay for her daughter’s expenses. 

With the aim of continuing to improve her business, she has requested a loan from EDAPROSPO, which she will use for the purchase of products like perfumes, lotions, jewelry and makeup. In the future, she hopes to have her own place where she can sell her products directly. Johanna is grateful to the KIVA investors who support her as well as the members of her group.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Kihiuhi

texts.en:
Kihiuhi lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley.  His primary income sources are tea, crops, and providing transportation services.  He has 1 child and has been doing this work for 19 years.  

Kihiuhi stated what is most enjoyable about farming is that he enjoys growing cabbages because they don't require much capital and the returns are high.  His biggest challenge is lack of water for irrigation.  He will use the loan to buy a water tank.

Kihiuhi was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'He has seen many people who have gotten financial assistance from Juhudi Kilimo.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Microfinance loans are for development.'

His highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Kihiuhi replied 'He will be able to pay school fees for his child and provide for his needs. His wife died 7 years ago and he is the only provider.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Kihiuhi owns the following: 'cow, bicycle, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, poultry, pump, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, solar power, TV, DVD' but does not have 'electricity, running water, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in the Muranga area of Kenya, which lies in the central Rift Valley.  His primary income sources are tea, crops, providing transportation services, and a personal business.  He has 2 children and has been doing this work for 3 years.  He will use this loan to buy piglets.  

Paul stated what is most enjoyable about farming is that farming is a form of self-employment. He enjoys it because he is the boss on his farm.  His biggest challenge is wen diseases attack his crops, which affect production and returns.  

Paul was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied: 'Favourable loan terms i.e fair interest rate and good repayment duration.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Microfinance helps me to grow with the loans advanced.'

His highest monthly expense is family expenses. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Paul replied 'Higher income from the project will enable him to improve the family's living standard.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Paul owns the following: 'pig, automobile' but does not own 'cow, poultry, pump, bicycle, motorcycle'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, electricity, running water, TV, DVD' but does not have 'solar power, sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: buy piglets

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has 5 children and has been doing this work for 14 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, transportation services, and a personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming is: she loves her cows very much and seeing them makes her happy.  Her biggest challenge is high drug prices, more so when the animals are sick.  The animals on the farm have been given the names of Sofia and Maritat.    She will use the loan to buy and insure a dairy cow.

Salome was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Heard from another existing client.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Learnt about co existence with other members, leadership and loan management.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Salome replied 'By acquiring another cow she will be able to increase her asset base also the family income will go up.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Salome owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle, motorcycle' but does not own 'pig, pump, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is 44 years old.  He is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead. He has a house where he lives with his nine children in Ibb, Yemen. His educational background includes a diploma. He is a teacher who strives to be a professional in his field. He applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy construction supplies for his house.

loans.use: buy construction supplies for his house

loans.name: Kmal

texts.en: Kmal is 26 years old and is from Ibb, Yemen.  He is married and has two children. He has a bus  which he wishes to improve for his family's pleasant life. He has been running his bus for two years. He bought it with support from his father.  Kmal is asking for a youth loan of 100000 YER to buy spare parts for his bus.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his bus

loans.name: Jepkosgei

texts.en: Jepkosgei lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. Her primary income sources are milk, crops and a job salary. She has five children and has been doing her work for 10 years. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, Jepkosgei says she loves animals and she enjoys feeding them. When asked what is her biggest challenge, she says, "Feeding the animals can be hectic sometimes." The animals on the farm have been given the names Sambu and Kendo Goch. Jepkosgei was asked how she learned of Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "from another client". This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She says she learnt more about farming as a business. She will use this loan to construct a modern dairy unit for her dairy cows and buy poultry birds as well. Her highest monthly expense is business-related. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?", Jepkosgei replied that she will be able to get more income; thus, take her children to school. Also she will be able to feed her children well. As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jepkosgei owns the following: cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, electricity, TV and DVD, but does not have solar power, running water or a sewing machine. ====================================== Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository; thus, reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a dairy unit and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es: Pedro  Antonio de cuarenta y seis años de edad vive junto a su familia, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene mas de veinte años de trabajar en  la agricultura y eso le ha regalado una amplia experiencia en el rubro que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola, todo lo que produce lo comercia en los alrededores de la localidad y ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el excelente servicio; Pedro es un hombre emprendedor, dedicado a su labor, y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre esta buscando las mejores alternativas que le abran camino al éxito, en esta temporada de siembra aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para una nueva inversión, por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un credito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Pedro tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez confía que le dara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Pedro Antonio is forty-six and lives with his family.  He makes a living growing corn and beans.  He has worked in agriculture for more than twenty years, and this has given him broad experience in the trade that lets him obtain the best harvests.  His farmland is located in an area of large agricultural impact.  He sells everything he produces around the area, and he already has a lot of customers that prefer him for the quality of his crops, his good prices, and above all, his excellent service.  He is an enterprising man who is dedicated to his work and with many desires of getting ahead.  He is always looking for the best alternatives that will open up the road to success.  In this planting season, demand has risen, and he wants to make the most of this by making a new investment.  This is why is is requesting a credit from Integral that will let him buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.  Pedro has good credit references and impeccable morals.  He is sure that he will be able to pay back the debt, and he is confident that he will give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn and bean seeds, insecticide, and herbicide.

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en: Riyad is a 50-year-old married man from Baqa'a, Jordan, who has four family members. He is requesting a loan of 600 Jordan dinar (JD) to pay for his home improvements; he would like to do maintenance of the bathroom and to buy some household items. He hopes in the future to add another floor and also to create a comfortable space for his family.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Halima's Group

texts.en: This group, called Al-Taisir, consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They took out a loan of 190,000 Yemeni rials (YER). Nouria is a 24-year-old married woman who has four children. They live together in Sana'a, Yemen. She has been operating a general store for two years. She sells a variety of basic household products. She has managed to position her business in the market. She has a good reputation and is very accessible. It is a well established business and many people come to it, because they always find what they are looking for. Nouria has made the decision to invest in her business so that she can keep it well stocked and attract more customers. This will allow her to increase her sales levels and her income; thereby, enabling her to enjoy better living conditions. She has decided to request a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to invest in her business by buying products such as rice, sugar, beans, corn, soap, oil, paper, eggs, salt and other products for her business. She hopes to build a house.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans, corn, soap, oil, paper, eggs, salt, and other products for her business.

loans.name: Sefulu

texts.en:
Sefulu  is 28 years old and married with 3 children. She makes and sells weaving mats, elei lavalava, weaving hats, and weaving fans to earn a living.  She has been doing this for 1 year.

Sefulu has requested a loan to buy weaving pandanus, paints, painting brush, design board, and roller design. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy supplies for her weaving business

loans.name: Faamu

texts.en: Faamu is 22 years old and married with 22 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy sugar, cordials, flavors, plastic bags, and a freezer.  In the future, Faamu hopes to improve her business to help her family and her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make cakes for sale

loans.name: Matila

texts.en: Matila  is 24 years old and married with 3 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling weaving mats, weaving hats, weaving fans, and fine mats in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy pandanus, paints, feathers, and painting brushes. In the future, Matila hopes to improve her business to help her family matters and her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy weaving supplies

loans.name: Hijar

texts.en: Hijar is a 52-year-old married woman from Nao'or, Jordan, who has one family member. She is requesting a loan of 700 Jordan dinar (JD) to pay for materials for sewing, such as fabric, beads and silk, to resell. She would like to develop her project. In the future, she wants to expand her project by increasing the number of sewing machines to increase her family income.

loans.use: to pay for materials for sewing.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en: Nizar is a 41-year-old married man from Nao'or, Jordan, who has six family members. He is requesting a loan of 800 Jordan dinar (JOD) to pay for his home improvements; he would like to buy new furniture and do maintenance of the home. In the future, he hopes to improve his living standard and to buy another furniture piece.

loans.use: to pay for his home improvements.

loans.name: Faaoo

texts.en: Faaoo is 34 years old and married with 2 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork cakes, German buns, and biscuits in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy a gas oven, flour, oil, sugar, large tin bowls, yeast, baking pans, and a large cooking pot. In the future, Faaoo hopes to improve her business to help her family matters and her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy ingredients and supplies to make food for sale

loans.name: Faleulu

texts.en: Faleulu  is 38 years old and married with 3 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling Chinese cakes, donuts, and biscuits in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, oil, baking pans, yeast, baking racks, and a large cooking pot. In the future, Faleulu hopes to extend and improve and her business to help her family matters and her kids' education. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Taulau

texts.en: Taulau is a 48-year-old married woman with 2 childrens. She would like to start growing bananas and taro to earn a living. Taulau has requested a loan to buy a plant sprayer, chemicals, and bush knives. She has been a member of SPBD for 1 years. Taulau will spend her profits to improve her business.

loans.use: buy a sprayer, chemicals, and bush knives for farming

loans.name: Nuevos Frutos Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Nuevos Frutos” está conformado por 17 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; tejidos, pedicuro, invernadero, mecánico, venta de ropa, bazar, internet, venta de buzos, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Ana, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra  de pie en primera fila, ocupando el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta de color negra, y en su cuello lleva una bufanda de color claro, su cabello es de color castaño, lo usa corto y suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de artesania en tejido a crochet (Es el arte de crear mediante el entrelazado repetido de una o varias fibras con una aguja con forma de garfio), desde hace 10 años. Comenta que además de realizar los tejidos, también vende pizzas, para la venta de pizza se dedica desde los jueves hasta el domingo, y el resto de la semana a sus tejidos, ambos rubros los realiza en su casa, y su horario lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra algunas veces en la ciudad de Santiago y en locales de ventas de lanas, y para la preparación de sus pizzas en supermercados a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará un regulador de gas, galón de gas, queso, harina, aceitunas, masas, aceite, cajas para pizza y lanas de diferentes colores.
Una de las metas de Ana es tener un local para colocar una pizzería en paralelo con los tejidos a crochet y asociarse con su hermana y sobrina, asi generar mayores ingresos y optar por una mejor calidad de vida.
Ana vive junto a su esposo, su madre y tres hijos de 8 y 7(gemelos)años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal y familiar es tener su casa propia para darles un buen pasar a sus hijos, y a nivel laboral crecer como microempresaria.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades e intereses. Respecto a las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones, ha aprendido administrar su negocio de mejor manera.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Nuevos Frutos" (New Fruits). It is composed of 17 entrepreneurs who work in different areas, among which are weaving, pedicures, greenhouse, mechanic, clothing sales, bazaar, internet , selling coveralls, and services, among others. All of them are from the city of Talca.

Ana, a member of this communal bank group, is standing in the first row of the photo, in the third place going from left to right. She is wearing a black jacket and a light-colored scarf. Her hair is brown, short, and loose. She has been working in handicrafts and has been crocheting (this is the art of creating through repeated interlacing of one or various fibers, using a needle with the form of a hook) for 10 years. She comments that in addition to doing crocheting, she also sells pizzas. She works from Thursday through Sunday selling pizza, and the rest of the week she works at her crocheting. She does all her work at home, and she distributes her work schedule according to her availability.

Sometimes she buys the merchandise and supplies that she needs in the city of Santiago and in places where they sell wool, and for preparing her pizzas, she buys in low-cost supermarkets, which are therefore economically convenient. With the loan she will buy a gas regulator, a gallon of gas, cheese, flour, olives, dough, oil, pizza boxes, and wool of different colors. 

One of Ana's goals is to have a place to set up a pizzeria in parallel with her crocheting and to join up with her sister and her niece, to thus generate greater income and opt for a better quality of life. 

Ana lives with her husband, her mother, and her three children, ages 8 and 7 (twins). Her dreams at a personal and family level are to have her own house and give a good standard of living to her children, and at a business level, to grow as a microentrepreneur.

She is very happy and thankful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her, since it has allowed her to invest in her business. In addition, she feels very comfortable in the company of the other entrepreneurs in her communal bank group, since they share various activities and interests. From the training offered at the meetings, she has learned to manage her business better.

Talca belongs to the Maule region, located in the central part of the country. It is an administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region, being the most important city of the Chilean Central Valley. With regard to Talca, there is a curious reference in Chile, the phrase "Talca, Paris, and London." Among the myths regarding the phrase, some say that it is derived from the original saying by an Englishman, "Talca parece Londres" (Talca resembles London), because of the abundant clouds that frequently cover the city in the winter season, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy a gas regulator, a gallon of gas, cheese, flour, olives, dough, oil, pizza boxes, and wool of different colors.

loans.name: Lesina

texts.en:
Lesina is a 41-year-old married woman with 7 children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Lesina has requested a loan to to buy fabric materials and a sewing machine. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to maintain her business. She joined SPBD in July 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: buy fabrics, a sewing machine, threads, needles, etc.

loans.name: Siolovalu

texts.en: Siolovalu is a 25-year-old married woman with 3 children. She runs a business selling a variety of food in her community. She has many years of experience with this business.  Siolovalu has requested a loan to to buy a variety of food to be able to sell in her community. She plans to use her profits to improve her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anoanoai

texts.en: Anoanoai is a 47-year-old married woman with 4 children. She would like to start growing bananas and taro to earn a living. Anoanoai has requested a loan to buy a plant sprayer, chemicals, and bush knives. She has been a member of SPBD for 1 years.  Anoanoai will spend her profits to improve her business.

loans.use: buy weed killer, a sprayer, chemicals, and bush knives

loans.name: Iulai

texts.en: Iulai is 57 years old and married with 5 children. She runs a small business selling German buns in her community and has been doing this for 3 years. Iulai has requested a loan to buy more flour, sugar, coconuts and an oven. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Iulai will help out with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, coconuts, and an oven

loans.name: Naiem

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada has been operating a successful wedding dress rental business since 2002. Her gowns are beautiful and fiancees frequently inquire about renting after seeing a dress at a wedding. She hopes to partner with a seamstress in the near future to begin tailoring and selling gowns. 

Nada has requested this housing loan to furnish her apartment, where she lives alone. She plans to use the amount to install curtains and to replace the old mattress on her bed. These repairs will allow her to rest more comfortably. Curtains are an important status symbol as well, and she will be able to entertain guests and make connections with greater confidence.

loans.use: furnish her home with curtains and bedding

Since Samar is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en: Due to cultural reasons, Basma prefers that her photo is not on the Internet; thus the above photo is of her husband. Basma is a 50-year-old married woman who has seven family members from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 1,500 Jordan dinar (JD) to help her son to buy supplies for his marriage. She would like to buy for her son furniture and some household items. She hopes in the future to benefit from another loan.

loans.use: to help her son to buy supplies for his marriage.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Murang'a area of Kenya, which produces and exports coffee. His primary source of income comes from his personal farming business where he produces eggs, tea and other crops. He has four children and has been doing this work for 23 years. What he enjoys most about farming is growing kale, maize, peas, flowers and tea. His biggest challenge is not having enough seeds and fertilizer for planting season. 

With this loan he wants to buy his first dairy cow. Joseph chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan in order to get financial assistance to help him expand his farming. During Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, Joseph said that he learned that microfinance can help a farmer buy an asset that will help expand his farming. Joseph believes that the loan will benefit his family because it will give him a means to provide for his family's needs. His highest monthly expense is school fees.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Joseph owns poultry and a bicycle, but does not own a cow, pig, pump, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards that may come from a loan. This borrower has running water in his home, but does not have a mosquito net, electricity, solar power, a sewing machine, TV, or DVD player.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow
